author: {'steamid': '76561198253860814', 'num_games_owned': 262, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 17450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2655, 'last_played': 1693078026}
review: Всегда считал спортивные игры пустой тратой времени, поэтому на Football T&G, по всей видимости, вряд ли бы набрёл, если бы недавно не увидел стрим на канале Халецкого, где он показывал этот "пошаговый футбол". Сперва конечно было ощущение что это очередной инди-казуал вроде настольного футбола, но попробовать захотелось, поэтому взял, купил и... спустя 40 часов проведённые в игре за прошедший месяц, могу сказать, что точно не пожалел! 😃 Игрушка увлекает лёгкостью в освоении и необходимостью нешуточно поскрипеть мозгом для того чтобы добиться в ней серьёзных результатов. Каждый матч это настоящая пошаговая битва, где грамотная расстановка пары игроков порой поможет сокрушить даже намного более сильного противника, ударив в его слабое место. А его величество рандом способен как провести твоего оборванца нападающего с единственным обводным финтом через двух защитников и вратаря, так и неожиданно бросить твоему центральному защитнику из его солидных 75 баллов защиты жалкие 10, проведя вражеского нападающего с пушечным ударом прямо к твоим воротам (и тут-то подгорает не только мячик на соответствующей иконке...) Игра, повторюсь, имеет довольно несложную в освоении механику, с которой при этом можно и, главное, очень хочется экспериментировать — пробовать разные схемы на поле и разные классы, разные тактики защиты и нападения (пытаться ли забегать точными центральными нападающими к воротам или лучше навешивать им мяч фланговым полузащитником? А может вообще "танковать" вражескую защиту универсальным нападающим?) Такая же гибкость присутствует и в упрощённой, но вполне самодостаточной экономической системе, которая тесно переплетается с тактикой игрока - повисеть ли пару сезонов в 3 лиге, подзаработав на спонсоре который стабильно платит небольшие деньги за матч или прицелиться на солидное вознаграждение за кубок? Стоит ли копить на приобретение прокачанных грандов или воспитывать юниоров, восторгаясь их планомерным профессиональным ростом, словно собственными детьми (...ну или расчётливо выращивать их для дальнейшей перепродажи 😇). Решение только за игроком! И не беда если эти решения окажутся ошибочными — даже после череды поражений, оказавшись на дне, не хочется бросать и начинать карьеру заново, а скорее даже наоборот появляется интерес вернуть клубу было величие, воскресив его как птицу феникса. Мой личный вывод: продуманность + простота + азарт = глубокая игра которой хватит надолго. Смелая, необычная концепция и отличная реализация, что в игровом мире бывает не так часто... А то что родом эта диковинка с просторов Украины так вообще просто замечательно.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007535018', 'num_games_owned': 1682, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 16207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3212, 'last_played': 1669392917}
review:
I am not a fan of soccer in the slightest. But I do love turn based strategy. This scratches the strategy itch perfectly. It is also totally different from the usual strategy games I play. 

I have been playing this game for a while now on and off, and it has made a lot of improvements on what was already a very good game. 

I'm sure if you love "Footie" then this is likely to appeal to you, but if like me, soccer leaves you cold, but enjoy strategy, this is definitely worth a look. 

My biggest problem was who to play as. I ended up with Brighton as that was my Dad's favourite team.

Update: 2 years later

I still keep returning to this game. I have now created my own custom team, Snowdogs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078019189', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 11911, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 763, 'last_played': 1600452349}
review: very fun

author: {'steamid': '76561198293470544', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 9647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4092, 'last_played': 1697917775}
review: Perfekt für den nächsten Corona-Lockdown. Wenn die Friseure geschlossen sind, einfach 10 Minuten Football Tactics & Glory spielen. Bei all dem RNG reißt man sich die Haare einfach selber aus.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070167906', 'num_games_owned': 598, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 2176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1491, 'last_played': 1651117664}
review:
Hasse eigentlich Fußball aber der Taktikaspekt gemischt mit Wirtschaftssimulation hat mich zu einem Kauf bewegt. 

Habe keinen Cent der 20€ bereut. Losgelöst vom "Fußballfanaspekt" bietet das Spiel eine tiefgängige Wirtschaftssimulation. Vor jedem Spiel muss man überlegen, welche Spieler man spielen lässt, bzw. welche für das Team überhaupt nötig sind und ob man nicht lieber die 7 Millionen mitnimmt. Ebenso mit welcher Aufstellung man gegen den kommenden Gegner antritt, welche Fähigkeiten man entwickelt usw.. Alles in Allem gibt es mehr zu beachtende Dinge als in den meisten Branchenvertretern, was ich als Individualist in solchen Spielen sehr begrüße. Die Optik wirkt rund und passt zum Spielkonzepz. Bonuspunkte gibt's für aktive Entwickler und (noch) keine Mikrotransaktionen. Würde es so auf jeden Fall weiterempfehlen, auch für "Fußballhasser".

Lediglich der Soundtrack könnte erweitert werden aber bin echt gespannt, was sich der Entwickler noch einfallen lässt!

author: {'steamid': '76561197989964229', 'num_games_owned': 275, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1481, 'last_played': 1574257124}
review: Отличная тактика по мотивам футбола, которая дает отдохнуть от бесконечных PES и FIFA и не напрягает цифрами как Football Manager. Возможность создать свой клуб со своим лого и вывести его в ЛЧ дорогого стоит, пусть на это и придется убить очень много времени. Советую ставить длительность матча побольше (60 или 90 ходов), иначе глубина тактики (например, игра без мяча) будет проходить мимо.

author: {'steamid': '76561198217354667', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1532660102}
review:
[b]Football, Tactics & Glory[/b] es un experimento con la misma cantidad de puntos a favor que negativos. Por desgracia, lo que es táctica y estrategia no está tan asentado como debería (ni siquiera existe la típica selección de esquemas), y la premisa toma un carácter bastante individual.

A medida que pasa el tiempo, se ve una mayor coordinación a través de habilidades que hacen pensar en quién debe jugar y en dónde, tanto antes del partido como durante. Sin embargo, toma demasiado tiempo llegar a ese punto, por lo cual la gestión cae en la repetición y frustración. La propuesta está lejos de lograr lo que quiere, pero, como sucede con los equipos de mitad de tabla, puede utilizar la misma base para mejorar.

Leé el review completo en [url=www.overcluster.com]OverCluster[/url]
developer_response:
Lamento ver que no recomiendas el juego. Sin embargo, parece que no lo entendiste lo suficientemente bien.

Cuando domines diferentes mecánicas de juego, verás que es más rápido y profundo de lo que parece cuando recién estás aprendiendo. Por ejemplo, las habilidades no son solo una pequeña mejora: son el factor principal en tus tácticas. Lo mismo con cruces, clases, etc.

Usted dice que es un inconveniente que no permitimos cambiar formaciones. Pero, en realidad, es lo que hace que el juego sea bueno cuando sabes cómo jugar. Los entrenadores reales no cambian la formación al elegir de la lista, dan selectivamente las tareas específicas para jugadores específicos. Lo mismo en FTG: debes prepararte para cada partido, aprender los lados fuerte y débil de tu oponente y poner a tu equipo a contrarrestar las tácticas del oponente. Es lo que hacen los entrenadores reales. Y lo simulamos de una manera un poco simplificada.

Además, si desea jugar con grandes clubes actualizados, puede hacerlo:
1) Para más diversión, descargue las modificaciones de esta lista: https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=954423609
2) Comience una nueva campaña con el club superior y habilitado 'Sandbox'.

Pero te divertirás solo si dominas el uso de habilidades, entiendes cómo usar cada habilidad, entiendes cómo combinar clases y habilidades para ganar oponentes más fuertes, cómo usar cruces.

Espero, aprenderás todo eso y te divertirás tanto como muchos otros jugadores que ya dominaron el juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123886873', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 65241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6693, 'last_played': 1700763259}
review:
Il gioco e' veramente molto bello anche se ammetto che la mia valutazione e' un po' di parte; dal momento che in real sono un professore di matematica, mi sto divertendo un sacco a calcolare tutte le probabilita' statistiche quando gioco una partita.
Ho sentito dire in altre recensioni che il gioco si basa moltissimo sulla fortuna, beh .... e' vero in parte; e' piu' che ovvio che quando si ha a che fare con i dadi la fortuna la fa da padrone, ma un conto e' giocare a dadi quando gli stessi sono uguali e vince chi fa il numero piu' grande (fortuna al 100%), un conto e' quando i dadi sono, come dire, "truccati" nel senso che uno ha piu' facce dell'altro e qui entra in gioco il calcolo delle probabilita'.
Es. Mi trovo davanti al portiere e il mio attaccante ha forza 100 mentre il portiere 130 pero' potrei usare l'abilita' bicicletta con la quale ho due tentativi di 7 contro 10, cosa faccio? Il giocatore medio o comunque colui che gioca tanto per, fa la prima cosa che capita, colui invece che conosce la matematica fa l'azione con maggiore probabilita' di riuscita.
C'e' poi anche da dire che il gioco non si basa solo su concetti statistici perche' oltre ad essere dei buoni cultori del calcolo delle probabilita', bisogna anche essere bravini con le finanze, spesso infatti bisogna saper capire quando conviene comprare o vendere un giocatore comparando il tutto con lo stipendio che chiede e con quanti soldarelli abbiamo in banca.
Ho poi letto altre recensioni nelle quali si dice che le azioni sono sempre uguali; niente di piu' folle e sbagliato !!! Io personalmente preparo sempre le partite con la massima meticolosita' facendo molti calcoli statistici per cercare di ottimizzare il tutto ed e' molto raro se non addirittura impossibile giocare partite uguali perche' gli schemi usati sono sempre diversi.
Insomma, e' un gioco molto piacevole e per nulla macchinoso, un gioco che si puo' affrontare in tranquillita' per passare qualche ora di piacere e relax o in maniera psicopatica e con mille mila calcoli come il sottoscritto :-))) in ogni caso un bellissimo gioco a mio parere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074470434', 'num_games_owned': 123, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 3895, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2829, 'last_played': 1668977455}
review: Am Anfang habe ich das Game gefeiert und hatte 25 stunden spaß damit, weil ich keine Lust mehr auf fifa und co hatte. Ich habe also ne Alternative gesucht und sie fürs erste in diesem Spiel gefunden. Mittlerweile fühle ich mich aber in einigen Situationen innerhalb der Partien unfair behandelt, der RNG-faktor wirkt sehr merkwürdig auf mich.Dann bekommste noch Gegner zum Beispiel in der Amateurleague, welche dir den Hintern aufreißen und du kannst nur zusehen wie sie , auf teils lächerliche art und weise, tore schießen (gewaltschuss von der seitenlinie durch 2 Verteidiger + torwart) oder deine Abwehr aushebeln(dreifacher hackentrick hintereinander) und dann bist du mal vor deren Tor, was nicht immer einfach ist und merkst einfach wie du keine Chance zu haben scheinst.Meine Freude hat sich mittlerweile in Frust umgewandelt. Ich bereue es dafür 20€ ausgeben zu haben...
developer_response:
Es ist schade, dass du aufgehört hast, Spaß zu haben. Ich denke, dass das Problem darin besteht, dass man keine Fähigkeiten, Kreuze und Kopfzeilen beherrscht, wie Flügel vorwärts arbeiten usw.

RNG ist fair. Aber zu Beginn einer neuen Kampagne gibt es eine weitere RNG-Option: Erwartet. Es funktioniert etwas zu Ihren Gunsten.

Ich denke, dass du das Spiel wieder mögen kannst, wenn du all diese wichtigen Gameplay-Faktoren lernst. Sie können auch alle Änderungen abonnieren (https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=954423609) und die neue Kampagne mit aktiviertem Sandbox-Modus starten. Sie werden ein starkes Team haben. Aber Sie müssen auch lernen, Turn-basierte Mechanismen zu verwenden, um die Spiele zu gewinnen.

Hoffe, du wirst weiterhin Spaß mit dem Spiel haben.

review:
아마도 살면서 처음 게임평가 작성 (게임 제작진들과 관계자들에게 영광과 감사를 표합니다.)

한시즌 우승 3관왕을 먹고 작성

갓겜

중독성 굉장하고 정말 잘만든 게임

플레이타임 길다.

초중반때만 하더라도 끊임 없는 시련들이 나에게 온다.
시련들을 이겨내고나면 오는 쾌감, 턴제라도 골을 넣으면 혼자 주먹을 공중에 휘두른다.

결국 정가에 샀음에도 불구하고 최고의 가격대비 재미를 보장함

author: {'steamid': '76561198139591256', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2113, 'last_played': 1581516052}
review:
진짜 개꿀잼입니다. 장기 두는거 같아요 ㅋㅋㅋ 개꿀잼 근데좀 제정이 빢빡한 감이있음 ㅠㅠ 그러나 개꿀잼은 맞음
현재 31시간 했고 8시즌에 프리미어리그에 있느데 능력치빨 이런것도 있긴하겠지만 
전략으로 능력치 다씹어먹을수있음 ㅋㅋㅋ
예를 들어  수비가 100이고 우리공격수가 50밖에안돼도 전략으로 그 수비수 그냥 무너트릴수 있음
레알 개꿀잼

author: {'steamid': '76561198024732935', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2736, 'last_played': 1633329542}
review:
재밌고 중독성 있지만 파고들 요소가 부족해서 이해만 하면 끝이라 금방 질립니다. 
난이도는 35시간만에 프리미어 리그 우승할 정도로 어렵진 않습니다.
프리미어 리그보다 상위 2개 컵대회가 있는데 이를 목표로 하면 50% 정도 시간이 더 걸릿듯 하네요.
플레이 중 주의점은 초반 재정관리인데 여기서 망하면 플레이 타임이 한없이 길어질 듯 합니다.

단점으로 시뮬과 관전에서 세세한 전략을 지정할 수 없다는 것, AI가 골각을 사람보다 못 본다는 것
스킬이 레벨2 이상부터는 과도하게 좋다는 것 정도네요

review: 생각보다 전략전술이나 턴제의 매력을 잘살리면서도 경영게임의 면모도 잘살림. FM같은 느낌에 턴제 RPG를 섞은 희한한 느낌. 재밌다 추천

author: {'steamid': '76561198103855875', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3088, 'last_played': 1654622691}
review:
일단 FM 보다 캐쥬얼하고 단순해 누구나 쉽게 접근할수 있고 턴제 게임이라 뭔가 하는맛이 있음.

하지만 게임을 계속 하게 되면, 전략보다는 그냥 스텟,능력치로로 싸우는 느낌이 강함.

마치 중학교때 휴대폰으로 했던 모바일 프로야구 게임같은 느낌임.

결론은 FM에 접근하기 어려운 분들이나 가볍게 즐기고 싶은 유저에게 추천드림.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010808415', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 1234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1004, 'last_played': 1629733883}
review:
본래는 턴제 축구 게임으로서 평가를 해야하지만 난 대부분을 시뮬레이션으로 넘기면서 축구팀 운영 위주로 해왔기에 축구 감독 시뮬레이션 게임이라 생각하고 이야기 하려한다 

fm은 복잡해서 입문하기 너무 어려웠다
아무래도 축구를 안본지 오래되서 어떤 선수가 좋은지 모르겠고 해야할 것도 너무 많고 텍스트량도 많고 
fm을 제대로 해보고 싶었지만 노력과 지식 부족으로 fm은 1시간도 되기 전에 환불했다 

헌데 이 게임은 실존 선수에 대한 정보 없이도 fm보다는 상대적으로 덜 복잡하고 직관적이었으며  
플레이 자체도 직접 할 수 있는 메리트가 있다 물론 하다가 시뮬레이션으로 다 넘겼지만..

최근 축구를 잘 안봤고 전문적이고 파고들 것이 많은 fm보다는 
간편하고 라이트한 축구감독 시뮬레이션을 찾는다면 이 게임이 답이다

author: {'steamid': '76561197985123601', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 1828, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1788, 'last_played': 1558807693}
review: I hate to give this a bad rating but while it was fun and refreshing at first it becomes just tiresome after a while. Your players develop very slowly but get older and expensive in wages quickly. It relies too much on special abilities. The game often goes from one side to the other with a lucky punch deciding the winner and hence is just frustrating oftentimes. Also the sweeper is overpowered. And so on and so forth.
developer_response:
Sorry to hear you do not recommend the game. However, it seems that you just didn't master most of the tactics like crosses, the combinations of skills etc. I think so because, actually, no one class is overpowered. But to see that, there is a long learning way.

The guy by the link helps new players so you can watch his explanations or ask questions: https://steamcommunity.com/app/375530/discussions/0/1729828401709624463/

There is also a modification which allows starting the game with young players.

Also, you can download mods and play in Sandbox mode which allows you to have all needed skills and classes when you start with Premier League team. 

Hope, you will continue playing and learning FTG and have fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025588077', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2263, 'last_played': 1532035175}
review:
Decent game, could have been excellent.

The good part: The tactical board works surprisingly great. While you can simulate or watch the games, doing so means missing on the main aspect: the tactical play. The round based duels are exciting and keep you wanting for more.
The slim tutorial doesn’t deter from the game. It’s easy to learn, with a comprehensive help menu. The gameplay basics revolve around your player’s attribute numbers versus the opponent’s. Higher numbers means a higher probability of success. This can be pushed in your favor by clever tactical positioning and using skills at the appropriate time.

The game definitely has the "one more round" hook. Games are short and numbers increase with every round, from player attributes, to skills and specializations. Performing well, especially against a better team, also gets you more fans and “glory”. Fans bring in the money, which can be spent on increasing stadium capacity, new players, or a “Youth Academy”. Glory is used to either improve your technical team, or fast track player skills.

Graphic wise, the game looks nice, even though outdated. Sound is as expected, including upbeat instrumental soundtrack.

In time you pick up on small important nuances.  "Pressing" with 3 team-members, for example, can make an attacker back off without risking a foul. Or, using a “Power Shot” instead of a “Precision Shot” increases the chance of a favorable corner kick.

As for the not so good part, there’s quite a bit.
The game is pretty thin on substance. The chess-like board provides a theoretical high skill cap, but in reality you can abuse the simple and few game mechanics early on. "Crosses" for example, are a way in which your forward players can score even against above average opponents. This is valid especially early on, where higher attribute values have a higher impact. 
Outside of the tactical game there are very few things to do: choose attributes to improve, spend currencies on 2 options, player start position. This makes the game options to simulate or just watch the rounds a bit puzzling.

The game has other easy to abuse parts, like the “transfer” mechanic. You simply invest in the “Youth Academy” until you get above average players. Train them a few years and they’ll either dominate your league, or sell them for a huge profit. Which you can invest in your “Youth Academy”… The same is valid for “glory”. By recruiting assistants your players improve faster, or you can spend it to speed up skill learning.  All this increases the mobile game feeling, considering in the end all you need to advance is a significant time investment.

There are only 13 skills, 6 of which are passive! This seems to compensate for the mediocre AI, which barely puts up a fight. The passive skills tend to happen on the opponents turn, which leaves you with very little choice on the board. Considering this, the game would have been interesting with simultaneous turns.

While the game has a clean and easy to read interface, the lack of options (including graphics) is significant: very simple specialization trees, few options in player transfer, and so on. Comparing it with any other football manager is out of the question.

As for things outside general mechanics, I found the skill icons hard to interpret at a glance. Color coding would have made it easier.
The penalty shoot-out system is a matter of luck. No numbers, no skills. If you drag hard games to that point, winning means clicking on where you expect the ball to land.
Help menu is missing a search function.

All in all, the probabilistic randomness keeps things interesting, even if repetitive. Later games force you to make some tactical moves on the field, but the lack of active skills and dice rolling still means higher numbers win. More active skills and larger development trees would offer more interactivity and depth.

Who knows, maybe a sequel will give us more; maybe even an easy going alternative to “Football Manager”.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105481130', 'num_games_owned': 157, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 4613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3260, 'last_played': 1543739775}
review:
개꿀잼 스탯도 4개라서 적은편이고 스탯빨 겜이라고 생각했는데 꽤나 전략적임

유니버셜 포지션은 포지션 위치에 상관없이 효과가 발동되고 특정 포지션은 선호하는 자리에서만 효과가 발동됨 그리고 유니버셜은 스킬 2개씩 달아줄수 있는데 유망주는 유니버셜로, 26살  이상의 선수는 특정포지션으로 키우면 됨

수비는 스위퍼+ CD FD CD 이렇게 세우는게 젤 좋고 RD LD는 수비로는 쓰지마셈
                 
미드라인은 수비 컨트롤 좋은 DM 앵커맨으로 쓰면 개꿀 거기에 롱패스 하나 달면 DM에서 바로 이어지는 빌드업 가능 
외국포럼에서는 MF가 좋다고 하던데 중앙미드필더에 한정해서는 CM이 짱임
압박이 턴이 안든다는게 엄청 장점이고 이거로 중원을 장악할 수 있음.


공격은 헤더가 필수, 따라서 CF를 쓰던가(유망주가 아닐경우) ACC 낮은 유망주에 MF를 달고 헤더를 달아준후 최전방에 꽂아주면 됨. ACC 낮아도 컨트롤 몰짱해서 드리블로 골넣으면 됨. 컨트롤은 높을때 페널유도도 가능하니 좋음. 헤더를 쓰려면 사이드 별려주는 선수가 필요한데 패스는 적어도 50~60이여야 하며 침투후 한번에 올려줄수 있는 MF, LF, RF, LD, RD를 윙으로 쓰면 되는데 미드필더 코치 효과를 전부받기 위해 공격진에 전부 미드필더 쓰는걸 추천.

선수 스탯은 디펜이랑 컨트롤이 사기임. ACC는 높을수록 안좋은 스탯.  

재정은 모든 선수는 34살에 은퇴 선언하니 33살에 모든 선수를 팔면 됨 스킬 박으면 선수값 뛰니 그걸 이용해서 스킬 안박힌 선수를 산다음에 스킬박고 팔아서 돈벌수도 있음 4천원에 선수 사와서 20만원에 선수파는 매력이 있는 겜임 깃발로는 코치영입 추천

review: Great football game for fans of turn-based strategies. Really fun to play, and has lots of tactical choices and interesting progression. The game could appear casual due to it's art-style, but it's not really. Some abilities, like Long Pass, in my opinion are overpowered. But it's scratches most of the itches when it's comes to turn-based football.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996928549', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 8060, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2897, 'last_played': 1655119038}
review: Dieses Spiel ist für alle, die die Nase voll haben vom Football Manager mit seinen 40 Werten pro Spieler, seinen irrelevanten taktischen Einstellungen und seinen unverständlichen Spielergebnissen. Mag es bei Football, Tactics & Glory in den untersten Ligen noch wenig spektakulär und recht einfach zugehen, sind später keine Siege ohne gründliche Analyse der gegnerischen Spieler und ihrer Fähigkeiten möglich, und auch nur, falls man es schafft, seine eigenen Stärken im Spiel zur Geltung zu bringen. Eine grandiose Mischung aus Schach und Fußball mit netten Managementaspekten.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094441468', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1829, 'last_played': 1599743036}
review:
I really really enjoy and love this game :) it's great and different to all the other football-games since its a round-based strategy game. I really enjoy how it works out, but ofc there are some things to talk about.

-First of all, in the early states of climbing the leagues, it's fairly impossible to win against some teams, just because they have something like the rainbow feint lv2 and just run through your defense - the penalty for using them should be greater(eg. not just slighty reduce the potential if used repeatedly but cutting it in half) or maybe only 1 special action per player in one turn(3 actions), it's nothing too bad at all of course, but it feels disappointing, especially in the earlier state of progress.
-The AI should be optimized, since i managed to get in an action-loop where we basically traded the ball onto eachother without moving it and just advancing the time or, and what i find is pretty stupid: the only shoot with powershots. I get the effectiveness, i use it alot too, but it's quite boring to see every second shot that doesnt score a goal gets to be a corner kick..
-Also an option to not just choose between 3 RNG-Modes but having a scale, where you can set the minimum/maximum % of the potential so those who want to have some more reliability in their player's stats can have their way to go too. (considering achievements, enable them only for "default" or set different achievements for different %-stats
-And also, for the Multiplayer: i would LOVE an option for playing a campaign, similar to singleplayer, but with more players in different team, so they can climb with their individual teams, but also play against each other and transfer players with each other etc (i think you get what im talking about). every one plays the same match day and has to wait for the others to finish their game of course, but it would be great to play with friends this way and not just a simple match 1v1

But as i said: i love this game and it's so much fun and i would definitely recommend it to other ppl (already did :P) that like football, team-management and strategy games

author: {'steamid': '76561198131696298', 'num_games_owned': 144, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 5078, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2692, 'last_played': 1701115091}
review:
Vorab – ich spiele gerne Mangerspiel und besonders gerne Fußballmanagerspiele. Insgesamt habe ich z.Zt. ca. 40 Spielstunden und weitere werden hinzukommen. Wer einfache Fußballmanager, die sich auch mal gut simulieren lassen, spielt, der ist hier an der richtigen Stelle. 
Das eigentliche „Fußballspiel“ besteht aus einem rundenbasierten „Schachspiel“, in dem ihr immer drei (durch Spezialaktionen auch mehr) Aktionen zur Verfügung habt. Ziele ist letztendlich immer der Sieg – Fußball halt. Der Weg dorthin ist allerdings äußerst diffizile und mMn extrem belohnend. Der „Mangermodus“ beschränkt sich auf einige wenige Aufgaben, wie Stadionausbau (linear), Trainer, die die Entwicklung der Spieler vorantreiben, Ausbau der Jugendakademie, Vertragsverlängerungen und weiteres. 
Wie komme ich nun auf 40+ Spielstunden? Die Antwort ist relativ einfach – es mach riesigen Spaß seine eigenen Jugendspieler auszubilden, diese dann einzusetzen und die Entwicklung mitzuerleben. Vll ist die Faszination auch nicht wirklich nachvollziehbar aber ich bin begeistern! Ich kann jedem, der gerne Anstoß oder ähnlich Fußballmanager gespielt hat und nicht unbedingt das Gehalt der letzten Reinigungskraft selbst verhandeln will, dieses Spiel wärmstens ans Herz legen.

Zum Abschluss noch eine kurze Pro- und Kontra-Liste, die aber eigentlich eine Pro-Liste und eine Liste mit Verbesserungswünschen ist.
Pro:
-	Spielspaß
-	Spielerentwicklung
-	Aufbau des konkreten Fußballspiels
-	Langzeitmotivation
-	Dauer der Saison bei Simulation (kleiner 30 min)
-	Workshop-Anbindung

Verbesserungen:
-	Vertragslaufzeiten größer 3 Jahre (ohne Ruhm)
-	Etwas mehr Individualisierungsmöglichkeiten in der Peripherie

author: {'steamid': '76561198167892933', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 25722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6895, 'last_played': 1710561701}
review:
Не назову себя ярым поклонником футбола, но иногда под пивко с мужиками можно например посмотреть Чемпионат Мира или Европы. Как ни крути, но это один из самых зрелищных (а поэтому и денежных) видов спорта. Так вот и получилось, что в канун чемпионата мира по футболу в 2018 году, мне попалась данная игра. Увидел её на ютубе (один из лучших обзоров на тот момент был на канале LapoT Youtube), заинтересовала идея скрестить такие казалось бы несовместимые вещи, как футбольный менеджер и пошаговую тактико-стратегическую RPG. Располагало к себе и то, что разработчики были русскоговорящие, с необъятных просторов СНГ. Купив игру, начал на лёгком уровне сложности и быстро вышел сначала из любительской, а потом и из третьей лиги. Однако игра оказалась не так проста, как могло показаться на первый взгляд. Быстрый выход во вторую лигу привёл к тому, что все команды противников оказались сильнее моей, в то время как у меня все ключевые игроки постарели и вышли на пенсию. Тут надо стараться продавать игроков, приближающихся к "пенсионной" отметке 35 лет. В игре конечно есть возможность продлить с ними контракт, но это практически не реально поначалу (требуется много очков славы). Необходимо также стараться набирать новых перспективных игроков, которых  желательно систематично качать в определённый навык и определённую позицию на поле. Важно подбирать специализацию игрока, исходя из его характеристик. У всех игроков твоей команды (и в командах противников) есть набор параметров, одним из которых является вышеупомянутый возраст (влияет он обычно на усталость). Помимо этого есть атака (точность), защита (она же влияет на умение отбирать мяч), способность давать пас и контролировать (удерживать) мяч. Ну, и наверное самое важное и интересное - это умение игрока, например, игра головой, подкат, дальний пас или пас на ход, пушечный удар, проброс или перехват мяча и т.д. Иногда именно исходя из умения целесообразно даже переучить игрока из одной специализации в другую. На данный момент вышло одно крупное обновление после которого добавилась ещё талантливость футболиста, определяющая насколько он в перспективе сможет прокачаться.
В общем, в игре довольно много контента. Если не соблюдать баланс, окажешься в ситуации "команды для битья". AI просто будет подавать на своих нападающих и забивать тебе гол за голом, порой даже через всю линию защиты! Я начинал несколько раз, выбирая разные типы случайности и порой сталкивался со всевозможными странностями. Бывает, что твои ПЗ, АП, ЦН с неплохим рейтингом не могут переиграть "вопросов" (игроков, не имеющих специализации). Серьёзно? Следуя такой логике, шансы того, что Роналду обыграет колхозника равны 50%? )) Смотрим дальше, на канале пресловутого Лаптя у него в продаже всегда есть кто-то ценный, у меня, одни зелёные всегда, за редким исключением. Растить с нуля защитника или нападающего - это отдельная песня. Всё это время вы, скорее всего, будете сливать матчи. Ждать пока прокачаются ваши футболистики. Это может происходить долго и мучительно. Шанс выиграть будет только если вам повезло с вратарём, но это не точно. Вратарь вполне может пропускать от "вопроса", при защите = 50! А хороший вратарь в начале попадается очень редко. Нападающие - это вообще отдельная песня, вам повезёт, если хоть один будет с точностью выше 30 и возрастом лет хотя бы 30. В обратном случае, через несколько месяцев вы останетесь без нападения, а растить своего ох, как нелегко. В одном из прохождений я слил фанатов до нуля, просто проигрывая все матчи, т.к. не было форвардов. Неважный нападающий будет даже при выходе один на один с вратарём будет не способен забить. По моему мнению, игра имеет потенциал, но уж очень она дизбалансна местами. За месяц я так и не смог выйти из второй лиги, тупо игроки стареют и новых дорого покупать. Попробовал разные тактики, слиться на лигу назад, играть всегда вничью: баланса нет. Сливаешься, значит у тебя нет денег и славы. Выигрываешь - значит тебя делают потом более сильные команды. Ещё замечу, что это наверное одна из немногих игр в моей копилке, в которую не становится играть проще со временем, Хотя не такой уж я прямо игрун, надо сказать, да и возможно слишком стар уже).

P.S.: Спустя некоторое время, конечно начинаешь уже разбираться во всяких приёмчиках, вариациях. Но всё равно, играть интересно, и вспоминая прошлые партии, иногда кажется, что иногда получалось даже лучше команду сколотить даже без наличия какой-то целенаправленной стратегии. Огромный плюс, что разработчики не забрасывают продукт, регулярно латают и всячески допиливают игру, а первое (и пока на данный момент последнее) крупное обновление Football Stars внесло разнообразие, добавив нам новых плюшек.
developer_response:
Спасибо за обзор. 

На самом деле, игра очень сбалансирована, но выиграшные возможности не лежат на поверхности. Я смотрел прохождение Лаптя, и он очень грамотно играет. Поэтому, у него есть и победы, и игроки на трансферах. Это не удача - это грамотная игра с планированием наперед, правильным использованием навыков, классов и т.д.

Но пока вы сами не дойдете, почему он делат так, а не иначе, вы не можете использовать то, что он показывает.

Из вашего обзора, я предполагаю, что вы недооцениваете навыки. Но навыки - это ваше главное оружие. Независимо от уровней футболистов и их парамтеров, навыки для всех футболистов зависят лишь от их энергии. Также важно научиться выполнять прострелы.

Хоть игра и зависит от удачи, когда вы умеете использовать разные тактики, когда вы грамотно выстроили команды, вы увидите, что в длинной перспективе решает не удача, а тактика и подбор футболистов. Именно это видно на канале у Лаптя. И именно до этого вы, надеюсь в какой-то момент дойдете и получите удовольствие от того, что выстроили действительно мощную команду.

Удачи на футбольном поле!

author: {'steamid': '76561198043870331', 'num_games_owned': 286, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 750, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 750, 'last_played': 1532578815}
review:
EDIT: There's a lot more RNG in this game than I thought. I understand the whole idea that it's a simulation of soccer and that sometimes a miracle can happen but I think a random roll function is just too simple for this. It goes from being the basis for a really interesting tactics game to basically the deciding factor in the game, meaning that at times it can feel like this game is pure RNG and that is very frustrating. This coupled with a few other issues I had with the game like the simple inability to make substitutions on a free kick makes me feel like this should have launched into Early Access. 
Tl;dr, this game is fun for the first few hours but if you try to get serious about it, you will become infuriated.
 
OLD REVIEW: This game is a ton of fun. Like others have said, it feels like Football Manger without all the complexities combined with really interesting and unique turn-based soccer gameplay. There's a surprising amount of depth to the gameplay that I am still gaining an understanding of. It can be frustrating at times - I had a cup game that went to penalties and the result was 100% RNG. You shoot left, right, or center and guess left, right, or center on defense and the game randomly picks what will happen - pure RNG, no stats involved, which was a little disappointing. Other than that, I'm having a great time learning this game and messing around with different strategies. Give it a try!

review: Não tinha ouvido falar sobre o jogo, realmente me surpreendi ao jogá-lo. O jogo em si é muito "atrativo", é simples, sem muita complicação e você não esquenta muito a cabeça. O gráfico não é lá essas coisas, é bonito mas não é um "meu Deus, queria que todo jogo fosse assim". A gameplay é realmente legal, não peca em nada em minha opinião. Comprei fora de promo, não sei quanto ficaria (ou quanto ficou) em promo, mas até agora, valeu cada centavo!

author: {'steamid': '76561198165236693', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1901, 'last_played': 1652700192}
review: Очень интересная и оригинальная стратегия. Очень увлекательно играть и создавать свою команду. Единственное, чего я не понял, зачем сделали, что во время матча можно выйти в главное меню, ведь сбивается весь результат матча и можно начать его заного. Дело в том, что таким образом можно всегда выигрывать. Допустим, вы проигрываете 3:0. Вы просто выходите в главное меню и начинаете матч заного, пока вас не устроит результат. Не знаю, баг это или нет, но это очень упрощает получение некоторых ачивок в стиме. Но если быть честным игроком, то вы на это не обратите внимания.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101958514', 'num_games_owned': 130, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2642, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1610, 'last_played': 1535288606}
review: Ist ja ein schönes Spiel so im Großen und Ganzen. Wenn aber die KI die ganze Zeit nur aufgrund von unfassbar behindertem Würfelglück gewinnt, selbst wenn man mit einer 1,5 Sterne Mannschaft gegen eine 3 Sterne Mannschaft spielt und bei den eigenen Spielern trotz drei Mal würfeln und voller Ausdauer keine Fähigkeiten funktionieren. Irgendwie hat man das Gefühl, dass das RNG in dem Spiel rigged ist. Mal abgesehen davon ist das Spiel in Ordnung, die Idee ist eigentlich ganz nett, aber diese beschissenen RNG machen das Spiel an manchen Stellen unspielbar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089479962', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1692, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1225, 'last_played': 1602449751}
review:
So I don't even follow professional football, but I have always thought that the nature of divisional systems in football leagues lead to the best possible opportunities for long lived management games. Start in the dumpster league with a team full of beer-bellied amateurs and build until you eventually reach the top tier and resemble a professional team. There's no room for that kind of rags-to-riches tale in hockey (my favorite sport) or american football because those leagues have static membership.

FTG reminds me of Ultimate Soccer Manager 98 in its managerial simplicity and ability to inspire you to take just one more turn. It's a huge accomplishment, and after playing this game for a good while, it made me realize how long I've been waiting for a game like this - nearly 20 years. FTG makes things even more interesting with its turn-based match gameplay, which is probably going to be what both alienates and interests players the most. Those looking for a classical football simulation may revile at the way turn-based matches play out - certainly we're using football terminology but it doesn't really resemble how football is played - it's optimized for being able to play entire seasons of these matches manually. They are quick, your formation and position is largely static, and every play is incredibly important. I think it's beautiful, unique, fun, and really gives non-football fans a way to get into this game, in that they don't need to sit through 90 minutes and 500 passes, but if you're looking for a hardcore, realistic simulation, that isn't the point of the game and you're going to be disappointed.

I recommend this game to anyone who is at all interested in sport management. Whether or not you really like football is actually kind of beside the point, because this is it's own game and it's not attempting to closely model real football. At the same time though, the tactical turn-based gameplay is fantastic and the managerial aspects (contracts, training players, etc.) are deep enough to be worth thinking about, but casual enough that the game is very far from a spreadsheet simulator. I like how all of the components of management and decisions you make there will tie back into the turn-based matches, and so those decisions all have very tangible outcomes that I don't get from more statistically-focused simulations.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965032453', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 10793, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5155, 'last_played': 1670091550}
review:
Eigentlich ein gutes Spiel, wenn man keinen großen Wert auf die Managerkomponenten legt. Die ist leider in fast allen Bereichen viel zu simpel, zu statisch oder gar nicht vorhanden. Hier nur ein paar Beispiele:

Sponsoren:
Einmal zu Anfang jeder Saison wählt man genau einen Sponsor aus drei Möglichen. Das zusammen mit der Tatsache, dass die Preisgelder von der Höhe her sehr schnell absolut irrelevant sind, macht das Ganze Sponsorenthema einfach nur zu einem nervigen Klick nach jeder Saison. Warum gestaltet mans nicht einfach so:

- Mehrere Sponsoren (z.B. einer für Trikot, vier für Bandenwerbung, einer für Stadionnamen usw)
- Keine festen Längen (einer geht 6 Monate, einer 30 Spiele, einer 2 Jahre)

Transfers:
- Sowohl Kaufen als auch Verkaufen sind genau 2 Klicks. Jeden Spieler der zum Verkauf steht, hat man sofort, genauso wird jeder Spieler der weg soll sofort verkauft. Keine Verhandlungen, keine Absagen, keine Anfragen von anderen Vereinen nichts. 
- Auf der Transferliste sind nur die Spieler im Alter von 16 und maximal noch 17 Jahren interessant, wenn wirklich Not ist. Alles andere entwickelt sich langfristig einfach zu schlecht. 
- Ich habe keine Möglichkeit, Spieler von anderen Vereinen abzuwerben, ich habe nur Das, was auf den Transferlisten erscheint.
- Kein Ausleihen / Verleihen

Ligen:
- Keine Möglichkeit die Ligen anderer Länder anzusehen
- Es gibt keine Aufstiegs- oder Abstiegsrunde, entweder direkter Aufstieg oder direkter Abstieg
- Keine Nationalmanschaften, also auch keine Abberufung der Spieler für Länderspiele und keine Turniere usw.

Spieler:
- Das man Namen mit Mods anpassen kann ist gut, es bringt nur nichts weil die "nachwachsenden" Spieler wieder die selben, vorgegebenen Namen haben.
- Das Talentsystem im aktuellen Zustand sind ähnlich zu den Sponsoren eher nervige Klicks. Man skillt fast immer nach dem gleichen Prinzip und in gleicher Reihenfolge, es gibt viel zu wenig Abwechslung und für meinen Geschmack sind die Auswirkung der Talente auch viel zu hoch.
- Nach einiger Zeit im Spiel kann man seine Spieler im Alter von 22 bis 24 Jahren bereits auf der Maximalstufe haben. Die restlichen 8-10 Jahre gibt es keine Entwicklung mehr.
- Kosten für Verträge mit den Spielern sind, abhängig von den Fertigkeiten und Talenten immer absolut gleich.  
- Trainieren kann man theoretisch immer eine von vier Fertigkeiten, praktisch trainiert man über die gesamte Kariere eines Spielers, abhänig von dessen Position eher genau eine

Sonstiges:
- Absolut kein Personalsystem, man kann niemanden Anstellen, man "kauft" sich nur bessere Trainer mit Punkten. Die man aber irgendwann alle dauerhaft hat. 
- Ab einer bestimmten Anzahl "Fans" ist es nicht mehr möglich "Fans" zu verlieren. Man hängt also sehr schnell dauerhaft beim Maximum von 80 000 und es gibt absolut keine Änderung. Mal davon abgesehen, dass eine krumme Zahl hier irgendwie besser aussehen würde, wäre da etwas Schwankung deutlich angenehmer.
- Stadionausbau beschränkt sich auf simple Vergrößerung der Anzahl an Sitzplätzen bis max. 80 000. 
- Geld wird irgendwann irrelevant wenn alles ausgebaut ist, da man für nichts mehr (ausgenommen Gehälter und Spielerkäufe) Geld ausgeben kann. Und die Kosten sind im Vergleich zu den Einnahmen auch wieder irelevant (Es sind ja nur 16 und 17 Jährige nützlich und die kosten eben nichts).
- Wenn das Spiel längere Berechnungen durchführt dann hängt es sich auf, bis es fertig ist, und läuft erst dann weiter.
- Nicht alles läuft im Fenstermodus auch im Hintergrund. Bei manchen Sachen gehts erst weiter, wenn das Fenster wieder den Fokus hat. 
- Simuliert man Spiele scheint es keine Auswechslungen zu geben. Generell sind da die Informationen während des Spiels relativ mager. Es werden maximal die Tore angezeigt sonst nichts. 
- Bei simulieren Spielen scheinen Taktik und Aufstellung nur wenig oder garkeine Auswirkungen haben. 

Wenn man vielleicht auch nur ein paar der Punkte angeht, wäre es mir einen Daumen nach oben und eine Empfehlung wert.

****wird noch ergänzt****

author: {'steamid': '76561197970661331', 'num_games_owned': 207, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 967, 'last_played': 1617985465}
review:
Vorneweg: coole Idee! Tolles Spiel! Kurzweilig, aber:
der aktuelle Spielmodus ist ok, macht auch Laune, aber als alter Manager-Spieler wäre es schön, wenn man die Managementfunktionen etwas erweitern würde. Gängiges, was man aus anderen Spielen auch kennt:
- Freundschaftsspiele ansetzen
- 2. Mannschaft (in der man seine Jungspieler etwas heranreifen lassen kann)
- Mehr Stadionmanagement

Die Aufstellungen sind etwas begrenzt - beispielsweise geht nur ein defensiver Mittelfeldspieler, und da das Spielfeld nur 7 Felder breit ist, ist bei 4 Verteidigern schnell dichtes Gedränge. 

Evtl könnte man auch die "3 Züge pro Runde" etwas anders gestalten - beispielsweise, dass man in einem Zug auch Spieler mit einer besonderen Fähigkeit wie "Raumdeuter", "Abfangjäger" oder "Flügelflitzer" steuern könnte, um das Spiel etwas dynamischer zu gestalten. So könnte man sich freilaufen, oder gegnerische Aufbauarbeiten unterbinden.

Und Statistiken fehlen... 
an sich macht das Spiel aber auch so schon viel Spaß
Kann es aktuell empfehlen!

Meine Tipps, die ich bisher empfehlen kann:
1.: immer auf die eigene Jugend bauen. Frühzeitig eigene, sehr junge Spieler zu Stammspielern werden lassen. Alle halbe Jahre bekommt man einen neuen Jugendspieler, die zwar dann 1-2 Jahre denn alten Hasen hinterherhängen, diese dann aber sehr schnell überflügeln. Ich tausche meine Spieler, die zwischen 27 und 30 sind immer gegen 16-18 jährige aus, verkaufe dann die alten (bis 30 kriegt man auch noch was für die) und fahre so ganz gut, ohne dass ich übermäßig viel Geld verdienen muss
2.: mit Libero, IV und DM spielen - die meisten Pässe über die Mitte werden so abgefangen, Stürmer werden angegriffen und es steht immer wer im Weg um einen Schuss zu blocken
3.: ein Verteidiger mit Kopfballstärke - sehr wichtig, vor allem, wenn der Gegner olympische Tore macht
4.: Ich spiele mit 4er Raute im Mittelfeld und 2 Stürmern. So habe ich eigentlich immer Passoptionen, muss selten hoch spielen und krieg den Ball gut nach vorne.
5.: Kontrolle: Mittelfeldspieler brauchen viel Kontrolle, damit sie den Ball nicht immer gleich wieder verlieren

author: {'steamid': '76561198007486621', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 42364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3583, 'last_played': 1708032030}
review: Играть просто, стать мастером сложнее. Простые правила, не так много характеристик игроков, как в других футбольных менеджерах, но прекрасно сделана сама игра - фактически, мы покупаем набор шахмат и потом рубимся до упора с чужим набором. Графика незамысловатая, но не отвлекает, проблем со стабильностью нет, искуственный интеллект достаточно силен, чтобы доставлять удовольствие, прокачка и выбор игроков под свои схемы - что еще надо?

review: 作为一个模拟经营类游戏没问题，但是作为足球模拟游戏我觉得阉割掉了最有趣的转会系统，租借和交易都没有，不能自己找球员，所有的球员都是ai给的。但是真正的足球操作中无球跑动需要空间 这个的跑动空间太窄了。最后这个分数到底是怎么计算的，我的能力 高于ai几倍还是不能拿住球这我就很蛋疼。其余还算不错，回合制足球是个很有意思的东西，但是我觉得这个部分还可以完善

author: {'steamid': '76561197970489784', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 35985, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33034, 'last_played': 1711096587}
review:
Over 500 hours simulating games because I like the building of a club, picking players and training them. But in simulation this game is horribly flawed and possibly designed to make you manage with one arm behind your back, in truth it cheats. I took a side from the bottom division to the premier league over 20 years. I then yo-you’d in and out of premier for 10 years. Like other times you hit an invisible brick wall. I took a contract with another team and watched my old team in first league win UNDEFEATED, out scoring other teams for the year by more than 50 goals and only conceded 14. They were elevated to premier where they went undefeated and won it. Same players but with bizarre tactics using RM/LM out of position. 

At certain points things change, your running top 3 at the winter break, suddenly you don’t win a game or you come up against a clearly inferior team and they beat you or suddenly your team can’t score for months. The penalties are a cheat, I’ve lost games 4-3 and the opposition got 4 penalty goals and the opposition is guaranteed to either score in the first minute of the second half or in the 90th. 

The devs need to remove the cheats or give simulation some attention as it’s clearly flawed or biased to the AI teams.

I got offers for my LM of $6 million which I rejected, when I swapped teams I tried to buy him, they asked $30 million !!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198072871880', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 816, 'last_played': 1550243950}
review: Boring after some time. It's time-dependent game. Not so much about strategy.
developer_response:
Unfortunately, it seems you used only the basic mechanics. If you use only basic actions, you can level up slowly and after some very long time to win other opponents.

However, if you utilize all the tactical possibilities the game provides, you will be surprised of how many possibilities to win much stronger opponents there are. Master using skills and combine them with the abilities of the classes. 

For example, many novice players think that the Cannon Shot doesn't make sense in the game (from your review I suppose you think the same). But if you start combining different tactical possibilities, you will see that it's one of your strongest weapons. Here's an example where experienced players give advice to a novice player who has not yet mastered skills: https://steamcommunity.com/app/375530/discussions/0/1729828401680241170/

I hope, you will give the game another chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030375249', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 7464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3573, 'last_played': 1709545798}
review: Итак, купив еще весной, только сейчас получил немного времени поиграть(да реал злая штука). В чем прелесть данной игрухи простота,простота и еще раз простота. Не надо как в ФифаМенеджере держать под контролем 30+характеристик.Можно выбрать схему и наигрывать игроков на неё. Можно просто расслабится вечерком просимулировав пару сезонов без особого напряга. И при граммотном подходе ворватся на международный уровень. Единственное что огорчает нет привязки игроков по национальностям и в следствии чего нет Чемпионата Мира,ЧемпионатаЕвропы. Надеюсь когда-то добавят все это. В остальном неплохо провести время,незаморачиваясь как в других симуляторах за 10+ параметров. Для тех хто хочет простототы самое то.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996970443', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 157, 'playtime_forever': 1206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1206, 'last_played': 1559036249}
review:
Начну издалека. В далеком 1999- 2002 «EA Sports» выпускала свою линейку менеджеров. Для меня это была одна из самых завораживающих игр. В ней было все – футбол, его менеджмент, селекция, строительство сооружений, развитие клуба и прочих около футбольных деталей. Главным плюсом игр тех лет была легкость. Там было конечно груда текста, в котором нужно было разбираться, но это было легко интуитивно и увлекательно. 

В 2003 году менеджер шагнул в прогрессивный интерактивный мир и сильно изменился. Чтобы разобраться в новых сериях футбольного менеджера от этой компании нужно было…- это был ад! Игра поменялась в корне, всего стало очень много, но после 3 сезона вариативность терялась. Объясню, например, появились послематчевые интервью тренера и это было круто и увлекательно, но после 3 сезона ты уже знал ответы и их последствия наизусть. И так практически со всеми нововведениями. Но самый главный минус, что игра потеряла легкость и стала тяжелой и цикличной. Но это по-прежнему был хороший футбольный менеджер чья концепция работает по сей день. 

Ну и как с этим связана «Football, Tactics & Glory»? – спросите Вы. Так вот она очень сильно напомнила мне менеджеры тех годов и порадовала легкостью. Здесь все просто, интуитивно и понятно. Самые важные аспекты футменеджера соблюдены. Команда, турниры, спонсоры, тактика, финансы, строительство. Концепцию игру ты понимаешь буквально через сезон второй. Плюс не хилый такой бонус и фича игры – пошаговый футбол. 

Давайте о геймплее. Да это пошаговая стратегия на футбольном поле, да с прокачками и способностями футболистов, с привычными клеточками, перками. Забавная, мультяшная и утрированная анимация. И идея крутая! Но в схеме есть большие дыры. Суть такова, допустим Ваш ход, значит у Вас есть 3 действия, потом у соперника и так до конца матча. Например, обведет ли защитника нападающий зависит от скила обоих. Так вот если у Вас ФК «Сахалин», а противник «Спартак» то никакая тактическая гениальность или рандом Вас не спасут. Ибо даже с двух метров, которые тут формальны, форвард попадет в защитника, если последний сильнее по показателям. Поэтому на первых парах с сильными командами можно спокойно скипать игру и ждать пока Ваша банда прокачается. Так же и наоборот, через сезонов 5, когда Вы прокачали свою дружину, можно регулярно вести со счетом 3:0 к 15 минуте матча. 

Плюс есть мелкие упущения в правилах. Например, если Вашего игрока удалили в Чемпионате России на 3 игры, то он удален и в кубке, и в Лиге Чемпионов и в общем везде. Что не правильно, кто разбирается в футболе. Подобных мелочей я замечал не много, но недоработки есть. Ну и самая главная недоработка, наверно цикличность. Как только понимаешь механику игры, разрабатываешь одну стратегию, качаешь скил и ты царь горы! Ведущие игроки повесили бутсы на гвоздь? Потерпи пару сезонов и радуйся жизни вновь. Поэтому сам геймплей достаточно скоро становится не интересным.

Однако этому есть временное спасение - это матчи с живыми игроками. Тут все веселее и напряжёнее.  Однако железное правило «скила» не отменяют поэтому, каким бы ты не был гением футбольной тактики, если нападающий соперника прокачен на максимум 100, твой защитника на 93 – голу быть. Но все перечисленное не делает игру плохой. Наоборот, она любопытна и достойна внимания.

В итоге я насытился геймплеем и начал скипать игры, и понял, что получил свой любимый менеджер из 2000х. Она легка в обращении, мобильная и очень отзывчива. Плюс игрой продолжают заниматься. Конечно многого тут не хватает, даже мобильный менеджер от PES намного масштабнее в возможностях. Но у игры, безусловно, есть потенциал. Скелет готов, осталось нарастить мышцы и кожу. 

Лично для меня «Football, Tactics & Glory» это лёгкая футбольная убивалка времени. Когда до дел минут 40 это игра спокойно займет Вас на это время.

Любителям футбола и футбольных менеджеров рекомендую. Это любопытный опыт.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038027462', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 1110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1110, 'last_played': 1530495490}
review:
TL;DR : A great idea that is fun for a while, but the more I played and the more I realized the game had big issues.

I enjoyed it for a while, excited by the idea of playing a strategy based football game because I often feel that classic sports game become very repetitive and should be used as an inspiration to create original games (look at Blood Bowl or Pyre). Sadly this game became too repetitive as well with each match playing itself like the one before. 
Because of how short the games are, winning comes from the tactics chosen at the beginning (players and positionning), not from the choices in game. Since you can do 3 actions during your turn, if you have the ball, you either pass agressively to try a shot, move forward and protect the ball, or protect the ball and reposition your defense in case they manage to get the ball back. If the first option isn't available (since you need 1 action to tackle and get the ball back from them, leaving you with only two), then you have to choose between leaving a open defense that the attackers can penetrate or lose 3 actions not moving forward, knowing that you only have 12 actions each half of the game. Scoring becomes very hard if you choose the 3rd option and games become very boring. Draws happen way too often in this game.
Sure you can adjust the length of the game, but only when you create a new team, and I didn't feel like giving up 15 hours of climbing with my first team just to have a chance to get more interesting games. Also, lengthening games could cause a new issue : climbing up the leagues would take even more time than it already does.
Speaking of climbing, you will at times reach a point where you'll be stuck because your team isn't good enough yet to keep climbing. Although that seems realistic, it also mean you'll spend hours playing in the same league again to upgrade your young players and get some money. That's call grinding and it's not fun.
Finally, I'm concerned about the end game. I've launched some games playing top teams and I didn't felt like I had more options. Since the defense becomes so good that shooting from afar and dribbling the players become impossible, you have to rely on your players getting better at crosses or using special moves. The overall amount of possibilities doesn't change since old tactics are replaced by new ones. That's not enough to keep me interested.

Overall, the game can be fun for a season or two, or in sandbox mode if you want to make flashy plays. But I was looking for an enjoyable adventure climbing from Amateur all the way to Premier League, and I had to stop in Second League because I didn't felt there was enough to keep me invested.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072614707', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 159202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3341, 'last_played': 1708804134}
review:
I love this game. This is a very fun game incorporating the most interesting elements of football action and management. It reminds me of Xcom and Bloodbowl 2, incorporating elements of both with slightly less complexity and shorter game time. In my opinion, it is also more fun and satisfying to play than the supposed football simulations offered by FIFA and PES.

The game starts you off in the lowest amateur league where you try to develop a club up to the lowest level. This means that each season is a struggle for promotion or to avoid relegation as you try to manage your resources in the best way to overcome your opponents.

I really like the short length of each match with each one lasting about ten minutes. This means that the matches and seasons go quite quickly.  It means that you can sit down with the game for half an hour, play a couple of matches and adjust your team etc. Although, I find it difficult to only play a couple of matches; I always want to play just one more.

The matches themselves are fun and compelling as you try to out position and manoeuvre the opposition with skills and tactics. Every match is challenging and I find myself cheering every goal and every victory. Even a 0-0 draw can be satisfying if you need points in the league or have played a superior team.

There is an extensive player customisation tool which in my opinion is far more advanced than the game requires. However, in my view any customisation is welcome. It's just a shame they didn't include female (or even unisex like in Super Mega Baseball 2) player, teams and leagues, as that would have given them a jump on other football games.

I read that they are considering porting to consoles. If they do I may also buy it for XB1 and would recommend it to friends who have consoles. I would also love to see an iPad version as this game is made for IOS. 

In summary thus is a fun and compelling game that will interest fans of turned based games who have an interest in sport. In fact, even those who are not interested in sport may like this a it excludes most of the dull, frustrating elements of real sport.

review: This is a great game for fans of football and/or turn-based games.  Truly enjoyable, with RPG elements (developing your players, selecting which skills they will train), strategy elements (selecting your formation, game stye, adapting to each adversary), and business simulation elements (making good use of your budget for either contracts with players, improving your stadium or investing in the youth academy).  I can definitely recommend it.

review:
This game is amazing!

I'm a big fan of the Tactics genre and am always looking for new additions to the genre. Well, I've always wanted to get into the Football Manager games but never have. This has scratched both of those itches for me!

The game is surprisingly deep as you'll see once you get half way into a season. I'm still learning the mechanics/strategy, but it's amazing how well soccer translates into a tactics game. If you're a fan of either genre, I'd highly recommend this!

author: {'steamid': '76561198072086580', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 4385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2467, 'last_played': 1531355555}
review:
This is a fantastic little game and wow am I glad Rock Paper Shotgun did the review of the game that prompted me to give it a shot. So who is this game for? Well, if you are a fan of Soccer, (Yes I'm American) Tactics games or sports franchise simulations you will likely find something to love in this game. So let's get to the pros and cons.

Pros:

1. Snappy match times. The length of the matches is just about perfect. The game has a “just one more match” feeling going for it and I often find myself playing way too long...
2. Tactical depth feels perfect. The game has just enough tactical depth and breadth too keep the game interesting whilst not bogging the play down with unnecessary complexity.
3. Mods. You can mod in your own custom leagues or download others creations from the Steam Workshop...House Targaryen FTW... 
4. Multiple settings to control the RNG present in the game. I would, however, like to see more granular settings for this.
5. Challenging game play and team management.
6. Robust facial editor for those who like to customize their players and you can rename the players as well.
7. It's bloody FUN...

Cons:

     The only real complaint I have about the game is that the player and team progression feels a bit slow in standard franchise mode . There are settings (Read “cheats”) and a sandbox mode that allow you to adjust your play experience, but I hate the idea of resorting to cheats. I really just wish that the franchise mode moved at a slightly brisker pace whilst maintaining its level of challenge.

     Well that's it. I absolutely love this game and I am going to stop writing so I can go play.

Cheers!

author: {'steamid': '76561198001507954', 'num_games_owned': 3199, 'num_reviews': 302, 'playtime_forever': 472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1531587307}
review:
[h1]Football, Tactics, and Glory[/h1]

Ridiculously addictive "one-more-turn" matches of strategically explosive bite-sized tactics scenarios, all in the form of the exciting and exhilarating hype of a stadium soccer career. I'm definitely not a huge soccer fan and this is not a game I ever saw myself being sucked into, but thanks to a concretely solid system of accessible and easy-to-execute commands on the field and an incredibly addictive management loop to deliberate on between matches Football, Tactics, and Glory was not an easy sports game to put down.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]

The absolute unpredictability of a real sports match is present here in full force, with random chance factors playing into the outcome of each decision. Of course these factors aren't totally random, with a bit of help from the base stats of your individual players having a big role in the general strength and weaknesses of your team. It's definitely important to pick the right man for the job, and strongly consider each of your members for their most worthy position on the field making the management aspect between matches an important and addictive decision making process.

The real pleasure in Football, Tactics, and Glory is how smooth and quick it gets you into the actual action. No long-winded animations, no complex series of inputs for simple moves like a lot of other bogged down strategy games, just the core action of inputting your movements and careful deliberating on where to place your shots and your body blocks. This is the core of soccer/football distilled into the careful routine of planning and acting out the tactical steps that lead you to victory, and it just feels really good.

[h1]Visuals/Sound[/h1]

The animations are smooth and sweet, to-the-point and they carry so much personality just as the individual players do. Very distinct visuals and personal traits make each of your footballers stand out in a way that's easy to manage in the middle of the action, but also in a way that gets you attached and involved with each of your members in a memorable way.

While I'm definitely not a fan of the overly optimistic, sappy and borderline cheese-y car-commercial sound to the soundtrack here, I can absolutely see that a lot of work has gone into the sound production in this game. It does the job and its fitting for the more mainstream world of sporting events, and the actual recording of sound effects are what really draw you into the authenticity of the matches.

[h1]Final Thought[/h1]

Its been ages since a strategy title of any kind drew me in this much just with its hard-to-stop core mechanics alone. Football, Tactics, and Glory is going to be a compelling new addiction for tactics and strategy fans from the most casual of mobile tactics game fans to the most hardcore X-com junkies around. Its so incredibly easy to get caught up in thanks to its well telegraphed visuals and easy to recognize and execute commands, while having a ridiculously high skill-ceiling of going up against some of the toughest and formidable teams later on in your career.

Absolutely recommended for all fans of any kind of addictive management, planning, tactics and sports simulation.

[i]This review made possible through the generosity, consideration and contribution of [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/11739878-ReviewExperts/]Review Experts(REXnetwork)[/url] and the developer/publisher. 

Email contact@dnbmedia.co for requests & game promotions[/i]

review: I played the demo because it was free, bored and have never played any type of football manager game before. After a few minutes playing the demo I can say I am hooked. I find myself jumping out of my chair and raising my fist with just about every goal one of my players score. I don't play any "twitch" stuff...I just keep to meself and am learning how to make the best team that I can. The gameplay is intuitive and there have been no negative surprises, like bugs or obtuse events that I don't expect. The game world seems real and the game environment just works. Like I said, the demo hooked me and, if you buy the full game, it seamlessly picks up where you have progresed to in the demo. One more thing...the teams, from individual face details to the design of the players' socks, are totally customizable. 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198056930242', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 13077, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5954, 'last_played': 1589679784}
review:
[b] ++ One-more-turn & depth [/b]

CIV, EU, TW and XCOM LW veteran here. This game is gold. For the first time since early CIVs I'm getting the one-more-turn (match in this case) feeling again. It's challenging on the strategic and the tactical level. It becomes more complex as you progress without ever becoming overwhelming.  And the best is, if you want to succeed you’ll need to adopt different strategies. In most other games I can usually settle with one or two strategies which are either op or suiting my style. Not so here. To succeed at higher leagues you’ll have to check the opposing team before each match and set up your own team to counter their strength and exploit their weakness.

[b] + Demo & Developer [/b]

Seriously, a demo? Haven’t seen that for ages. Shows some confidence by the developer in their product. And justified. Go ahead and try. It’s a fully featured one season. Just one warning, the demo starts in the lowest league, just like the full game. Little skills are needed, only a few tools are available. The full depth of the game will reveal itself only after you get promoted to the next league.

The developer really cares about their game. They listen and answer(!) to the community, and keep updating the game. Just go to the Steam Discussion and browse a random few.

[b] - Graphic & Sound [/b]

It’s good but lacks behind the AAA game play. Player models look a bit like gnomes to me. The music I had to turn off immediately. The menus are well designed though. Try the demo and judge for yourself.

[b] -- No boobs [/b]

Sadly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060686899', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 906, 'last_played': 1563655413}
review:
To be honest, I have two main opinions for this game. One concerning the turn-based soccer mechanics, and the other about the management mechanics. I'll outline both of these opinions below, but the long story short is that the game is quite good, I just wish it had a bit more to the management aspect and more controlled RNG.

[h1]Turn-based soccer[/h1]

It's a novel idea to turn a sport that would usually be incredibly fast-paced into something turn-based, and best part is, it works. Mostly.

The actual soccer matches of this game are essentially an exercise in risk-management (figuring out which dice rolls to take, whether using skills to get extra movement points is worth it, etc.) and positioning. It's a rather simple but fun system at first glance, but there is a level of depth. 

Skills are a great way to equalize the playing field between players of different stat levels (bringing dice rolls to a 10 sided dice roll for both sides), and using them at the correct time can gain you an extra point of movement that'll help you net that cup-winning goal. 

In addition, there is actually also quite a lot you can plan out in advance with your players' positioning, especially considering how different player positions (FW, CF, LD, etc.) have various passives that can activate automatically (e.g. a DM will attempt to intercept any ball passed in the square beside them), potentially turning a match around when in the right place at the right time. Seeing your careful strategies of creating the ultimate defense line play out is absolutely euphoric.

Everything above is strategic and can be planned out in advance, making it incredibly satisfying to play. However, by the nature of the game's structure it is plagued by the RNG of dice rolls. You can mitigate the risk by good positioning and high player stats, but nothing will ever 100% protect you from that natural '1'. This is my one big problem with this system, it can be crushing seeing a carefully planned last minute offensive be torn apart by bad rolls. There are some re-roll mechanics with skills but none for regular actions which can be frustrating. 

[h1]Team Management[/h1]

This is probably what I like most about the game and why I'm also slightly disappointed by it. I love the idea of bringing a team from nothing to stardom, and for the most part, the game delivers. You control what what your uniform kits look like, your logo, your sponsors, and you can even customize each and every one of your players. You upgrade your facilities as you go along, gain fans and repute, and eventually compete in an equivalent of the UEFA Championship League.

However even with all that, there seems to be a lack of distinct personality between teams. In the end, no matter what my players look like or what skills they have, the eventual goal is for them is to have solid stats, a good player record, and a contract that doesn't bleed my team budget dry. There are no unique traits for players, no quirks, small weaknesses, or even distinct goal celebrations. It is all very generalized.

This is the same problem with team customization. You can select a sponsor every season, but it's only ever one out of three randomly rotated ones. You can't build repute with them or gain anything aside from money from them. You can improve your team's facilities, but in the end you just want all of them to be at 5 stars to gain maximum bonuses. I hope you can see the pattern here.

There is a lack of uniqueness to the team you create and the players that populate it. I don't mind as much because I make stories up in my head about each of them (I personally have a lot of fun drafting people out of my team's youth academy and fielding one rookie for all games per season), but a part of me still wishes there was more personality to it all.

[h1]Final Thoughts[/h1]

The team management aspect of the game has a good foundation, but I hope for more personality in both my teams and players in the future. The turn-based soccer mechanics are fun, but RNG is definitely an aspect. All in all, good game but could be much better.

At 20euro it is overpriced in my opinion.. i'm sure alot of work went into the game but the turn based match gameplay is not very enjoyable and poor.. and it is pretty basic on content, if it's ever on sale for a tenner it'd be worth it
developer_response:
Hey, 

try, please, to get to the higher leagues. If you master using skills, crosses, and abilities of the classes, you will see that the game is much deeper than it seemed initially. 

Using skills and crosses make a lot of difference in the game.

Hope you will give the game another chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198159923964', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 12162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2359, 'last_played': 1707501359}

author: {'steamid': '76561198032854925', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 10774, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2756, 'last_played': 1633924154}
review: You can't keep your original players because they are too old and too expensive. So you have to sell them and buy new ones (less skilled but younger) in order to train them and make them superstars. The problem is that other teams train their players too, and as you learn new skills so do your opponents. As a result, in professional leagues you have to compete against teams one level stronger than you (with far more experiensed players). And that is pain, not pleasure. Not fair al least.
developer_response:
I regret you don't recommend the game. But it seems that you didn't learn the game's basics.

The game is a simulator. It means that other clubs develop their squads, sell and buy players, earn XP etc.

To successfully develop your club, you should master using skills, crosses, and abilities of the classes. Don't ignore turn-based matches. When you master the game's mechanics, you will be able to win much stronger opponents. 

Also, read all the notes of the old coach. Everything he tells is very important. For example, if your players play the matches, the interest from other clubs grow, and you can sell them for higher prices. 

It's a strategy which is made to allow for thinking ahead and planning.

But if you want a bit easier experience, I recommend you to start the game on Easy mode. You anyway would want to master turn-based mechanics but it is easy to earn money in this mode.

Hope you will play again and have fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071610096', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1352, 'last_played': 1530473016}
review: Wer einen Fußball-Simulator sucht sollte nach einem anderes Spiel ausschau halten. Wer aber ein super Fußball  Stratgie-Spiel für zwischendurch sucht, könnte mit "Football, Tactics & Glory" glücklich werden.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008711459', 'num_games_owned': 576, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 6398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3816, 'last_played': 1621250828}

author: {'steamid': '76561198119805965', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 14010, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5500, 'last_played': 1704853361}
review:
เป็นเกมที่เล่นได้สูบเวลามาก หลายๆคนอาจจะไม่ชอบ แต่เราชอบ!

เป็นเกมแนวสลับกันเดิน ฝั่งละ 3 ครั้ง ต่อ 1 เทิร์น ดังนั้นก่อนจะทำอะไรต้องคิดให้ดีก่อนเสมอ
เพราะการกระทำทุกครั้ง อาจจะส่งผลได้เสียประตูเลยก็ได้ หลายครั้งที่เป็นตาเราบุก แต่ต้องขยับกองหลังเพื่อป้องกันการเสียประตู
บางครั้ง ตาเรา แต่อาจจะได้ลุ้นเสียเป็นประตูเหมือนกัน

แต่ยังไงก็ตาม เกมก็ยังอาศัย "ดวง" เป็นหนึ่งในตัวแปรสำคัญเช่นกัน

author: {'steamid': '76561198016918112', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 902, 'last_played': 1530971353}
review:
If you are like me and love the managing aspect of football, but find FIFA gameplay too tedious and Football Manager way too in-depth, you should play this game. 

In this game you take over or create a team and join a league of your choice, you can even use real leagues and players if you use workshop content, which is really nice. Between the matches you will be responsible for transfers, contract renewals, upgrading your arena or youth academy etc. It doesn't get too deep so you won't have to spend hours upon hours on theory.

When you play a match you have a grid on which your players and opponents act. You can take 3 actions before your turn ends and your opponent can move, which most of the time needs a bit of thinking ahead and decisionmaking. It is your choice if you want to be aggressive or play for control, you don't need to take the shot, you can try to keep the ball under your control to have 3 full actions on your next turn. 

Success is calculated by a dice roll similar to some Pen & Paper RPGs. Your players have certain stats, your opponents have certain stats and the game "rolls dice" for both, and the higher one wins. Some actions or skills add raw value onto your stats while others increase your chance of failure but grant a different outcome (for example, defenders have higher stats against power shots, but if you miss they won't automatically get ball possession, instead the ball will bounce to a random field).

After the match your players gain normal experience and special experience for the position you assigned them to. This gives you the opportunity to shape some of the younger players that don't have an ideal position yet. A position/role level-up grants you access to a small skill tree, which could be a bit more extensive. Normal level-ups sometimes grant you the ability to train a new skill, which needs a lot of time (seriously, an in-game year or more to learn a new skill).

However, as fun as the gameplay is, this game gets a bit repetitive after a short time. But this may be just my own opinion. If you like the FIFA career mode or Football Manager, this repetitiveness won't be anything you haven't seen before. It's just the way football is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009299482', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1890, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1870, 'last_played': 1604242221}
review: Stupid RNG mechanics, e.g. the enemy attacker with 76rating scores 2 times in a row against my 166rating GK. Things like that happens every game and makes me feel like the ai is cheating on me.
developer_response:
AI is fair. You just might not notice when random played in your favor.

However, there is an Expected RNG when you start a new campaign. It works in player's favor a bit.

Also, use skills, master using crosses. You will see that random is not the main factor in the game.

Hope you will have fun with the game.
