author: {'steamid': '76561197966922015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 4815, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1768, 'last_played': 1575926520}
review:
Gioco abbastanza semplice ma molto carino!
Per certi versi ricorda i gestionali che c'erano su Amiga e C=64, dove passavi ore a guardare i dei bit che si muovevano sullo schermo pensando a come gestire la tattica.

Football Tactics, ha tutte le carte in regola per diventare uno di quei titoli con cui giocherai per anni, tutto diepnde da quanto gli sviluppatori aggiornerano questo titolo in quanto ha effettivamente delle mancanze.

Ad esempio non è previsto un sistema di non possesso palla (tipo pressing, fuorigioco, il muoversi dei giocatori senza palla). 
Tutto questo semplifica molto il gioco che per certi aspetti può sembrare banale, ma che alla fine ti farà  comunque passare diverse ore davanti al monitor senza che tu te ne accorga.

Alla fine, anche questa notte ho fatto le 2 e non mi sono accorto, ed è quello che di solito cerco in un gioco ;)

Nota:
 Per certi aspetti, soprattutto nell'interfaccia, Football Tactics è un po' acerbo, ad esempio quando lo si lancia, carica direttamente la partita senza avere un vero e proprio main menu. 
La prima volta che l'ho lanciato è andato in crash dopo 2 minuti, durante il tutorial. Cosa che non si è più verificata.

P.S:
Probabilmente modificherò questa rencensione tra qualche tempo visto che al momento sono ancora nel campionato "eccellenza" (serie D) e non ho praticamente visto ancora niente ^^"

author: {'steamid': '76561198043270735', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 16523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1864, 'last_played': 1654307413}
review: Fun game

author: {'steamid': '76561197962393696', 'num_games_owned': 454, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 547, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1583959564}
review:
TL;DR:

Recommended, but I'd say buy the game and try it out, IGNORE THE DEMO.


Full review:

In the game you start with a decent team in the lower ranks (decent for the rank, I mean), and you play against mostly easy teams, with only a couple of them posing any challenge. This allows you to learn the mechanics, try out new tactics, and pretty much have a great time seeing your players progress and doing awesome things.

The demo however, makes the difficulty escalate quicker by moving from 1 (or 2) easy games, one challenging game, and one simply impossible to win match.

I tried the demo a few months ago. End result: super frustrating. There's no way I can win ANYTHING if all games are this difficult.

Now, the full game is nothing like the demo, fortunately. Seems a lot more fun. Will update when I reach the higher ranks - and although I expect them to be more challanging, I trust I'll have the experience and knowledge needed to prepare awesome tactics that might allow me to accomplish something.


Suggestion to Devs: make the demo cover the whole first season. It's a lot more fun and there's no way anyone who was enjoying it thus far will not buy the game at that point.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042466270', 'num_games_owned': 340, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 19513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3636, 'last_played': 1672352169}
review:
Game is simply wonderful - it is simple, yet also wonderful. No unnecessary stuff, motivated devs keeping great communication with comunity. Truly a rear example of what early access game developement should be like.
At this stange game is completly playable and fun for like 20h without break, then it gets a bit repetative but after month or so you come back and see that  something was updated so you hop back in and another 20h goes by.
If you are into football and management, this game is a must. As for myself, I'm not that big of a football fan, but I like management and strategy games and somehow this game just clicks for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063057999', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 13816, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6977, 'last_played': 1686209734}
review:
Wow, what a game. It was already fun, but this new update has really brought it up to a higher standard by adding a lot of depth, as well as personality to the teams that you build. 

Had this game for a long time and I keep coming back. Great developers, can't ask for more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063873843', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3872, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 777, 'last_played': 1625646513}
review:
Pro: buon tutorial, immediato, tatticamente profondo e stilisticamente semplice ma molto apprezzabile.

Contro: si potrebbe approfondire di più a livello strategico.

Più simile ad un Blood Bowl o un Xcom che a un Pc Calcio, è divertente riuscire a segnare e ci sarà sempre l'effetto del "ancora una partita e smetto". Se si approfondisse dal punto di vista strategico sarebbe un capolavoro da 10. Al momento si ferma a un 8 e mezzo abbondante.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017179451', 'num_games_owned': 182, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 3286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3078, 'last_played': 1649069054}
review:
终于等到中文了，翻译质量很高而且很全面，必须给个好评。
新的改动增加了头球，传中，界外球等技战术选项；增加了更多的求球员位置，不同位置拥有不同的技能。游戏性更加的丰富了。
但是在游戏中也遇到了一些问题：
1.新游戏刚开始的剧情模式中，教程让我点击球员所在的格子，但是我点击以后没有反应，结果只能跳过。
2.用初始的RM在边路角旗位置控球，对方禁区外一格有一名我方自带1级空霸技能的F，但是RM无法传中，只能短传，挑传，射门。这个问题不知道是我使用传中的方式不对还是BUG，希望有朋友能够解答一下。（问题以解决，原来传中要点击另一侧的空白格子，是我看指南不仔细···）
3.点击球队界面右侧的战术板界面上的球员时，位置的标志符号和球员属性，不显示球员姓名很不方便，希望能改进一下。

author: {'steamid': '76561198061200712', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 15980, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3924, 'last_played': 1639605189}
review:
Lol, totaly forgot this was a Early Access, so got a bit of a hickup when i started the game with all changes. Befor it was a ok game, not the best game, but it was soft and easy tactical game where you didn´t really had to think and plan to much, so used my old tactic in the first match and it diden´t go good.

So if you look for a Strategi Football-ish game with a bit teammanager over it i have to recomend it.
If you´r looking for a bit more easy clicking around with not that much deept in to it, then you have to ask the dev to undo this update :)

If you know anything about football and somethng about teammanageing then it´s a really easy game to learn and ounderstand but i would say its hard to master, you really need to put you´r tactic right to win in the top matches.

I probably just have one negativv thing to say about the game and that is.
Some teams in lower leuage can have 1-2 overpowered players, like as if they have put all of the team money in just the 1-2 players none in the rest, and if that is a GK you cant score coz they have 100+ in skill and you have around 20-30 in skill on you´r FW and the same if it is  FW they have and you´r Gk can´t just save the shot,  it´s imposible for you´r selves to get a player like that coz of not enoughe money in the lower leuage if you even see a player like that in transferlist, 
 but after the first 2 lower leuages it do feel like it evenout more tho i have seen 2-3 team with some owerpowered players that have been imposible to score on or stop from scoring.

Else then that it´s just ++++ for the game, but with this big update i probably find something to complain about in some 50-60H more gameplay

author: {'steamid': '76561198028668377', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 70046, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18604, 'last_played': 1693160951}
review:
Un jeu gestion/tactics qui paye pas de mine comme ça, mais faut pas s'arrete a l'emballage. le contenu et la jouabilité est fun,peu etre un poil trop facile, mais j'ai testé la Beta 10 et la difficulte augmente drastiquement.


 - Vous pouvez ameliore votre club grace a des pts et de l'argent  gagné par match,pour aggrandir votre stade,ameliorer 
    l'entrainement des joueurs, ameliorer le centre de formation pour les jeunes.
 - De renouveller les contrats des joueurs ou non (c'est a 90% ce qui bouffe votre pognon)
 - Choisir entre 3 sponsors a chaque fin de saisons avec des objectifs differents
 - Et surtout, ce qui m'interesse le plus : demarrer en division amateur,puis grimper 5 divisions pour gagne la LDC avec un 
    petit club ou un club crée de votre ville qui n'existe meme pas sur google maps.

Mais vous pouvez tout aussi bien prendre PSG,BARCA,MU,CELTIC,BAYERN,SPARTA MOSCOU etc.....

review: I've got bored of all the football managers and thought I'd try something different. Football tactics is just that, a jump back to how football games used to be. There is a limit to how far this game will take me but for the price I can see hours of fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198179525937', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4907, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1093, 'last_played': 1600583134}
review:
Beaucoup de bonnes idées, le jeux est fun, plaisant à jouer et tactiquement interessant.
A améliorer, plus de liberté dans le positionnement des joueurs lord des formations, plus d'équilibrage au niveau des rapports attaque défense.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009761372', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 11467, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2050, 'last_played': 1567327637}
review:
I believe in gamers who loves games and whishes to improve them. Football Tactics is that community.

I¨ve played alot of football manager in my days. One day I stumbled across this game by random and saw all the positive reviews. Usually I buy a game, play it less than two hours and then asks for a refund. But this game, wow!

At the beginning of the game I got to create my own club, give your players nicknames and design the matchsheets. The first season you start the the bottom league, lowest of them all. Played a 4-4-2 tactic, my strikes Nils Liedholm, what a champion shot me to the second place while I kept training my defence. Starting from the back, every once in a half year you get a rookie from your youth academy, a goalkeeper. Tossed that youngster into my starting lineup thinking "one of these days, you will carry the team on your shoulders" and the story kept going, fought hard games but NEVER won a title, I advanced now and then in the systems but never got a gold medal. Until my last season, the reigning champion lost in the semifinals, I let all my pro players rest for the finalgame and won with 2-0, ah the glory! 

Theres many stories to be told but what you, if you still are reading should try, is this game. I myself and many other gamers who touched this have pitched ideas to the devs - and the devs answer. This game is still in early-access but they got big plans. You cant afford to miss this, just give it a chance.

Excellent desktop-game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007199567', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 13204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2987, 'last_played': 1508981267}
review:
Dieses Spiel ist der Beweis, dass weder große Namen noch überladene Parametermengen und schon gar nicht high-end Grafik braucht, um Spaß und Kurzweil zu erezugen.

Kämpfe mich seit einiger Zeit aus der fünften Liga nach oben, ärgere mich grad in Liga 2 rum und werde wohl absteigen, aber das ist der Reiz dran.

Manchen mag die Spielmechanik vielleicht zu linear sein - Ich sage: Thumps up für diesen Gelegenheits- oder Mehrfachstunden-Zeiträuber.

Ist fast wie bei Civilization: Nur noch ein Match, ok bis zur Saisonhalbzeit, ok aber nur noch die Transfers, dann ist Schluss - na klar ;)

Eine Fortsetzung - Teil 2 ist absolut überlegenswert. Weiter so!

author: {'steamid': '76561198035846391', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 17189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3735, 'last_played': 1693252159}
review:
Don't write many reviews, but having sunk 140 hours into this badboy, can definitely say if youre into fun management/strategy hybrids, that are detailed enough to capture your attention, but casual enough that you can drop in/out as you feel like it, then you will thoroughly enjoy this! 

After 100+ hours you will (at least I did) start to feel like maybe you could do with that tiny extra bit of complexity, mainly in the transfer window, but it really is a minor gripe, and only if youre nerdy enough to sink that amount of time into it like me! haha

author: {'steamid': '76561198066587104', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 3109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2004, 'last_played': 1664301917}
review:
I will write some things that I don't like in the game, but I don't want to be misunderstood... I definitely recommend it and absolutely love it! It is a unique idea, that all football gamers will like... 

I read on other reviews, comparisons with other Football Manager games, like FM... Just don't fool yourselves. It has nothing to do with the depth of FM, or the management aspect of it. This is the game's greatest strength, but also its greatest weakness...

What do I mean by that?

The strength is that the in-game management during the game is managed by you! For example, the decision to place a certain left CB in your defence to deal with a superb right CF of the opponent is going to hit back at you, whether you were right or wrong... This means that the stats each player have, will surely play a big part in the game, if the tackling will be successfull or not, if the long ball will make it to the midfielder, if if if.... You will feel very excited and perhaps proud, if you make right choices, but also frustration when you click the button and miss the tackle! A superb experience!

All aspects of the game point at your in-game management. With that in mind you will be looking for the right players in the transfer market, renew the contracts, or swap your players positions. That is the greatest difference with FM. The in-game management, the turn-based RPG system.

The weaknesses on the other hand of this game (in my opinion ofcourse) is the lack of one element: Realism.

I don't like the superpower of some players, the skills they can develop, with which the opponent can't react, if they don't have the opposite "super skill". For example scoring in corners, magically dribble the opponent, scoring at a great distance, make the super tackle etc. It ruins all the realism in football! I would prefer a more realistic approach... 

I also don't like the lack of movement of players. For example during a turn you can only move the player with the ball. Why? In football all players are moving at the same time. I would prefer a game where during a turn you could move all of your players at the same time, with propably a bigger pitch and not moving in squares. I know that this suggestion ruins much of the mechanism, that the game is currently built, but for me it would made more sense this way.

I would also like to see the dev team to make use and explore more elements of football, such as headers, free kicks or crosses... 

I know it's a game still on early access, but I am writing all these things as a constructive discussion and opinion. I know its a great idea, there is a great dev team behind and I am thrilled to see a game which will have the realism of FM and the mechanism of a turn based RPG game...!

author: {'steamid': '76561198116072339', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6047, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2627, 'last_played': 1634376009}
review:
Игра невероятно крутая, затягивает. Эмоции только положительные (за исключением моментов, когда инвалид уровня 2го дивизиона 2 раза подряд пробивает твоих топовых защитников и вратаря (хотя, здорово, что такое происходит время от времени)). Проблема для меня только одна: крайне глупый ИИ. Надеюсь, что со временем они поумнеют, потому что это немножко грустно, когда на последние 3 действия бот даже не пытается использовать свои пусть призрачные, но всё же шансы, а катает мяч аккуратненько на своей половине поля. 
Идея же игры очень интересная, для меня абсолютно новая. Я крайне редко играю в однопользовательские игры, но в FT я залип на 40 часов за неделю, и уверен, что это не последние 40 часов, которые я уделил этой игре.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971111112', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 150, 'playtime_forever': 381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1564725578}
review:
tl;dr needs more time in the oven, this is a game of pure exponentional unrecoverable attrition.  If you aren't setup and know what you're doing from the start, gonna have a bad time.  Don't level up right?  Gonna have a bad time.  No way to undo mistakes and just snowballs down.

I really want to like this game.  I find a lot of mechanics cool but more frustrating.  The way the game plays out is a prime example, you feel helpless when the team has the ball.  Advanced tactics seem to allude you, IE moving to players at once.  Shootouts are just RNG.  I find myself having the most success letting the AI do the matches, so actually watching the matches is really...boring after the third time.

The 'x-com' element is really just boils down to how can i make a shot in 3 moves.  If you have an ai opponent that is just smashing you on one saide there aint shit you can do about it until the half.  Any moves you want to make for a defender means you aren't movign the ball up and the same AI will just steal and shoot in the same move.  Boiler player 3 moves per side doesn't cut it.  Maybe 1 move each.  I think the dev's have watched a few matches but don't realize every action on the pitch has a reaction on both ends.  Offsides really isn't a thing.  fouls are just RNG, no slider to effect your chances on how aggressive you want your players.  

the way you level up your 'coaches' with fame is the same way you're leveling players...which is drip fed at a slow pace.  you can get 'maybe' 2-10 fame per match and every upgrade is n+2.  Meaning whatever upgrade, from whatever coach, is going to need 2 more than the last.  By an hour in, each upgrade was 50 fame and I was getting maybe 4 fame?  To upgrade a player its either 2 seasons of play or...200 fame.  At this point I was over my head and nothing I could do but lose.  I ended up leveling up my players, but then when they were retiring the players i could buy were woefully crap.  So I made it to the first league (3->2->1), then had to drop down to the second cause i had to rebuild.  But because I wasn't getting good replacements well I was still losing.  I find myself either woefully underpowered or smashing everything.  

It doesnt make sense that you use fame instead of money to pretty much level up everything.  EPL is known for throwing money at any problem but this is pretty much a no-op.  The jumps in spending are insane.  10k -> 100k -> 370k.  The most I got from a match is maybe 22k.  Most players cost 200-500k.

gameplay loop seems to be simulate all the matches, and inbetween make minor adjustements on injury or training.  End of season buy your new team then hope it was enough carry over.  if not, well you'll relegated to a league you smash so you build up your $$ (not fame) again.  

to the devs, who gives a fuck about face engine when you don't even see your players on the pitch.  I didn't even realize that one of my star players had a mowhawk until I had to renew the contract.  You're exponential costs for upgrades is absured.  Make coaches like players where you hire/fire them.  Remove the fame system and make everything money.  If you want to keep fame, then do it in building your arena more.  Use it to attract fans.  Why can't I build buildings?  Where is the training camp.  Where is the locker room.  Where is the coaches meeting room.  There is absolutely no reason for me to keep a player at age 34 when he retires in a year when I can ax him for a 6 figure payout most times.  When a player retires with the team, that's fame.  When Thierry Henry retired he got a statue.  When Ian Wright retired there were documentaries.  When a player retires here, he's just deleted.  Fame in real life is built by the player sticking with the club and it's ignored.

I really want to like this game.  I will come back to this but for now it's not enough.  Even the demo isn't enough. It gets you from league 3 to 2 which is just a cakewalk.  I won the league by simulating every match and made 2 changes to player positions at the start.
developer_response:
It's a pity that your first experience with the game wasn't good. However, I hope, you will change your mind later when you master the game. 

I want only make few notes which might show you that the game is not what it seemed.

1) Football Tactics gives you the easier way to manage your club than Football Manager. But it is not a casual game in the meaning of easy wins, easy promotion etc. Football Tactics is a football world which lives by itself. And you as a manager have different ways to develop your club.

You can try for the fast promoting from league to league, but it has the consequences. You can slowly build the foundation of your club, but it's slow. You can develop through the transfer or through the Youth Academy. You can be a footballers' farm (train weak players and sell them for big money) etc.

Sure, you have to know how the game works to make better decisions. Mastering the game is part of having fun.

2) The Amateur league is simple and has no tactics. But winning in the higher leagues requires tactical approach: using skills, previewing the opponent and finding his weak spots to counter them. Every match needs a preparation. 

Coach's notes describe the tactical elements, but I'll leave there few important notes about skills:
- train skills for your players
- learn how skills work and use them a lot because they give +1 actions for your team if performed successfully _against an opponent_
- in the first turn after kick off the skills are not available because players have to concentrate

Watching is a good mode when you know what are you doing when you prepared your team for the match. Also, if you have players with the skills, watching how AI plays with your team might help you to understand how to play better. We taught our AI how to better use different tactical possibilities.

3) Again, read the coach's notes, they explain many important things. For example, fouls are not just random. They depend on the direction of the tackle. They depend on what action or skill do you use to tackle (Sliding tackle is more probably end in foul than usual Tackle). There are many other things to take into account regarding tackles and bookings. Also, there are offsides.

4) If you don't like the RNG, start a new campaign and select "Less random" option. It makes the results more dependent on the players' attributes. The matches become more predictable. 

5) Amount of fame depends on the league you play, on the goal difference, on the opponent's power. It's hard to earn fame, but it's the same in real life as well. Also, as FT is not a casual game which allows for easy and unfair progression, upgrading the trainers is not granted. The better you play, the more possibilities you have to improve your club. As FT is a strategy, you have different ways to develop. You can put all the fame in the Forwards' Trainer, or put it in the Transfers assistant, or make all trainers average. Your choices make the club develop differently.

6) You can make money not only by selling tickets to matches. There are sponsors, for example. Select less risky conditions (like money for every match) to earn at least something. Also, you can sell your best players. It's a very good way to earn money in the real life as well. Especially for the lower league clubs. 

7) One of the important steps in the gameplay loop is preparing to the next opponent. Without it, you just blindly send your players to the match with hopes for the victory. However, the game gives many "tools" to counter the opponents' formations. Put your forwards against the weaker defenders. Learn how different skills work, and use players with the skills in the places, where these skills are most effective. Make a good defense. 

Simulating the matches is a good way of playing only if you know what is happening in the match. When you master the mechanics, when you know how the skills work, how to position your players, you will be able to predict how the match will go. Simulating matches is the same as watching matches. AI makes the same things but you spend less time. So when watching matches end as you planned, you can start simulating them. And so your preparation for every match matters a lot.

Without understanding how to outsmart opponents tactically, simulating matches is a roulette which is not fun.

8) We are still working on the updates. And soon (around 1 month) we will release a huge update which will make the game even deeper and much much more tactical. 

You can play a beta version of the update. It is still rough on the corners but main new features work. Also, the beta has a footballpedia which explains game mechanics in details.

http://steamcommunity.com/games/375530/announcements/detail/1451703867052346225

- - - - -
Hope, you will give the game another chance. We know that the game did not explain its depth well. That's why we have many negative reviews from the players who played 3-5 hours, and many positive reviews from those, who played 20-200 hours. We will improve the tutorials in the next update. Meanwhile, I'm open to help and answer the questions. FT is our dream game, we have a lot of fun playing it, many players have a lot of fun playing it. And it would be a pity if someone dropped the game not having a chance to understand how fun it is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198313625812', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 2117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 519, 'last_played': 1612034067}

author: {'steamid': '76561198120758455', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2836, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1598, 'last_played': 1664979051}
review:
So I haven't played this game that much, but I can already tell that it is going to be an addicting game. It's a really smart idea, there's not really much else to say.

When i thought I played 20 minutes, it was actually 2 hours, it's the "one more game" kinda thing.

A few things:

I think the game is too expensive for what it is, £13 which I assume is like $18, I would prefer something along the region of £8 for this. I also think, for such a small game, the face engine is too advanced, maybe saving that sort of thing for a much bigger game (cough cough FIFA).

An improvement I think would help the game is if you could choose how long a game could be (Edit: I just found that you can change the action amount, so dasisgud) , as well as adding injury time, I get pretty disappointed when I'm on the attack and the whistle blows so quickly. The games usually last between 3-5 minutes, I would love if the half was about 3-5 minutes. Idk I'm not an expert, i'm the kinda guy that will give advice and then say "but im not sure" in case they take the advice and it goes badly :P

Edit: I also really like the music :)

Ok so let's ignore my shitty review. This  game is fucking great. I wish something similar to this was used when I was younger to play Match Attax, that would bring a lot of fun into it. The developer - who I think is Ukrainian - has clearly done a lot of research, and has spent so much time on this game, that I really hope this game succeeds. The guy is clearly passionate about the game, not about the money, which is all too rare these days. Hats off to him, I enjoy this game, and I hope you do too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138636065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 3864, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2072, 'last_played': 1631124307}

author: {'steamid': '76561198050230136', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1504436834}
review:
I'm sorry but this game is shocking.. Not worth £2 let alone £12.. I've played better free to play on my phone.

If you like football you WON'T like this. This is for people who have no clue about football if I'm honest.. Sorry I hate to write such a poor review but it's a very limited game.. Not for Football fans..

It's called Football tactics? lol... There's very little to do with the tactics.. You click on a player.. Click on a box for him to run to or pass to.. Hope the other player receives it or the shot goes on target.
But it's brain numbing.. Zzzzzz

Fair to say I'm not impressed.. I fell ike i've wasted £12.00.
developer_response:
Sorry to hear that you dislike the game. However, it seems that the reason of it is that you played only in Amateur League which serves as a prolonged tutorial. There isn't any challenge or real tactics. The tactics appear in the higher leagues when you learn skills and use them smartly. There are much more than it's visible in the first few hours of playing. 

Also, you can check out the Beta of our next huge Update. It improves the game significantly on many layers. Also, it adds even more depth to the game. It's still in the polishing stage, but you can try and see yourself that Football Tactics is not something small and stupid. 

http://steamcommunity.com/games/375530/announcements/detail/1451703867052346225

Hope you will play more and do see how deep the game is.

Also, there are many mods. Subscribe to them. They will revamp the whole game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994091566', 'num_games_owned': 366, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1568721702}
review:
As a football fan and a big FIFA and Football Manager player, it can sometimes feel like Football Manager is maybe a bit too in-depth and takes alot of focus away from the actual matches and is in my opinion hard to learn from scratch, even if you know most things about football. 

This game has so far been easy to learn and is a very simple first game to get into football manager games. I would have liked more customizable features like stadium and perhaps more logos, but it is a good turn-based game with a sport twist to it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136424560', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1857, 'last_played': 1577537149}

author: {'steamid': '76561197986331836', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 4190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1474, 'last_played': 1610996913}
review:
Lovely little game. 

Really like the tactical system for playing matches. Its quite intuitive but has some depth,
to use a cliche, ''easy to learn, hard to master'.

The league, management and player progression all work well enough it seems so far, but its fairly abstract.  A well thought out and designed fun game rather than a slavish 'simulation' of real leagues.

I am not a soccer fan at all and never follow real games  however Football Tactics  is a compelling management and tactical game and stands up well as a game in both those genre's on its own merit.  You really don't have to know anything about or like soccer to  enjoy playing.

Its good currently and its early access, may become a great game ..... time will tell.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095683964', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2500, 'last_played': 1508278950}

author: {'steamid': '76561198182067230', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4949, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2922, 'last_played': 1649605479}
review:
i played a lot of this in few weeks, as a former football manager fan, i missed the feeling of developing a team
things i liked: players develop into stars, you need luck, and need investment, 3-4 players can carry you to the next league and make nice profits from rest of players, the face generator is nice, each player has unique face which helps with rpg part, its a lot of fun winning the league and making better and better team
rock, paper , scissors, lizard , spok- skilsl beat other skills, strategies beat other strategies, changing back a midfielder to defence can mean the difference between a 2-0 lose or a 2-0 win
using 2-3 young players decreases your team value and increases the match revenue, also they get xp faster, bit more micromanagement but lot of  games i used 3-4 players actively and the closest defenders, squad rotation can be nice
your decisions and strategy matters, if you like high level strategy games with a lot of random then you will enjoy this

things are annoying: RNGsus, sometimes they intercept a ball with almost no mathematical chance then score from it,sometimes you get a lucky 2-0 lead, you cover the best players and the worst guys score from half pitch and beat you in min 90 from last action
new leagues are usually way out of your league, the player prices are crazy, you cant buy new stars, you cant afford them
big teams crush you so bad you dont even have the mood to restart over and over again you just exit and simulate, so needs patience each time you go for higher league
the replay value is not the best as things happen mostly the same way
the "less random events" mode has less random, the dice rolls between 30-100% but the generator seems predictable, if your player missed 2 chances, he will score next, end of half events fail a lot. this means that stars perform always good, small teams dont really  have a chance vs bigger teams and no strategy can save you
transferable players are randomly generated, you cant really manipulate the league buying the best players of your opponents
teams are mostly random, there is no strong club identity nor many combinations on defence, skills are better then invidual player stats, so you need the right ones
second team gains no xp unfortunately so no reason to buy more players other than the starters and substitutes
players on same level have the same skills, not much difference on base stat with 4skills
player prices are kinda too predictable also, if has a skill and high interest you get a profit, if has half year training better keep it. kinda sad that most time i used players to play in games to increase their prices so my best players stayed on bench for few years
you cant possibly win every game without restarting. you cant get sponsor money for win all home victory, those quests could be changed
kinda lot of balancing issues but the base game is solid and can be built upon

overall worth the price and the updates will be good, you will have fun until you figure out how to play and what are best strategies, just one more game feeling and transfers are fun, half year of play is around 90 mins which is good for people who work and dont have time to play all day,  the simulating function helps also, i started new after my first 2 years, then again after i reached 1st league, then i won easily my 3rd run with 5 star defender train and a great keeper. but then felt kinda bad anything else, even if are many options, the best order is usually the same and the player prices still increase if you need more than a year in the league. so the replay value is like 3 runs, and maybe trying different leagues
 
spoiler:
the general strategy is like a flash clicker game, you need to specialize to something rather than put points on everything
first 3 years you need to swap all old players to young ones, and as game xp is less, bonuses are bad, so just go for younger and bigger transfer list, change all midfielders to defensive train
skills are more important than stats
one forward (or midfielder) needs to have cannon shot and control training, the other high accuracy and dribble skills
set "penalty for playing on other position" only for goalkeepers or AI will use 3 gks as defenders
one midfielder needs layoff pass and set the opposite side of your cannon shot player, offset one, so he passes, player steps into the cannon shot position and gets extra turn
long pass is good when the layoff fails, and next time you can try again.
a midfielder with tackling can reach everybody from middle and slide in, defenders are too slow for it, they only block if ball goes trough them so you can use in T shape deffence and on middle of field, kinda most important player is the sliding midfielder with high pass
defenders and gks are on defensive training always, you cnat really use defenders on midfield as they are too slow to tackle, maybe if they got layoff/long pass but not advised
best offence is defence, i even tried it with 4 substitute goalkeepers, and gk training, a great gk can stop the best attackers but in higher leagues you need decent defenders as well, usually midfield is skipped, so formations like 5-2-3 or 6-1-3 are okay, mostly used 5-3-2, best is usually 5 defenders in a line and never let them to do a cannon shot
if they got nutmeg you can block with 2 players after each other, if they got dribble skill a deep defender can still be good

i would expect more elements from fm: player potentials, scouting, a closed system transfering enviroment, more skills, more tat types, ability to teach young players, useless and useful combination of player types, more styles of play, player moral and coach talks

author: {'steamid': '76561198137363621', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 684, 'last_played': 1652488483}
review:
Football Tactics es un juego simple gráficamente, pero muy adictivo por su gameplay, que aunque fácil e intuitivo tiene muchas cosas por enseñarnos, en un principio los partidos nos parecerán sencillos, pero una vez ascendemos de división, las cosas nos serán más difíciles y las decisiones que tomemos repercutirán más en cada partido por lo cual el nivel de adicción aumenta.

Su gameplay se basa en estadísticas que no son cerradas, es decir, durante un partido las estadísticas de un jugador y las probabilidades para ejecutar una acción pueden variar haciendo que sea posible incluso ganar a un equipo superior al nuestro. El juego se desarrolla por turnos (tres movimientos por turno).

A nivel sonoro es bastante normal, algunos de los temas son bastante buenos pero se vuelven monótonos después de un tiempo.

Es un juego que al verlo no parece que fuera a enganchar… pero lo hace de sobre manera, lo único que cambiaría en él, es el aspecto gráfico que estuviese más acorde a la plataforma en la que se esta jugando, y no se que tan viable sea para el propósito del juego, pero ojala los partidos tuvieran una mayor duración, y el campo de juego fuese más grande.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064621555', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1141, 'last_played': 1626840622}
review:
Parecia ser um jogo fantastico, parecia muito bom... até que a estratégia pifia se cumpriu:

1- Jogo pago no inicio, meio mundo de promessa (e caro, R$20,00).
2- Diz que vai sair uma atualização porradona e que precisaria até aumentar o preço.
3- Torna o jogo free

Até agora foi isso, os próximos passos são:

4- Tornar-se pay-to-win
5- Compre dinheiro, compre influencia, compre até sua mãe se tiver a venda

Só queria poder reembolsar, cambada de filho da jega amarela.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106081140', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 17358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1808, 'last_played': 1683635414}
review:
Dieses Spiel ist ein vergleichsweise einfacher Fußball-Manager (es gibt nur Begrenzte Möglichkeiten sein Stadion auszubauen / Trainer einzustellen etc), ich bin gespannt ob da noch mehr kommt.

Dieses Spiel ist allerdings auch ein Strategiespiel, das an Schach erinnert. Oder Civilization. Und das macht unglaublich viel Spaß (jedenfalls mir) :-)

Allen, die das Fußball-Setting mögen, und Spaß an Rundenbasierter Strategie haben, sei definitiv ein Blick auf diesen Geheimtipp nahegelegt :-)

Was ich mir für die Zukunft wünschen würde:

- Grafische Darstellung des Vereinsgeländes und der Gebäude / Trainer
- Historie vergangener Erfolge nach Saison (aktuell werden nur Pokale für Siege in der Liga ausgestellt)
- Mehrere gespeicherte Aufstellungen. Ich entscheide mich vor den Spielen meisst für meine Standard-Aufstellung oder eine etwas defensivere Aufstellung, wenn die Gegner übermächtig sind. Diese würde ich gerne als Vorlage speichern.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093381907', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4072, 'last_played': 1595326440}
review:
I like the idea behind this game – simple football manager combined with turn based match play. This is a casual game and if you treat it like that, it will be fun.

I’m looking forward to the AI/match update. Right now is the match play is good (not great). 

I do find some things annoying like:
- I think player on the field shouldn’t be able to use the same special ability twice within one action set (e.g. use rainbow faint twice in a row) especially since some special abilities on higher levels feel overpowered.
- ball interceptions should end action set
- players shouldn’t be able to tackle the same target more than once in the action set

As for the managerial part of the game, there are a lot of improvements that could be added without adding too much unwanted complexity, like:
- better stats, on team and league levels
- individual awards on the end of the season (best scorer, best 11, etc…)
- better scouting and transfer list
- ability to save preset formations
- more info on actual stadium visitors and capacity filled

Technically, the game runs great. My only remark is that you cannot add PNG as club logo, therefore no transparency. Also, there should be an option to restore the original club logo.

Overall, it’s a good game for fair price with potential to be great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029192147', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1363, 'last_played': 1567293558}
review:
Usual first thing is comparison with FM. Obviously, If you Really want to play hardcore football and dedicate most of your free time, forget this and go with FM. On the other hand, if you would like to play FM, but you don't have time. energy. or you have a family, but still want delving into football tactics (pun not intented), get this. Cheap, plays quick, but as with everything cheap and quick, it lacks depth. The execution is superb, but if you strive for something reminiscing real life, this is too abstract. It's still early access though. It has club management, training, infrastructure, but it's all barebones.
This won't help you much, but I'd go with something inbetween FM and Football Tactics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198176725349', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 42788, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8628, 'last_played': 1709985342}
review: This is the best sports game in the world right now.  Football, Tactics, and Glory doesn't have the best name, graphics, isn't the most realistic, but it is the best.  The game captures the feel of coaching, playing, being a fan, being a general manager of a soccer team.  I hope the game becomes a franchise.  I would gladly pay 50 dollars for yearly updates...well maybe not gladly, but I would.

author: {'steamid': '76561198145427667', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1577, 'last_played': 1702649931}
review:
Allora da dove si parte,diciamo che il gioco diverte se si riesce a capire che è un gioco a turni !!
cioè scordatevi di giocare le partite come siete abituati nei vari giocihi di calcio.
Capito questo ci siamo.
si parte con la prima stragione che fa da tutorial per imparare i meccanismi di gioco;
abilità,posizione giocatori per difendere o attaccare,movimento ecc ecc...
finita la prima stagione inizia il gioco diciamo,anche se si gioca fin da subito.
ci sarà da lottare su ogni campo per far punti per puntare a l'obiettivo della scietà che viene dato ad inizio stagione,con la scelta dello sponsor importante prendere quello consono.
Se inizia a prenderti diverte molto,sopratutto la fase gestionale della squadra,vendere & acquistare bene è fondamentale.
Inolte la musica del menu è TOP, non smetterei mai di ascoltarla ahah grandi !!

Gioco consiglieto a chi ama il calcio ma in un altra visione,il che ci piace !!
ps: segnare da calcio d'angolo è una figata pazzesca peccato che giocatori con quell'talento ce ne siano pochi è il mio era vecchio lo dovuto vendere grrrrr.... ^^

voto 8 su 10, ricordando che è in accesso anticipato !!

author: {'steamid': '76561198002995030', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1813, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 806, 'last_played': 1586427466}
review:
My second review of a game ever.

Football tactics may seem very easy at first glance and very repetitive. But it isnt.

The game has some depth that you will see after you progress from the lower class off amatrur league.
I have almost all the football manager games but in the previous years i was some how "bored" of all the micro mangement.


Football tactics is offcourse not near the depth of football manager, but it isnt suppose to either.

The best thing i like about this game is :

+ You can build your own team and assign names
+ Easy to manage, not many messages to read before you start a game
+ The numbers displayed before you make a move so you an decide the right course of action
+ The fame you can implement in various things to uppgrade your skills on various positions

The only thing i think is minus, even though it is very small is that we should get more fame when you win matches, atleast in teh beggining so you can get a team going.

Going from amateur league 3 -> 2, i was amazed by the level between those 2 leagues. But when i saw that the team who came first in league 3 (i came second) also struggling liek me, made me feel better.

So there is a system:) 

I recommend this game to the fullest, enjoy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198375198643', 'num_games_owned': 44, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1527702994}
review: Very fun  and addictive

author: {'steamid': '76561197991166248', 'num_games_owned': 315, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1613332882}
review:
This game has potential but there are too many issues.  There are a lot of morons on this review section claiming this game to be the next FM or something, they are morons and nothing more, here is why the game does not work:

1. No set ups for volleys.
2. Poor UI, nothing is properly explained, why not just use a percentage calculator to determine the risk? Instead it compares 2 different stats and you're supposed to click through players looking what is happening. (UPDATE - This has had somewhat of a revamp) 
3. BORING matches, you get about 2 attempts per half, most of the time it just ends up switching possession at each others box, you can't actually work the ball back up the field and therefore you end up in this shit stain stalemate, only luck will save you then. May as well reboot the match and try again. By the time you work out of the stalemate, or build some momentum using the +turn skill abilities the halftime whistle blows.
4. This is top trumps, pretty much.  5 stats for each player...that isn't depth, all strikers do is shoot, they don't head the ball, volley it, nothing. Defenders tackle, midfielders pass, and there are auxilery stats that help ball retention such as control...k...
5. Training is none existent, players just LVLUP from XP, then you can TRAINSKILL, but you only get 1 choice until they hit 50...k... (UPDATE - This has been expanded and improved upon)
6. They brag about face models...you literally won't notice, the kit making system and badge builder is pithy. 
7. Sad sack AI, they literally do the SAME strategy every match, kick the ball to an attacker, run around, go for a shot, if they got a skill they might get sweaty with it.
8. Formations made me LOL, I thought I was going to build positional play, nope, all you do is look at your opponents formation and respond in kind, put a defender where an attacker is, put attackers where defenders are not.  The AI can't respond, so you ALWAYS have the advantage. (UPDATE - The AI will now change their formation mid game, but still easy to deal with as the game has no depth) 
9. You can't play defense, literally. There is ZERO marking system, they can run around in all adjacent squares of your defender and he will not move, the only time they will stop you is if you try to run through them, so all that happens is they build a wall, and so do you, that's the only way to stop them.  They will then, if they are lucky, attempt a dribble and woop, win win. 
10. Shooting is retarded, you may as well not attempt to make space, since you'll only have a few piddly shots, and dribbling is so damned hard to pull off, just shoot through 2/3/4 defenders, I scored more doing that than crafting a plan to breach their back line.
11. Speaking of making space, there is none, your players are CRAMMED in there tight, get ready for a boring tackle fests.
12. The set pieces are a f-cking distaster, you have to f-ck around marking people, then they roll based on their control then push you out of the way, then they boot it in.  Free kicks in field are worse, they move all their players in defense, there was literally 2 full lines of defenders in front of the box, whut a joke lads. 


In conclusion, they tried...but failed.  Ignore morons claiming this to be some sort of masterful strategy game, or the "I DIDN'T EVUN LIKES FUTBOL BUT I LUV THIS LOLOLOL." the reason why people who do not like football, like this, is because it has NOTHING to do with football, it doesn't even play like a macro match. It feels like a fleshed out mobile game tbh.  If you're an FM fan, this will bore you, it's a poor mans blood bowl through and through.



UPDATE 25/06/19

Rebooted it after the update, it's so mind numbingly woeful I forgot how bad of a game it was when I first played it.  EXACTLY the same nonsense, a match goes like this:

Kick off
Pass to Striker
Precision shot
Goal/Miss
Restart

BUT WAIT, the AI is soooo amazing, what happens now is it will use this super duper skillful strategy....drum roll: Putting 6 PLAYERS IN DEFENSE.  Sounds fucking stupid right? Sounds like something a moron would do right? Nah, it works, you basically create a line of defenders, 2 rows, very clever and then that means, lol get this, you have to do more dice rolls to score, but here's the skilful bit, the game is so shockingly bad, that all they do when you lose a dice roll is....kick the ball back up the field, and take a shot, and score or miss.  I figured the AI out in 2 games and was able to steam roll them.  Still a bad game, still cannot recommend.   I have updated my above points.
developer_response:
I respect your opinion. Part of what you say is true, but most of your points are the result of little playing. Many of so-called "morons" played 50-100-200+ hours before writing the positive review, after mastering the game. 

It seems it's not your kind of game. I assume it based on your reaction on how the real football elements (like set pieces) transformed to the turn-based mechanics. But I want to answer to show what is not really true in your review.

1) It's true. We do not simulate every detail of a football match. Rather, we want the match to represent the manager's macro decisions. Every action in the match is shown like one action, but by this action, we mean 2 minutes of the match where the players perform some less tactically important things, and which result in the action shown in the game. 

2) UI is explained in the coach's notes. There are even pictures which explain these numbers. There are some things which we do not explain or explain briefly. But we will explain them in the next update, adding a Footballapedia to the game. Back to your comment - comparing players' potential is one of the important match's mechanics. Showing percents would break some things.

3) When players write about the boring match - it's true for the lower leagues. Because the Amateur and Third leagues represent the amateur football in general. You won't see beautiful football in such games. When your players get stronger and learn skills, you will see that the matches are very tactical. Especially in the higher leagues. You won't win the Prestige Cup without tactics. Also, beating the stronger opponents is possible only if you master using skills and think ahead. And it's the only way to play in Premier league and European tournaments,

4) If players have 8-10-20+ stats but in the end of the day you are not sure why you win or lose the matches, these stats do not matter. Every stat should be very important if you are going to make important and fun decision. We found a golden middle between amount of stats and the depth of the tactics. XCOM soldiers do not have 20+ stats to represent absolute shooting reality. They have only a few, and it doesn't make XCOM a bad game. 

5) You are right. Training is nonexistent in the way it implemented in other football manager games. We don't want any part of the game to be a chore. However, we think about adding a bit of complexity to training in future. Also, the skills training will be improved in one of the next updates, giving a more valuable choice.

6) You are partly right. There is not enough places where we show these faces. However, we will add more possibilities to see your players closer. 

7) AI is quite smart there. It knows the best chances to score, so it will behave the same if the situation on the pitch doesn't change. But when you master the game and play smartly, AI will search different ways to your goal. However, I should admit, there are few things where AI might be better. For the next huge update, we wrote our AI 2.0 which supports the new, much deeper match mechanics. It becomes even smarter. Will be released soon.

8) It's partly true. Putting a strong forward where weak opponent's defender is - is a tactics from real life, isn't it? However, there are more to it than you are saying. Especially, when you consider skills. They add a totally new layer of depth when you want to win something, not just playing. There are also other tactical aspects in formations. 

9) There is no defence like in real football - that's true. However, placing the defenders is tactical and important. For example, here's a guide, which explains the positioning of the defenders: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=526764180 The next update will add much more. There will be sweepers, there will be CDs who can auto tackle the ball if an opponent moves near, there will be flank defenders. But yeah, currently we don't have those in the game.

10) Shooting through 2/3/4 defenders is possible in Amateur league, when you play against much weaker teams. But it's not a good way of shooting in Football Tactics in general. You should use skills,, you should decide beween Precision and Power shot which give different possibilities. Dribbling is hard if your forward can't dribble. Train Control stat for that. And it's one of the tactics - to have a good dribbler in the team. As I said earler, this game is based on the macro decisions. So it doesn't have the level of details of realistic 90 minutes match. But being a "macro" game, it allows to make valuable decision for 5-10min matches and have fun.

11) Sometimes it's true. Depends on your and opponent's players. It's very true for amateur football which you saw playing in the lower leagues.

12) It's a disaster if you need a 100% realistical football. Taking to account the grid and game's speed, we implemented the real mechanics in our turn-based system. It lacks total realism, but it represents the real football and allows you to make few important decisions instead of making many unimportant ones.

Again, if it's not for you - that's okay. You seem expect realism while we wrote in the game's description that we inspired more by XCOM than Football Manager even though we love football and try to create this feeling of managing your club in realistic football world. 

Other players, who love Football Tactics are not morons. They might accept the level of the conventionality of Football Tactics and by accepting that, they see football, football drama (which indeed exists there), club development (which becomes fun after some time playing the game). In most cases, I saw that when players master skills and play to Premier league, they start to see the game's depth, they start to see how their decisions shape their club, and they like Football Tactics. 

Anyway, if you give the game another chance (maybe starting a new campaign with real world mods?) and master the game mechanics, it would be great. If not, thanks for your review anyway. It shows us that we do not teach players in the lower leagues enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041530055', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 327, 'last_played': 1526070945}
review:
Schon einmal gefragt, was passieren würde, wenn ich ein Rundenstrategie Element in den Sport Bereich verfrachte? Nun, Football Tactics bietet eine sehr interessante Antwort darauf. 

Das Spiel simuliert zunächst einmal einen sehr interessanten Ligabetrieb (von der jeweils untersten Liga aufwärts soweit ich weiß) und erlaubt dem Spieler in diesem Zusammenhang rudimentäre Einflüsse auf den Verein. (Ausbau der Stadionskapazität, Verbesserung der Scouts und Trainer etc.), ohne dabei jedoch wie der FIFA Manager so sehr ins Detail zu gehen, dass man gefühlte 2 h braucht, um endlich die Vergrößerung der Tribüne zu bewerkstelligen. Hier ist der Simulationsbereich sehr übersichtlich, jedoch nicht zu einfach gehalten. Das Kernstück des Spiels ist ja per se generell etwas Anderes:

Hauptteil des Spiels sind die einzelnen Spiele selbst. Dort, wo man normalerweise, je nach Hand-Augen-Koordination, mal besser, mal schlechter, mit einem Controller versucht, möglichst viele Tore zu schiessen, haben die Entwickler es geschafft, das ganze in ein taktisches Korsett zu giessen, ohne jedoch den Spielfluss zu unterbrechen oder zu unterminieren. Jede Seite innerhalb eines Spiels hat 3 Züge für Aktionen Zeit, bevor die Gegenseite ihrerseits Aktionen ausführen kann. Es kommt dort wirklich jede Menge Spass auf und kann manchmal richtig, richtig schwer und herausfordernd sein. 

Die Entwickler, ein russisches Team, geben sich, soweit ich das bisher überblicken kann, Mühe und gehen auch aktiv auf die Community ein und schenken der ein Gehör. Etwas was natürlich weder per se immer so ist bzw. auch nicht immer so umgesetzt wird. Selbstverständlich hat das Spiel originalerweise keine Lizenzen der Fussballligen etc, aber diese kann man ohne große Probleme mittels Mods aus der Community heraus herunterladen und im Spiel integrieren. 

Ich kann das Spiel auf jeden Fall empfehlen!

author: {'steamid': '76561198386631019', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1501071651}
review: wtf is this? slow and boring. Its like chess but football....
developer_response:
Please, play longer and find out how the skills work. Lower leagues are easy because they consist of amateurs. But in the higher leagues, you will have to be smart and tactical to win the opponents. 

Here are few important tips:
1) Use skills often because if performed successfully _through an opponent_ they give +1 bonus action to your team. It's very important in the matches against stronger opponents.
2) At the kick off, the skills are not available because the players should concentrate.
3) Use Power Shot if your chances to score are not high, but you want to get a corner or to not give the ball to the opponents.

In the long term, you will see how your decisions affect your team development.

PS if you want to play with the real leagues and real clubs, you can subscribe to modifications: http://steamcommunity.com/app/375530/workshop/

After you subscribe to the needed leagues, start a new campaign.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198007619541', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 431, 'last_played': 1500885870}
review:
I bought this game for all the positive reviews and the novelty concept. I always liked tactical games and being a management game at the same time is a nice bonus. 

The overall game concept is nicely executed and fun to play. I tried to like it and would have normally spent days playing this game, if it weren't for one design choice, which absolutely broke the game for me.

You can restart and exit ongoing matches at will. 

While at first this doesn't sound too bad or severe it is symptomatic for the underlying problem. The game is not designed around you losing or struggling in a division. At the same time the game showers you with rewards, if you manage to beat the enemy by a big margin. 

Which you inevitably will. You will beat far stronger enemies simply restarting a couple of times until you are lucky and then stalling it out. You will always be first place in any division until the enemy gets so ridicolously strong that it is no fun to play.

It is a nice game with a nice concept, but I personally wouldn't have bought it.

Edit: changed to positive after getting feedback. Read the comments if you are interested.
developer_response:
Hi, thanks for the review and showing what you don't like about Football Tactics. 

The goal of my answer is to show that the game is not designing around winning everything, and there are ways to see it.

1) Not sure if you mastered using skills, but they make a huge difference in how you play the game. Because they allow you to use different tactics and approaches to every opponent, and in general - to how you build your team. 

2) We want the game to be a living "open world". In the Amateur league, we do give the weak opponents to the player. But then, the world lives by itself. Stronger teams promote to the top, weak teams fall to the lower leagues. You can develop the club how you feel is right for you. Want to level up your players staying in the lower league - do it. Want to develop your youth - do it. Want to rush throughout the leagues - you can try.

3) We want the game to be similar to the real world. Stronger teams beat the weaker ones in the most cases. But if you gathered right players, if you prepared good counter tactics to the opponent, there are high chances to beat an even much stronger opponent. 

4) When you play a lot, you can see that the match results strongly depend on your tactics and formation, not the luck. However, luck is the important factor as well (as in real football). The luck mechanics is our way to show how in the real football even the best footballers can miss the whole match, and how one stupid shot from a weaker team can ruin the game. 

However, not everyone likes how rng affects the results.  So we provided 2 ways to lower its effect. One way is "Restart" button. The second way is a game mode "Less Random". You can start a new campaign. And there will be plenty of game setting to make the game suit your tastes. "Less random" option makes the players' potential to roll not from 0 to its maximum value, but from 30% to the max value. 

- - - -

Hope you will get back to the game and have a lot of fun with it ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198138759082', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 30847, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1748, 'playtime_at_review': 15228, 'last_played': 1712455813}
review:
A great game in theory...a very poor game in execution.
If you play the matches, expect to lose 80% of the individual battles when you have the numerical advantage. It is pretty ridiculous...
developer_response:
It's always a pity to hear our players have problems with Football Tactics. We do our best to make the experience as fluent as possible for our tiny team.

However, I do not understand what kind of problem do you have. Could you elaborate, please?

What sponsorship you signed? 

There are three kinds of the deals with sponsors:

1) Deals which can be paid after the matches (small earning for a match, for the goals, for the win etc)

2) Deals which can be paid for the great achievements (get to the cup semifinals etc). They are paid after you achieved the condition. Usually, it happens in the second half of the season.

3) Deals which are paid after the final season match (win the league, win the cup, win all home matches etc).

I can't understand what the deal you have that you expected to earn $80.000 after the 6 matches. There aren't such deals.

- - - - -

There are different ways to earn money in Football Tactics. One of the ways is to grow young players (or buy the cheap ones) and sell them when they learned skills, raised few level and constantly play.

The last condition is very important. If a player plays constantly, the interest from other clubs grows. If he sits on the bench, his price will be really small.

- - - - -

Good luck with the game. Hope you will be able to recover your team and make it to the top.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048689200', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 13817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4441, 'last_played': 1612116891}
review: Ein tolles Fußballmanagement-Spiel! Besonders für alle die nicht ganz so viele details managen wollen wie in vielen anderen Spielen dieser Kategorie. Es ist einfach den Überblick zu behalten und gleichzeitig schwer genug um es Stundenlang zu spielen. Ich bin jetzt bei 55 std, wovon etwa 5 Stunden drauf gegangen sind um zu der Einsicht zu gelangen, dass ein schneller durchmarsch (zumindest bis zur dritten Liga) zwar möglich, aber nicht empfehlenswert ist... Man sollte sich wirklich die Zeit nehmen und einige (in-Game-)Jahre je Liga verbringen um die eigene Nachwuchsförderung aufzubauen (der Schlüssel zu einem guten Team) und bessere Trainer zu engagieren). Aktuell, nach 50 Std, bin ich mit einem sehr guten Team in der 2ten Liga und habe auch schon den DFB-Pokal gewonnen =) ... den deutschen Spielern empfehle ich übrigens, den Bundesliga-Mod zu installieren...

author: {'steamid': '76561198104511132', 'num_games_owned': 174, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1577509997}
review:
PRO
+制作方6月3日答应在下一次更新中加入中文
+战棋回合制足球游戏
+创意工坊弥补了队徽之类的问题
+支持Twitch联动，可以在Twitch频道留言来让观众直接操控下一步，增强了互动感
+具有俱乐部升级养成要素
CON
-虽然有俱乐部养成，但是十分贫弱，期待后续更新
-Bug略多
-BGM单调
-每进行一次行动消耗5分钟游戏时间，也就是说半场比赛最多只支持玩家6次行动，而要获得射门机会大概会需要3-4次行动

author: {'steamid': '76561198006647933', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 5035, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2234, 'last_played': 1682157570}
review:
Enjoyable game and with the Workshop content of real-life leagues highly recommended. Simulating matches works great, and when you want to play yourself, the game is very deep and really enjoyable. Football Manager light, much cheaper and much more enjoyable for me as there are not a million pop-ups and it won't take 3 hours just to start a match. Football Tactics does so much better, it's almost illegal.

Major plus for me is the ingame editor as I am a sucker for editing names. You can change names while ingame when you sign a new player. This helps tremendously for the enjoyment, for me at least. 

This game is highly recommended and an absolute steal for the discount! This game is also worth the €15, so don't delay, buy today!

author: {'steamid': '76561198055576921', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 5462, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2920, 'last_played': 1614884632}
review: Mit dem geschickten Einsetzen der Spielerfähigkeiten kann man fast jeden Gegner schlagen. Es macht Spass seinen Verein nach vorne zu bringen. Wer Fussball und Rundenbasierte Spiele mag, macht hier nichts falsch.
developer_response:
Hallo Bruno

Es tut mir leid, dass Sie unser Spiel nicht mögen. Allerdings scheint es, dass der Grund dafür ist, dass es Ihnen nicht klar war, wie man Fähigkeiten einsetzt. Das Spiel ist sehr taktisch. Aber um das zu verstehen, musst du mit Fähigkeiten beherrschen. Also, hier sind meine Vorschläge:

- machen Sie Ihre Spieler lernen Fähigkeiten
- Fähigkeiten nutzen, wenn möglich
- Sie erhalten +1 Aktion für die erfolgreiche Fertigkeit, wenn es _through_ der Gegner durchgeführt wird
- die Fähigkeiten sind bei der ersten Runde nach dem Auftakt nicht verfügbar
- ändere deine Taktik je nach dem Gegner, den du spielst
- versuchen Sie nicht, sich selbst zu spielen, sondern sehen Sie, wie AI spielt. Es weiß, wie man Fähigkeiten einsetzt und wie man starke Seiten deines Teams benutzt
- Ich möchte Ihnen versichern, dass das Spiel nicht ganz zufällig ist. Es hängt von deiner Taktik sehr viel ab

Allerdings, wenn Sie möchten, dass das Spiel weniger zufällig ist, starten Sie eine neue Kampagne und es wird eine Möglichkeit, 'Weniger zufällige' Option zu wählen.

Hoffe, du wirst dem Spiel eine weitere Chance geben.

- - -
Written in English, translated with Google Translate

author: {'steamid': '76561198025757777', 'num_games_owned': 510, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1801, 'last_played': 1674680842}
review:
First time ever writing a review, but liking the game so far.

About me:
~Mostly only play sports games
~Soccer is my favorite sport
~Just got into board games

So why do I like this game? It combines the above three points.

The PC doesn't have many sports games, especially non-text games, but this one hits the spot if you can't play FIFA or FM.

Pros:
+Fun
+Fast games
+Addictive (can't play just one)

Cons
-Very random (should have option to see nice and influence the decision)
-Extremely difficult to improve team considering everything costs so much
-You can only play certain tactics (ie: Some rows are "greened" out and you can't place players there, which negates various tactics)
-Uniforms and crests are very basic (ie: can only have two colors)

Hopefully the next update brings some positive changes
