author: {'steamid': '76561198002413545', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1441, 'last_played': 1496057333}
review:
[h1]Unbalanced RNG and rampant unfairness ruin a very promising game.[/h1]

Put about 20 hours into Football Tactics so far, I'm about ~40% done achievement wise and played through 5 seasons so far.

The game is very promising, there is a glimmer of what could be a very good tactics game, unfortunately, it's a pretty shitty football game. The AI is very binary, and with the RNG dice rolls and the way the AI gets players makes the game inherently unfair. For example;

My last game the opposing team had a Goalkeeper with ~90 defence and one Striker with ~65 Accuracy. The rest of their team was awful and did not impact on the team at all. As my Strikers are ~40-50 Accuracy and my Goalkeeper is ~50 defence, no matter how I attacked it was impossible to score, no matter how their team attacked it was impossible for them not to score. Result, 6-0 loss.

This is further exasperated by the AI. The AI knows that the Striker will score every shot. This means every turn for the AI consists of 2 passes to that striker, and a shot from max range that will always score. That's right, their League 3 Striker scored [b]6 50yard screamers in one match.[/b]


Add to this a lack of crossing or headers, defenders moving one square only (no wing backs in this game...) there are no actual football tactics in this football game. Nearly every match relies on using your best passer to play down the middle to your best striker, score. Reset, do the same again.

I've seen matches where both myself and the AI can score in 3 moves from kick off, lots of 6-6 or 7-7 draws etc. in this game.

The way the RNG works can also lead to massive swings. Whatever the stat is for your player is the max they can roll. So if you have a defender with 25 defence they will roll a D25 for every action, if the Striker has 50 Accuracy they will roll a D50. The Striker is almost guaranteed to win every dice roll.

The skill system is obtuse and doesn't always seem to trigger, a lack of defensive options (Pressing and ending the turn seemingly has zero affect on the AI), AI bonuses leading to whichever 3 teams were relegated nearly always winning the league by huge margins and a lack of management simulation, I really can't recommend the game. The training and sim systems are particularly bad, with players being sold/bought on a whim without needing to go to a team, you can't choose what to train your players in (skills are randomly allocated) and a lack of any real management beyond buying some one shot upgrades for bonus exp.

To finish up fully, I could see myself needing to grind for 20-25 seasons slowly leveling up players. [b]It's often better to deliberately lose games and finish fourth for several seasons than get promotion to a new league.[/b] Every draw and loss has a chance to lose you fans and reduce your income on a weekly basis.

Avoid unless they make significant changes.
developer_response:
It's always hard to know that someone doesn't like your game. But everyone can have its own opinion and taste. So no problem with that.

However, from your review, I see that one important part of the game wasn't clear for you. And it hugely affected your experience. 

This feature is Skills. 

When you master using them, when you start developing your team to get the maximum from the skills, you will see the tactical depth of Football Tactics. Pass+Pass+Kick is tactics for an Amateur League. To win the stronger opponents with higher stats, you have to use skills smartly.

We know that currently, it is explained not very well in the game. So I will write there few important notes:
- the skills are not available after kick off
- the skills give +1 bonus action after performed successfully _against an opponent_

So there aren't bugs in which the skills do not trigger. It's just the cases we haven't explained well.

Other than that, there are few additional notes.

1) You might feel that we intentionally affect RNG to be unfair for the players. But it's not true. There aren't any reason for us to do that. 

2) We wanted Football Tactics to simulate the random nature of the football when even stronger footballers just play badly the whole match. The RNG simulates it. But if you don't like it, start a new campaign and select an option "Less random". With this option, the effect of the RNG will be decreased significantly. 

3) No matter whether you play with this option or not, when you master using skills and building your team with needed skills, you will see that on the big scale RNG doesn't affect your results much. As in real football - if your team is strong, and the tactics is smart - some random losses won't stop you.

4) We are working on the next huge update which will add headers, crosses and other football elements to the game. The game will be much deeper http://steamcommunity.com/games/375530/announcements/detail/590375319499622407

Hope you will win Premier league with very skilled team and change your opinion about our game

author: {'steamid': '76561197998084785', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1520030606}
review:
[h1]What is it?[/h1]
THIS is the football manager game for people who don't understand football manager games, or for people who really don't know (or care) a lot about football even!  It's a manager game for people who have little patience for poring over the big spreadsheet-management games that the pros play and who don't want to be swamped by stats and the minutiae of skill points typically found in the bigger games in this genre.  This is manager-LITE!

[h1]How easy is it to play?[/h1]
Very easy - you can literally jump right in and play from the start with the very simple tutorial.  The game is mostly point-and-click.  Stats screens are few and simple.  The management functions are very basic but effective.  Best of all, you don't need to know the first thing about football (soccer to our American friends).  You can do pretty much everything that you can do in a full-blown management sim, except it's all very simplified and lightweight here.  Fans of full management games will probably not enjoy this one at all, but for those of us who could never master the bigger games, this one is perfect!

You start out by either selecting a pre-existing team (it seems quite a few countries are supported) or you can create your own team.  I picked my local town's team and found myself starting out in the lowest amateur league.  If you choose to create your own team, there is a superb player editor where you can (hope to) emulate your favourite players' faces in the creator screen if you have that kind of patience.  Once you have your team, there are no numbers to play with at this stage, so it is a case of starting your first match.  You can watch, simulate or actually play the match yourself.  Playing is easy and turn-based: click on a player, choose one of his available moves, then click to execute the move.  You get three moves per turn, and then it's your opponent's turn.  Everything is demonstrated in a simple, hands-on tutorial.   If you don't want to play and prefer to stick with team progression only, you can simply watch the game instead.  However, I found playing the match to be a lot of fun.

If you win, you'll accrue both fame points and cash with which you can upgrade your team, your club and your stadium.  You can manage contracts and recruit new players, and there is a basic screen to play with tactics.  Again, it's all very simple. 

[h1]What's good about it?[/h1]
Simplicity!  Everything is so clean and nicely presented.  No fussy user interface, everything displaying context descriptions when hovered over with the pointer, and every part of the game very simple to play, requiring no knowledge of football as a sport, or of manager games generally.  The graphics use a fun art style that I found to be quirky and amusing, and the few tables of stats were simple and self-explanatory.  A real joy to people who have no patience (like me...)! 

[h1]Anything not to like?[/h1]
My only disappointment is that, in creating a team, I cannot opt for a female team instead.  That's a bit nit-picky, but the excellent graphics style would easily have accommodated female players too - something I would have loved.  Other than that, everything is great for this level of casual game.

[h1]In summary...[/h1]
I've lost count of how many football-manager games I've bought and then not played over the years.  This one is basic enough for people who don't have patience for the bigger management games.  While it's definitely at the 'casual' end of the gaming spectrum, it's one of those lightweight games that hits a perfect balance between simplicity and the fun (and addictiveness) of a management-genre game.  If you're like me and have found the big-name footie management games a bit too much of a chore or trial to understand, then this game is for you.

Recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198166320654', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 3198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 701, 'last_played': 1682797592}
review:
Gioco molto molto buono.
E' un gioco con ambientazione calcistica e dalla doppia anima: tattico e gestionale.
Si inizia come manager di una squadra di calcio che parte dall'eccellenza per arrivare a vincere la serie A ed anche le coppe Europee. Il gioco si svolge conducendo la squadra nei vari match e poi occupandosi di impostare gli allenamenti, fare le compravendite potenziare le giovanili gli allenatori fondamentali per il miglioramento dei nostri giocatori, il fulcro della nostra economia e quindi della nostra gestione più o meno positiva anche nel lungo termine. Lo dico subuto il gioco è cmq semplice da padroneggiare, ma ciò non mi è sembrato affatto un male. E' un giusto mix tra profondità e leggerezza anche se a vantaggio della leggerezza.
L'aspetto tattico del gioco riguarda lo svolgimento delle partite: è per intenderci stile Final fantasy Tactics, i vari giochi di Holly e Banji, il Blitzball di Final Fantasy 10, oppure la mappa strategica di Civilization e Rome Total war.
L'aspetto gestionale riguarda tutto il resto ed ingloba la parte tattica che però è il cuore del gioco.
Più difficile a spiegarsi che a giocarsi: il gioco difatti nonostante appartenga a generi non esattamente entry level è molto entry level, l'approccio è molto easy, l'interfaccia è molto amichevole ci spiegherà velocemente e con grande chiarezza tutte le dinamiche del gioco, la difficoltà non è altissima, però credo che padroneggiando al meglio, oppure no, le varie dinamiche soprattutto allenamenti ed il momento in cui vendere i giocatori si possa fare parecchia differenza.
Molti i Pro, giusta profondità, allo stesso tempo semplicità e curva di apprendimento rapida, buona immersione nel gioco, sonoro gradevole, giocabilità immediata e grafica gradevole, buona sfida, buon livello di strategia/pianificazione delle operazioni di acquisto e di gestione della squadra funzionale alla crescita.
Pochi i contro e le cose che se aggiunte dagli sviluppatori (tra l'altro molto disponibili al dialogo, troverete vari loro interventi nelle discussioni) e pare che le vogliano aggiungere nei prossimi updates farebbero quasi decollare un gioco già molto buono. Mancano classifiche cannonieri, storico ed albo d'oro dei record individuali (la raccolta dei trofei di squadra c'è già) piccole cose che aumenterebbero di molto l'immersione nel gioco. Inoltre sarebbe gradito una caratteristica nascosta in tutti i giocatori tale da determinare un potenziale diverso nella crescita degli stessi. In parte già c'è ma aumentarlo farebbe la differenza sempre in termini di maggiore immersione. Forse a 15 € costicchia un pò.
Insomma gioco davvero più che buono, tra i migliori dei giochi Indie tra i quali giochi Indie anche con recensioni buone si nascondono delle porcherie allucinanti tipo Punch Club giochi molto frustranti e poco bilanciati nonchè interfacciati male.  Quindi è già uno dei migliori giochi in circolazione, credo che con quelle modifiche, che dovrebbero arrivare, possa diventare un cult game e di ottimo livello. Consigliato molto a chi ama gli strategici e consigliato, un pò meno, anche solo a chi ama il calcio e lo sport ma non i gestionali.
Sono ritornato sul gioco a distanza di tempo. A mio avviso la notevole lentezza nella progressione rende l'esperienza complessiva frustrante. Accelerando la progressione econmomica si velocizza la crescita. Non posso passare 9 stagioni tra eccellenza e serie d...anche simulando le partite sono quasi 10 ore di gioco. Mi sembra onestamente ridicolo e infatti ho mollato il gioco.
Modifico il mio parere generale: assolutamente non consigliato

author: {'steamid': '76561197998330575', 'num_games_owned': 3178, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 4226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1714, 'last_played': 1613307669}
review:
Football Tactics is a nice little mix of tactical turn based strategy, simulation, and management. You take the role of the coach for a really crappy team playing in the 4th division of your country's league.  The game does not have licensed teams, but it supports the Steam workshop and the community has been great in adding a huge amount of real teams to the game.

I did a video review that I highly recommend watching. Not only is it incredibly informative but it also shows a lot of footage of skill usage which, in my opinion, the game does a poor job of explaining.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XlCYiTCwiEo&t=25s

I was struggling with the game once my team was promoted to the 3rd division. All the enemy teams now had skills and I had no idea how to combat them or even use mine. The in-game tutorial only teaches you the bare basics of how to move, pass, and shoot. Skills are taught via the "coaches notes" which pretty much show you a screenshot of the skill as well as a little bit of text.

Videos, demonstrations, etc would have been much more helpful. It wasn't until I started to watch simulated games and saw how the AI used the skills of my players did I finally understand them.

And then I realized just how OP the skills are. Cannon shot, olympic kick, and rainbow feint are absolutely ridiculous. One of my guys, a low level forward, was able to use rainbow feint to not only get past 2 defenders but also through the goalkeeper for an incredibly easy, and unsatisfying goal. 

Olympic kick allows the corner kick guy to shoot directly into the goal. It works 99% of the time. 

The only way to protect yourself from these skills is to have defensive skills but these are extremely rare and can still fail. This works for the computer as well and it was how I was able to quickly dominate and reach 1st place of the Ukrainian Premier League fairly quickly despite only having a team with a 3-star rating and most of my opponents having 4.5 stars.

Currently, the game lacks depth and strategy. Every match is almost the same. After kick off, I pass to my forward, he gets into position and attempts to score. The shot is either deflected, caught, or goes in. Then the opponent does the same thing, then I do the same thing. However, on my next turn, I'm able to use skills (you can't use them immediately at kickoff) and then I can just spam cannon shot or rainbow feint for free goals.

It gets easier later on since the AI is terrible. They never take into account your formation and will gladly have an awful defensive one which will allow you to spam cannon shots.

I've had a match where the opponent had 0 forwards. It was 6 defenders and 5 midfielders. This team had a 4.5-star rating but it didn't matter as they could never score. Other times I've had teams that were using terrible midfielders who got into position to attempt to score but never did instead of passing to their forwards.

As players start retiring, the AI starts using low-level players on the field (instead of training them earlier after they came from the youth academy) and it is so easy to exploit that especially if the guy is a goalkeeper or defender. 

At this point, I doubt I'll be playing this again until a new update arrives. Currently, every season is the same, I win everything, my players get even stronger, and the enemy teams are even weaker as their stars retire and are replaced with low-level trash. 

However, I do think it is worth it. $15 is chump change and I got around 30 hours of enjoyment out of it. The devs are responsive and are continually updating the game.  I do recommend watching the video I linked above as it is far more positive than this criticism. This is just a collection of my thoughts after putting in about 7 after I made the video and saw that I pretty much did everything the game has to offer.

There are a lot of things that I feel this game is missing. It needs more strategy, more depth, skills reworked and more variety. I know that specified positions are in the works (defensive midfielders, offensive ones, CBs, etc) and I'm looking forward to it.

I also want more upgrades to be available. The current ones are all linear and boring. Money is only used to increase stadium capacity and improve your youth league. Fame is used increase experience gain. Using fame to upgrade the free agency is pointless and a complete waste of currency.

I think it would be interesting to add things like food, alcohol, security, maintenance, and other things. The game just feels "too basic" if you know what I mean. It's incredibly enjoyable when you're struggling in the bottom 2 divisions, but after enough time passes, you will have players with OP skills and you'll breeze through everything.

It's also odd that there is no stat decay. Your forward will perform better when he's 40 years old as opposed to 26 which doesn't make any sense. 

I'd like for the game to have replays. Sometimes, when you're losing badly but manage to win at the end is extremely satisfying but there are no replays of even goals. 

I'd also like to have the ability to change the age of my squad. It'd be really nice if I could make them as young as possible and then take them all the way to the top. I get attached to my players and loved keeping the same squad in the Master League mode of PES.

I look forward to the updates as this game was incredibly satisfying at the start and has an extreme amount of potential.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984726819', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3864, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3080, 'last_played': 1617797122}
review:
[quote]It is inspired more by the likes of JRPGs, Civilization, and XCOM rather than by Football Manager.[/quote] Maybe it is just me but I don't see a whole lot of JRPG/Civilization here but definitely XCOM.


How similar to XCOM is this game? Well, I will tackle this topic first. 

So is the game similar to XCOM? I'd say yes, to the newer ones. Enemy Unknown and XCOM2. It is actually as close to XCOM as a football game probably can be. The numbers system is a bit different here but the basic idea is the same. The game involves a lot of risk management and evaluations, around said numbers and skills. In XCOM you can use supressing  fire, in Fooball Tactics you can use pressing, which lowers the enemy accuracy, ball control etc, just as a simple example. So yes, the game is very similar to XCOM, biggest difference being that your team can't just go on the field and straight out die. They can get injured though.


So the game is awesome. I haven't encountered any bugs and its absolutely great and playable in it's current state. [strike]The player classes are simple, just Goalie, Defender, Midfield and Forward, instead of being more specific. For me, it's a plus but someone might be also wishing for those. [/strike] They added more advanced classes in a HUGE update and I was wrong, I prefer it this way.

 I also found out the default match is just too short for my liking but you can customize that in the league settings. However, I haven't found a way to change it mid-season/career so I'm pretty sure it is impossible. Kind of forced me to start a numerous new games to find the perfect lenght for me. There are also other options you can customize, i.e. no injuries, no fatigue, unlimited cash etc but these do disable achievements. [strike]Also there is no external difficulty settings I've come across[/strike] While there still aren't difficulty options per se, you can enable "hard mode."


My only complaint is that I hope the game would extend the time as long as the ball is in penalty zone. In real Soccer if you're basically still on offense, the perioid won't be whistled over. This would make late-perioid corner kicks way more interesting imo, since defenders need to actually clear the ball or get it to goaltender. But this is just my opinion and not a flaw per se.

I don't often write reviews on steam, in fact this is my second one. I feel like this small developer deserves one, and a positive at that. If you're unsure, [b]try the demo[/b].

I also had to edit my review again at 30.3.2018. I haven't touched the game for few months again. I keep playing these kind of games, XCOM, Darkest Dungeon, Football Tactics & Glory, etc, in bursts. It's literally the only thing I play for 2 weeks, I quit it for 4 months, repeat. While I've been on a break, I've seen continous updates and improvements at great speed. [b]The developer actively updates the game, asks and listens to feedback in all fields.[/b] Be it just translation issues or improvement on game mechanics. It's been a joy to follow the developement so far and I couldn't be happier with my investment.

TL;DR Amazing. Reminds me of XCOM. After the new update, I'd have to say its even more amazing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031597791', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 4918, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4918, 'last_played': 1575403482}

author: {'steamid': '76561198003086112', 'num_games_owned': 350, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1492806530}
review: Концепция игры интересная, сыграв в демо пару матчей мне понравилось, но вот потом я ее купил и все полетело к чертям. Играть чемпионат за свою команду, мне кажется, нереально. Объяснюсь, в первом сезоне я не оставил шансов соперникам, потом у меня один сильный игрок  решил уйти на пенсию, двум другим я не мог позволить контракты, в итоге обоих продал, купить нормальных не смог, так как скауты не прокачены и на рынке одно говно было. из 2,5 звезд в команде у меня стало 1,5. Думал, ладно разыграюсь, а нет. 3ий год играю в одной лиге, не могу пройти дальше. Вот яркий пример - у меня заканчивается контрак на игрока с уровнем 33(лучший бомбардир) он просит 22 тысяч на год, я могу заработать только при доманшней победе 4000, считаем - я должен выиграть 6 из 11 игр и продлить контракт только с одним игроком, а котракты кончаются у 5х. Вообщем, либо лыжи не едут, либо что-то со мной не так. Но я так и не смог выровнить экономику и дропаю свою команду.
developer_response: Возможно, проблема в том, что мы объясняем основы игры, а остальное даем игрока исследовать самим. Начните, пожалуйста, новую кампанию. Сразу же поставьте всех футболистов изучать навыки (к следующему сезону у каждого будет один навык). Научитесь использовать навыки, так как успешное применение навыка через оппонента дает +1 бонусное действие, что позволяет обыгрывать тактически более сильных оппонентов. И обращайте внимание на стоимость ваших футболистов. Продавайте старых, покупайте молодых. Чем больше футболист играет в основе, тем выше интерес к нему от других клубов. Наличие изученных навыков значительно увеличивает стоимость футболистов. Покупайте на трансферах дешевых перспективных игроков. Для начала - тактика выращивания и продажи талантов - отличнейший источник доходов. Надеюсь, вы поиграете еще и измените свое мнение

author: {'steamid': '76561198099013029', 'num_games_owned': 633, 'num_reviews': 184, 'playtime_forever': 1624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1454, 'last_played': 1575326421}
review:
[b]Football Tactics 4/5:[/b] [i]Fotbal nemá logiku.[/i] To si ukrajinští vývojáři evidentně nemyslí, když se ho rozhodli zpracovat formou tahové strategie, kde chtě nechtě logika své místo má. Soupeři se střídají po kolech a každé kolo se skládá ze tří akcí. K tomu různé schopnosti a vlastnosti fotbalistů na obou stranách a o zábavu je postaráno. Nápad za všechny prachy, jeho převedení do praxe už však za všechny prachy nestojí. Což ani náhodou neznamená, že by to nebylo i tak nebylo sakra dobré.

 Koncept samotný je natolik silný a z ranku „jednoduše geniální, geniálně jednoduchý“, že to přebije i mnohé problémy. Nejvíce tomu bývala vyčítána malá variabilita. Po pár utkáních se to zvrhlo do stejného průběhu, kdy bylo vše odvislé na tom, zda se vám ta jedna dvě pečlivě připravované akce podařily či ne. To nesporně byla pravda, ale tvůrci na tom zapracovali a takto již pěkných pár měsíců pravda není. Navíc jde stále o předběžný přístup. A v tomto ohledu jde o ukázkový přístup ze strany tvůrců; časté updaty, úzký kontakt s komunitou co se nápadů a změn týče či aktivní modérská komunita skrze Steam Workshop (čili nepřítomnost licencí tím pádem není problém). Navíc hra samotná je již cca rok hotova; pilují se pouze detaily; kupříkladu pencle jsou stále "poněkud divné". Druhý vyčítaný aspekt je, že se to při delších seancích přejí. To sice pravda je, ale nejde o Football Manager, kde trávíte (desítky) hodin na jeden zátah. Tohle je určené k odehraní několika mála utkání jednou za čas. A v tomto módu to funguje bezezbytku. Vyčítat tomu, že manažerská omáčka mimo zápasy samotné je až příliš ochuzená sice lze, ale otázkou je, zda cokoli více už by hru neposouvalo někam trochu jinam. Sám bych to jen a pouze ocenil, ale chápu, proč to tu nemá své místo. A ano, nesporně kvůli všemu výše zmíněnému to jednou bude jako dělané pro tablety; v malých intenzivních dávkách, na tahy, lehce uchopitelné, přitom chytlavé a plné možností.

 Největší problém je tedy paradoxně v tom, že se v tom stále skrývá ohromný potenciál a vyloženě z toho čiší, kudy se šlo vydat dále. Jenže tvůrci po některých cestách jít nehodlají. A tak třeba nelze pracovat v rámci akcí/tahů s rychlostí míče, hra (až na animace) nebere v potaz hru vzduchem čili se nikdy nedostanete do situace, kdybyste před sebou měli padající odražený míč a bylo jen na vás, zda byste investovali jednu akci do jeho zpracování či akci pošetřili a zkusili ho napálit na první dobrou, branková konstrukce nehraje žádnou roli čili tyč nikdy nedáte, nelze úmyslně zakopnout míč do zázemí při potřebě střídání/přerušení hry, nelze v zoufalství nakopnout nazdařbůh mičudu přes celé hřiště v bláhové naději na vyrovnání a tak se vám klidně může stát, že na konci zápasu máte sice míč, tři akce a potřebu vsítit branku, ale jste tak daleko od soupeřovi brány, že není šance se k ní dostat a vypálit apod.

 Detaily? Nesporně, ale právě podobné detaily iritují tím více, čím více času v tom utopíte. A i navzdory výše uvedenému v tom lze utopit času nepočítaně, jelikož základní koncept sám o sobě prostě a jednoduše neoddiskutovatelně chytlavý a zábavný je. A to tak že opravdu (ale opravdu) hodně.

 [b][i]PS po čase:[/i][/b] Tvůrci komunitě vytrvale a pozorně naslouchají a tak mnohé výše uvedené výtky již neplatí. A tak lze nyní plnohodnotně centrovat do výskoku na hlavičku, přibyla zónová obrana, míč může opustit hrací plochu čili hrají roli auty i výkopy, máte ještě více volnosti, co i kam s ním apod. Navíc ostatní týmy se vyvíjí v průběhu sezóny, upravují taktiku v zápase, byly rozšířeny manažerské aktivity mimo zápasy a... No prostě je toho habaděj a pěkný veletucet vylepšení je ještě na dohled.
 ------------------------------------------------------------------

author: {'steamid': '76561198041284120', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1614, 'last_played': 1531487329}
review:
Creo que la idea del juego es muy buena, hacer un juego de fútbol por turnos añadiendo la propia gestión del club. Sin embargo, se queda bastante corto en todos los aspecto:

Pros:

- La dificultad es bastante adecuada, al principio cuesta ir ganando partidos y cuando subes de categoría notas la diferencia y sufres por mantenerte, pero es lo divertido de un juego de gestión.

- Hay bastante ligas y equipos "reales" (no tiene el nombre original pero se conocen). Podrían aumentar un poco la variedad de nombres, tenían cuatro jugadores con el mismo.

- El menú es bastante intuitivo y simple, que muchas veces es lo que se pide a estos juegos, un poco más de simpleza.  

contras:

- Los partidos son muy básicos y para mi gusto, demasiado cortos. Tienes tres movimientos para subir el balón y chutar o aguantar la bola, con lo cual la estrategia es bastante escasa y si no tienes buenos jugadores, es imposible meter un gol.

- La simulación es muy limitada. No puedes realizar ningún ajuste ni hay una pequeña retransmisión. Tan solo puedes realizar cambios en el descanso.

- El crecimiento de los jugadores podría ser diferente. Todos crecen por igual, tan solo varia la diferencia de edad.

Dicho esto, entiendo que es un juego en desarrollo y yo realmente amorticé la inversión. Daré mi voto positivo pese a que pienso que hay mucho por mejorar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198262374563', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1492469666}
review: Es un buen juego pero demasiado simple, parece mas bien de móvil. Si hiciesen el campo más grande, hiciesen más movimientos, alargasen la duración de los partidos... sería interesante. No digo que no sea un buen juego de estrategia, pero con las posibilidades que te da un ordenador se puede hacer mucho más que esto.
developer_response: La liga amateur es un tutorial donde tiene pocas posibilidades y sus enemigos son en su mayoría débiles. Pero cuando a dominar el uso de habilidades, verá que hay un montón de profundidad en la táctica porque las habilidades añaden 1 acción gratuita si se realiza con éxito contra un oponente. Mediante el uso de habilidades, usted será capaz de ganar tácticamente partidos contra rivales mucho más fuertes. Espero que va a jugar más y maestro utilizando habilidades. Son un interruptor de juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049110934', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 594, 'last_played': 1541623053}
review:
Una gran idea en la que se mezclan Futbol y estrategia por turnos.

El juego aun esta en desarrollo por lo que aun le falta mejorar muchos detalles, pero los desarrolladores son activos y van mejorando o implementando nuevas funciones al juego cada poco tiempo. Aunque no tiene las licencias de los equipos y jugadores de las ligas puedes usar el workshop para ponerlas sin problemas.

El mercado de fichajes a dia de hoy es algo muy simple, pero tienen pensado mejorarlo de forma que haga del juego una experiencia mejor como en cualquier otro simulador de futbol.

Para cualquier amante del futbol y la estrategia por turnos este es un juego a tener en cuenta y si los desarrolladores lo llevan por buen camino (que por ahora van bien) sera un gran juego capaz de hacer sombra a otros juegos "mas importantes".

author: {'steamid': '76561198004129073', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 3163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 899, 'last_played': 1654974152}
review:
My Football Tactics review.

My mate stumbled across this by accident at 9pm. We're both FM fans and thought this was something out of the ordinary.
We decided it looked good and bought it.

Quick download

Into the game, set up club, quick tutorial. Boom. Into it, helping each other learn the game.

He left at mindnight.

It's not 2:50am. I need sleep.
Goodnight.
10/10 - Would stay awake again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057906566', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 355, 'last_played': 1489755285}
review: Z počátku jsem byl k téhle hře skeptický, ale když jsem si nastavil hned od počátku co nejtvrší podmínky, tak musím uznat, že už hraji několik hodin a stále mě to baví. Nutno podotknout, že nejsem fotbalový fanoušek, tudíž kladná recence o něčem svědčí. Osobně bych uvítal jestli by šlo do hry vložit další efekty krom vlivu počasí. Například spojené s fanoušky, tiskem, investory a podobně. (Měl bych i nějaké konkrétnější nápady, které nebudu rozepisovat) Možná i nějaké historií inspirované scénáře a podobně. Možná bych ještě upravil velikost hlav hráčů, chápu pravděpodobnou účelovost, ale tahle věc mi po grafické stránce vadí asi nejvíc. Každopádně hra mě velice baví a šlape naprosto čistě, což je u předběžného přístupu velký úspěch, budu se určitě těšit na finální podobu hry. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198001684848', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 455, 'last_played': 1489570235}
review: Great game. was only going to play for an hour.... 6 hours later!

author: {'steamid': '76561198047936725', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1488496096}
review: As someone who loves management games, this is way too simplistic. Each match lasts 2 turns which is a bit ridiculous considering how long a soccer game really is. Who in their right mind would think 'very little micromanagment' in a management is a good thing? Good for people who aren't interested in management games I guess.
developer_response:
I just want to mention what is not true in the review:

- The matches last at least 48 turns (without added time). Each turn consists of 3 actions. Also, players can make the matches to last longer when starting a new campaign. When you learn how to use skills, the matches become very tactical and dynamic. The Amateur league is kind of tutorial so it's very easy and not tactical.

- That's true that the management part is not very big. However, even in its current state, it gives you the fun of tactical and strategical building your team. The next updates will bring much much more depths in the team building but even now it has a lot of depth to consider. 

Hope you will play more and see what I'm talking about

author: {'steamid': '76561198081102006', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 6597, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1470, 'last_played': 1606391808}
review:
It gets old pretty quickly. Wait until it gets on sale with a big discount, otherwise it isn't worth the purchase. 

The amount of movements and plays you can create in this is pretty limited. You'll get the hang of it quickly and pretty soon you'll be simulating the whole thing.
developer_response:
I might be wrong, but usually, we hear such reviews when players haven't mastered the skills. When you understand how they work and how to use them tactically, you will see that there is a lot of depth. Because the skills allow your weak team to beat much stronger opponents.  

It doesn't neglect the Simulation, though. But when you use the skills, the simulation just allows you to simulate the matches which aren't important.

If you give the game another chance, use please these tips:
So if you give the game another chance, I'd give you some tips:

1) At the first turn after kick-off, the skills do not work because players are concentrating
2) Learn new and upgrade learned skills on the trainings. It's very important
3) Skills give you +1 bonus action when successfully used _against_ an opponent
4) Kick on the goal as close to the opponent's goal as possible
5) If the chances to score are low, use power shot to get some chance of having a corner
6) Pay attention to your footballers' price. The longer they play in the main team, the higher interest of the other clubs is, and so the higher their price
7) Before every match, look at the opponent's formation and change your formation to use your strong sides and opponent's weak sides

Good luck!

author: {'steamid': '76561198037154859', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 13049, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2103, 'last_played': 1641676075}
review:
Football Tacticts ist ein Spiel mit sehr viel Potenzial.Es erscheint einen anfangs recht "simpel", aber wenn man einige Stunden gespielt hat und die Möglichkeiten entdeckt hat wie man seine Spieler richtig einsetzt, merkt man die taktische Tiefe. Man darf bei dem Spiel auch nicht vergessen, dass es sich noch in der Early Access Phase befindet.

Was mir hier noch ein wenig fehlt ist die Verbundenheit mit seinen Spieler z.B. wäre es cool wenn ein Spieler seine Karriere beendet und z.B. wenn er mehr als 150 Spiele für seinen Verein gemacht hat er in den Trainerstab gehen kann(Prestigegewinn), um einen die Entscheidung zu erschweren ihn vorher zu verkaufen! Und es fehlt noch die Möglichkeit eine  Teamkaptian zu wählen.

Freue mich schon auf das nächste Update!

author: {'steamid': '76561198177470921', 'num_games_owned': 45, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1535986630}
review:
Juego creativo, estrategico y divertido. Desde 3ra division hasta 1ra division de élite, he pasado horas jugando a este juego, como maximo, pediria comentaristas, pero eso es lo de menos. Es un juego en el que apenas encuentras fallos, tiene lo justo, no hace falta quitar ni añadir nada, a pesar de algunas mejoras en las fisicas.

Los 15 Euros mejores gastados.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007375281', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 18363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4367, 'last_played': 1710688245}
review:
Avis version Décembre 2022. 

J'ai restesté le jeu pour voir si il a été amélioré, ben ... voila, je tente une "tactique" avec un joueur qui a 55 en passe pour faire des centres vers des joueurs qui ont 2 et 3 en niveau de jeu de tête. Je marque, 1X sur 4. La passe rate presque toujours. 
Je remarque l'IA qui fait pareil avec un joueur qui a 16 en passe, il à réussit 6X de suite, j'ai pris 6 buts. bref, toujours aussi ridicule.

Suggestion pour rendre le jeu plus fun ... Au début des matchs, faire lancer un jets de dé pour les deux équipes, un jet compris entre 1 et 5 pour le joueur et entre 8 et 100 pour l'IA, celui à le plus, gagne le match automatiquement. Vu que de toute façon, c'est comme ça que se déroule 100% des actions du jeu. (jeu tactique, ... la bonne blague)

Update 03 Janvier

Depuis que j'ai relancé ce jeu, et modifié l'avis ci-dessous, j'en viens a mon avis Final. Ce jeu est bel et bien gaché. Toujours en fin de tableau en ligue 3. Avec des joueurs supérieurs a toutes les équipes adverses, math toujours perdu sur les jets de dés. Même avec des joueurs dont les niveaux sont les doublés des stats confrontée de l'IA, 70% des actions sont des échecs. L'ia réussit toujours des enchaînement de 4 à 5 actions successives alors que mes joueurs ne peuvent en réussir plus de 2 à la suite. Frustration totale, un jeu avec un potentiel incroyable. Simplement gaché par un système de jet de dés aléatoires complètement ridicule.

Vous pouvez faire la meilleure tactique possible, si les dés ne sont pas de votre côté, vous perdez le match.
Ne faites aucune tactique et mettez n'importe quel jouer à n'importe quel position, si les dès sont avec vous, vous gagnerez. Preuve que le côté aléatoire est plus important que la tactique, et donc qu'il ne s'agit PAS d'un jeu tactique.

Quand je lis les commentaires des développeurs, qui disent que l'IA est équilibrée sur les jets de dés, c'est se moquer des gens qui leurs ont versé de l'argent pour développer ce jeu de Foot, Tac.. , heu, jeu vidéo de Football purement aléatoire.  

---

J'ai acquis le jeu à ses débuts. Je relance ce jeu après de nombreux mois sans y avoir joué. Et malgré le travail que le jeu a subit, mon impression ne change pas. Un jeu avec du potentiel de stratégie complètement gâché par des tirages de "Dés" à la ramasse. Ca ne sert à rien de faire un jeu dit "tactique" quand le résultat complet d'un match, se joue sur un seul lancé de Dés. Qui reste a 80% à l'avantage de l'IA. J'ai retenté 3 matchs aujourd'hui. Sur 6 petits ponts tenté, j'ai obtenu 5 echec, quatre "1" et un "2". Le seul jet qui a fait "7" a rencontré un "8" en défense. J'ai l'impression que quand le jeu exécute les jets aléatoires, il y 60% de chance de nous sortir un chiffre entre 1 et 10, même si vos persos dépassent les 50 ou 60 en stats. Bref, pas un jeu pour les fans de jeu tactique, mais un jeu pour les fans d'aléatoires. 

Pire encore, lors d'un match sous canicule, j'ai remarqué que TOUS MES joueurs avaient des stats diminuées, dans le rouge, mais aucun malus pour les joueurs de l'IA. si en plus la météo n'affecte que nous et pas l'ia....

Avis depuis la version 10.

Ce jeu était prometteur au moment de la Beta, aujourd'hui, toutes les modifications apportées ont ruinés le jeu, les compétences des joueurs ne servent plus à rien, tellement il existe des effets de jeu qui vous les annules, les lancé de dés CPU/Joueur sont toujours à l'avantage de l'ordi, l'IA est complètement cheatée a ce niveau, les matchs sont maintenant soporifiques, il est devient quasis impossible d'avoir des occasions de but et quand vous parvenez à tirer, votre tireur doit réussir un ensemble de 2 à 3 jets de D qui sont de toutes façons toujours à l'avantage de l'ordi. Sur une suite de 6 matchs, j'ai obtenu 6  ... 0 - 0 avec de chaque coté 0 - 0 occasion de buts, du n'importe quoi ! 


bref vous l'aurez compris, comme on dit, a vouloir en faire de trop, on va trop loin, le jeu s'est ruiné de lui même alors qu'il était prometteur. 



Avis précédent : Vraiment un chouette jeu, quand j'étais gosse j'avais un jeu de foot de "société" que j'adorais, très simple, se jouant aux dès, et je retrouve le même plaisir avec celui-ci. On est loin de l'animation d'un vrai match de foot, mais ce jeu est plus tactique qu'il y parait, surtout après quelques heures de jeux. Au début, on se contente de passes et de tirs, ensuite, on se rends vite compte que les compétences sont très importantes, une fois en ligue 1, il est impératif de mettre sa formation en fonction de celle de l'adversaire, bien observer les stats des adversaires et leurs compétences pour savoir comment contrer ces joueurs et mettre en place nos meilleurs joueurs en fonction des faiblesses de chaque équipe rencontrée.
Le positionnement est très importants les matchs sont court, on a droit a 4 tours par mi-temps, ce qui laisse peut de marge de manoeuvre et donc savoir a l'avance ce qu'on veut faire, il arrive de devoir changer le positionnement rapidement car on a laisse un trou dans la formation que l'IA exploite. Vraiment un bon jeu, qui mérite de s'y intéresser.

C'est en étudiant correctement la stratégie que je me maintiens dans la première partie de tableau de ligue 1 avec une équipe de 2,5 étoiles. Même au niveau des entrainements, j'ai boosté mes milieux de terrain en Défense afin qu'ils coupent plus souvent les lignes de passe et j'ai booste les compétences Controles de mes attaquant au détriment de la précision pour temporiser efficacement et ça marche, la plupart des buts étant marqué grâce aux combinaisons de talents Tir Canon et Coup de Sombrero. Vu qu'avoir un joueur de précision a plus de 100 points ne garanti rien, puisque les jets de dé IA ne sont pas équilibrés.

Et avec les annonces de la prochaine update, et les nouveautés stratégiques présentées, il me tâte que cela sorte, bien comptant d'avoir profité de l'accès anticipés. 

Gros défaut par contre, les actions se jouent trop sur un résultat de dés qui n'a rien d'aléatoire sur les matchs importants,c'est à dire les matchs de dernier carré de coupe et contre les adversaires qui ont deux étoiles de plus,  l'IA étant vachement avantagé sur les résultats dans ces matchs et je trouve dommage de devoir cheater l'ia pour avoir de la difficulté a l'image de ce que fait une autre licence de jeu de foot que j'ai abandonné justement a cause de cela. 

J'espère que l’algorithme de calculs des actions sera rééquilibré, car passer 10 saisons pour avoir un buteur avec 115 de précision pour qu'il ne sorte jamais une valeur supérieur a 30 dans ses frappes c'est frustrant, surtout que l'ia avec un joueur de ce niveau nous sort des frappes a 80 minimum 6 fois sur 10. C'est comme l'ia qui égalise très souvent sur une action qui suit un but 9 fois sur 10 en coupes qui démontrent plus une volonté de programmation que d'un hasard.
Tout comme les Corners, 90% des frappes puissantes de l'IA dévient la balle en coup de coin, chose beaucoup plus rare quand ce sont nos joueurs qui font des frappes puissantes..

Bref, juste pour moi, cette problématique de lancé de dés IA à revoir...

J'attends la suite, continuez de faire du bon travail, ce jeu a vraiment du potentiel :)

EDIT : Je confirme que si Football tactics veut se faire une place parmis les jeux intéressants, changez le cheat IA .. depuis que je suis en Champions league laissez tomber, les résultats de dés sont du n'importe quoi. Même les compétences de niveau 3 contre des adversaires sans les contre-compétences, ca passe jamais ... C'est limite se moquer des joueurs sur ce coup !

author: {'steamid': '76561197962971695', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 249, 'playtime_forever': 14466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4040, 'last_played': 1638126971}
review:
A simplistic little turn based Blood bowl game. Doesn't require a lot of thinking, but there is enough strategy here for the price with regards buying players, contracts and player formations. 

After that it's all dice rolls. I'm not sure how frustrating it could be just "going through the motions" earning enough cash to get better players - there's no club management/advertising (etc), or any 1 time "pop up decisions" that could change the game enough to keep it varied.

After getting promoted you are just waiting for cash every game. Maybe worth £5-6.

EDIT: I have over 60hrs on this. You can just fire up a game, and play for 5 mins and quit again. Fun to pass the time, and you can play 1-handed if you are bottle feeding a newborn.

author: {'steamid': '76561198179698638', 'num_games_owned': 203, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 974, 'last_played': 1542428100}
review: Sehr einfach gestrickt, trotzdem sehr nice aber leider vergeht die Zeit sehr schnell bei dem Spiel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060949602', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 41103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 4591, 'playtime_at_review': 11529, 'last_played': 1712439952}
review:
WOW !
If you are old enough to fondly remember the original Football Manager by Kevin Toms then this will take you right back there.
Naturally, it's a bit more elaborate but the basic idea is still there. The beauty of this game is it's simplicity. Enabling new players to quickly get to grips with the mechanics. 
Slowly progressing up through the ranks you will be enthralled & at times downright annoyed by those 'shock' results. Nonetheless you will progress each season & eventually lift those trophies.
Althoigh i said 'slowly progressing' , you can finish an entire season on an hour or two. For me, that means many seasons can be completed in a day.
I love this game.........10 / 10.

Impression following latest update.....
Love the extra strategy which is added & it's not too complicated or over-involved like most footy management games nowadays.
Personally, i prefer to play with 'Simulated results' ( Quick game ). Only problem is the frequency of red cards, especially during cup matches. These can totally screw your season.

Very happy to have this in my library :)

Since the dlc 'Manager's journey' the game has become a bug ridden mess. Constant crashes to desktop. I have now removed it from my library.
What a shame. Used to be great. Then they 'improved it' !!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198086019182', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 30593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11452, 'last_played': 1644437084}
review:
Un jeu simple, tournant aisément sur tous PC. Une nouvelle mise à jour ajoutant tellement de profondeur (postes, motivation refaite, nouveaux talents, débuter en ligue 1/2, les têtes); un mode modifier exceptionnel tout simplement.

Achetez-le sincèrement, au pire ça ne sera qu'un passe temps mais dans le meilleur des cas vous oublierez FM pour moins de prise de tête. Que vous connaissiez le foot ou non, que vous aimez la gestion ou non il plaira à tous.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077855399', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1500387426}

author: {'steamid': '76561198017380437', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 877, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1552238873}
review:
Tipp Kick Strategie mit Manager vereint.
Die herkömlichen aktuellen Fussballmanager Spiele sind mir alle mitlerweile zu aufwendig und umfangreich und gefallen mir nicht mehr.Dort dauert es eine Ewigkeit und soviel Zeit hat kaum noch jemand heutzutage.Dieses Spiel ist genau richtig für zwischendurch aber auch für längere Zeit.Spannende Taktik mit guter Werte und Zufallsberechnung und toller Fussballmanager Eigenschaft.Der Kauf hat sich gelohnt und das alles zu einem fairen Preis.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067749651', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4056, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1319, 'last_played': 1488568133}
review: just love it, so addicting, like FM but more interactive and a lot simpler

author: {'steamid': '76561198121447875', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 8804, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1053, 'last_played': 1607753342}
review:
Bester Fussballmanager zu Zeit! Sehr straight, nicht überladen, macht riesigen Spaß zu spielen und erinnert an die besten Zeiten der Ascaron-Games. Unkompliziert, bekommt mit der Zeit Tiefe, innovatives Spielsystem.

FT ist ein wenig an das RTS Prinzip angelehnt. Wie bei einem rundenbasierten Spiel hat man pro Spielzug 3 Zugmöglichkeiten, bei der man sein Spiel entwicklen, Tore schießen oder dem Gegner den Ball abnehmen kann. Die Spieler entwickeln sich weiter und können bestimmte Fertigkeiten erlernen.

Stadionausbau, neue Trainer und andere Erweiterungen sind möglich, allerdings ohne dass man dafür einen Wochenendkurs für das Spiel absolvieren müsste.

Die Gesichter der Spieler kann man wohl anpassen, habe ich aber noch nicht probiert. 

Einen Nachteil hat das Spiel: man kann sehr schlecht aufhören, es zu spielen. Ein Spieltag geht immer noch. 

Unbedingte Empfehlung!

review: 玩了一段时间  感觉内容还是比较单调的  另外希望制作组取消只看比分的比赛模式  不然真的忍不住只跳跳跳比赛了

author: {'steamid': '76561197997604753', 'num_games_owned': 70, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 27763, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14252, 'last_played': 1695663320}
review:
Becomes better and better with each update...


One of the games I've had most fun with. 
There are so many positive reviews recommending the game and giving the details of the gameplay. I would like to just add some advice for a better gameplay. I dont know if the developer agrees with me, but:

- Goalkeeping should be a seperate ability other than acc, pass, def, and ctr. Both GK and DF depend on the same ability: defense. So, you can play a GK in DF position, or vice versa. (I know there is a "penalty for playing on other position" option when starting the game, but after playing a couple of seasons the AI teams start to play GKs on DF positions, and they are as good as DF players).

- I think it would be better to have "highlighted tiles" with different color than green. Pitch is already green. (Also the tile color can change according to the skill that can be executed on that tile. As an example, the tiles that an MF can pass/loft pass have different color than he can layoff pass.) 

- It would be better to see a statistics screen of footballers (games played, goals, assists, yellow/red cards, etc.) at the end of the season (or anytime we want)

author: {'steamid': '76561198332668999', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1486667683}
review: Hands down one of the best games, developers keep up good work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014438581', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 68076, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 63, 'playtime_at_review': 21904, 'last_played': 1712441576}
review:
This game is great - A simple football management game without the endless tedious micromanagement of the usual football games.

I love the tactics side.  It seems overly basic at first, but the longer the game goes on, the more the possibilities open up. 
At first I would just punt the ball up to my best striker and hope for the best.  But now I'm finding myself running the ball down to the corners to cling on to a 1-0 lead - or pinballing the ball around in midfield to get the other team out of position.

Although it is early access, it has no issues that i've come across (although a bit more depth & detail would improve things a bit).   

Games are balanced - no stupid 10-0 games - and once you get the hang of using the special skills you can produce some magic on the pitch every now and then.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994726896', 'num_games_owned': 203, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1916, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1583, 'last_played': 1486397995}
review: 玩了两天，从最低级别联赛一路上来，现在拿到了两个联赛冠军，一个杯赛冠军。球队评星达到了4.5星。基本后面只剩下AOFA杯和亚洲杯了。虽然游戏比较简单但是容易上瘾。FM外较少能这么上瘾的足球游戏了。强烈推荐！

author: {'steamid': '76561198114183825', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3047, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3047, 'last_played': 1486387804}
review: awesome game :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198004191766', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 373, 'last_played': 1671252103}
review:
What an amazing take on the soccer management genre.Simplicity itself is the key and fun, rather than arguing out who can play with who or negotiating a contract, it puts you straight away in the heart of things! Yes it`s a bit like chess, but, isn`t football like that also some times? If you could extend the leagues to involve lower league sides, (I am currently playing as Chorley ,but would like an official nod to the lower league sides) i think you would have cracked the FM trophy no doubt!!
Brilliant and made me feel like i was a kid playing Championship manager again!!
Well done and keep up the good work!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198018129650', 'num_games_owned': 663, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 3651, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1817, 'last_played': 1612224212}
review:
Only a couple of hours in, but felt the positive review was deserved as a show of support. 

There are some great reviews describing the game so I won't go into that. The gameplay has that satisfying "one more game" feeling, while still being relaxing as it feels fairly casual. 
Considering that some more content is coming, the game should end up being a very solid title. It is early access but there is already a fun game to play!

I stumbled upon the game randomly, and it's quite a nice surprise. If you enjoy turn based games and a touch of management, you ought to at least try the demo.

EDIT: Game is released, a ton was added since this review with major changes. The game has a lot more depth yet still remain very relaxing to play and not a number cruncher. One of the best "early access to release" game I played. Well done devs, looking foward to your future products, professionals have to be rewarded in this day and age. 

Edit2: Game has received a lot of updates, it is much more in depth now and lost some of its casual appeal. But it was worth it, great game.

Edit3: Got back into the game with the latest DLC, major improvements, DLC is definitely worth a purchase too.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995288381', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 3301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3237, 'last_played': 1640666383}
review: After having given this game 1 year and 8 months I have decided this game belongs on Kongregate.com not even close to what it should or could have been and I am convinced many of the reviews came from dev accounts.. absolutely try the demo first
developer_response:
Hi! Having fair critique is fine with us because we need feedback. But saying that the game is a scam and that the amount of the problems is ridiculous without a list of at least 10 big problems which are really a problem which don't allow you to have fun - it's just emotions which are unfair. So I want to answer to your review:

1) Random. 
Higher chances do not give you a right to expect 100% success. You might just have higher chances. The game doesn't help you or AI, it's just simulation of the luck in real world where even top class footballers can miss the whole match.

But! If you don't like it, you can start a new campaign with Less Random option. It is made for those who want more predictability.

2) Corners. 
The game explains few times that if you want to have more corners - take a position close to the opponent's goal and use Power Shots. AI uses it often. That's why it has more corners. No hidden tricks. 

3) You are saying that you can't see your players in the game, but you can. 
Not close enough, we know that. But at least you can recognise them. 

We are a tiny team which spends all our time and love working on Football Tactics. But still we are tiny. So we add features step by step. We do not give you zoom button in the match because we understand that at current stage it might have bugs. We want to give players the experience without bugs, so we just postponed this feature. That's why we are in Early Access - some features take a lot of time to implement for the small team.

4) Transfers. 
There is nothing pay to win in the game. Some footballers are more expensive like in real life, some - are less. In the lower leagues, you can't buy top class footballers because there is a range of footballers' levels which are allowed for every league.

Moreover, as Football Tactics is a strategy game, you can decide to develop your club either through developing your Youth team or Scout or both. When you develop your scouts, you can have more footballers in the transfer list. 

5) Cosmetic updates. 
Again, your words are not true. We are updating the game rarely with huge updates. And at the moment, we are working on the huge update to the match mechanics. However, to make players have fun between updates, we are making small micro-updates which improve slightly some game's features: AI, Match, Management, Face and Leagues Editors etc. Here's the list of the last three micro-updates. As you can see, every one of them has new  non-haircuts features:
http://steamcommunity.com/games/375530/announcements/detail/614011511175590618
http://steamcommunity.com/games/375530/announcements/detail/612884347364896450
http://steamcommunity.com/games/375530/announcements/detail/612883076678615818

6) Our passion to the game. 
Many players who follow the game development, write in reviews or on the forum that they didn't expect such improvements as we do being in the Early Access. Not many developers are so committed to their game and community as we do. That's not just words. From the first day in Early Access, our game changed a lot. Now it is in such state that we can release it as it is and no one would say that it's unfinished. But our goal is to make it not just fun but great. That's why we are in Ear;y Access. Adding new huge features, improving small details etc. The game is not so profitable, so we develop it for our money because we love what we do. 

- - - - -
Additional notes.
In our community, I see a big difference in players who mastered using skills and those who didn't. When you fully understand how skills work, you can develop your team to your style, you can use the game's randomness to your advantage, you can beat much much stronger teams just because you used special tactics against them. It seems that without understanding how skills work, you can't see the depth of the game's mechanics working together. So if you give the game another chance, I'd give you some tips:

1) At the first turn after kick-off, the skills do not work because players are concentrating
2) Learn new and upgrade learned skills on the trainings. It's very important
3) Skills give you +1 bonus action when successfully used _against_  an opponent
4) Kick on the goall as close to the opponents goal as possible
5) If the chances to score are low, use power shot to get some chance of having a corner
6) Pay attention to your footballers' price. The longer they play in the main team, the higher interest of the other clubs is, and so the higher their price
7) Before every match, look at the opponent's formation and change your formation to use your strong sides and opponent's weak sides

Good luck!

author: {'steamid': '76561197965732221', 'num_games_owned': 457, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1341, 'last_played': 1542051940}
review: Obwohl das Spiel noch im "Early Access"-Status ist, macht es wirklich schon einen Heidenspaß zu spielen. Es handelt sich hierbei in erster Linie um eine Fußball-Taktik Simulation mit einem (bislang) winzigen Managementpart. Zu Beginn wählt man ein Team oder erstellt eine neue Mannschaft in einem von vielen zur Verfügung stehenden Ländern (die Länder und die dazugehörigen Teams sind editierbar, im Workshop stehen bereits viele mit Originaldaten überarbeitete Ligen zum Download zur Verfügung). Man startet in der letzten Liga des gewählten Landes mit einem durchschnittlichen Team, das aber bereits über 2-3 Leistungsträger mit Spezialfähigkeiten verfügt. Das Gameplay während der Begegnungen ist mit "Rasenschach" treffend beschrieben. Rundenweise werden auf einer Art Hexfeld Spielzüge wie passen, schießen, Spielerbewegungen, etc. ausgeführt, jedes Team hat jeweils 3 Züge pro Runde. Der Erfolg oder Misserfolg der Aktionen im Spiel ist abhhängig von der Spielstärke der daran beteiligten Spieler. Je nach Leistung werden nach den Spielen Erfahrungspunkte vergeben wodurch die Spielstufe steigt und Spielerfähigkeiten (passen, schießen, usw.), je nach gewähltem Trainingsfokus, erhöht werden. Taktische Tiefe bekommt das Spiel durch die trainierbaren Spezialfähigkeiten und deren sinnvolle Integration in Aufstellung und Spiel. Siege o. Niederlagen sind zu einem großen Teil von der eingesetzten Taktik abhängig und nachvollziehbar, mit klugem Einsatz der Spieler mit den passenden Spezialfähigkeiten können so auch schwächere Teams gegen eindeutig stärkere Mannschaften Erfolge erzielen. Der "Management-Teil" des Spieles verdient kaum diese Bezeichnung. Er ist auf minimalste Funktionen reduziert. So verläuft z.B. der Stadionausbau in nur wenigen Stufen und beschränkt sich allein auf die Anzahl der Plätze, ähnlich wie in einigen rudimentären Browser-Simulationen. Insgesamt spiele die Finanzen eine untergeordnete Rolle. Gehälter oder andere laufende Kosten werden nicht berücksichtigt. Die Verlängerung eines Vertrages z.B. erfordert eine einmalige Zahlung die dann die gesamte Vertragslaufzeit mit allen Kosten abdeckt. Auch das Transfersystem ist mehr als minimal. Z.B. werden Spieler die auf der Transfer-Liste erscheinen zufällig gewählt, der gezielte Kauf bestimmter Spieler von anderen Clubs ist nicht möglich. Der Ausbau Vereinseigener Ressourcen wird teils mittels Geld und teils über "Ruhmpunkte", die man sich über Erfolge in Begegnungen verdient, bezahlt (diese begrenzen sich auf Stadionausbau, Verbesserung der Jugendabteilung des Trainerstabs und der Scoutingabteilung). Ein wenig mehr Umfang in diesem Bereich fände ich persönlich begrüßenswert. Nichtsdestotrotz macht das Spiel wirklich Spaß, die Dauer der Begegnungen ermöglicht auch mal ein kurzes Spiel "zwischendurch", verführt aber auch zu "...nur noch eine Partie" in der Nacht. Die Entwickler scheinen wirklich mit Herzem bei der Sache. Es erscheinen regelmäßige Updates und es wird viel mit der Community kommuniziert. Ich kann das Spiel jedem Fußballinteressiertem besten Gewissens empfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158537173', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1133, 'last_played': 1492983291}
review:
这么久了竟然还是抢先体验。。。
这是一个策略向的游戏，手残也能玩足球。体验吧一个弱渣球会带到顶级联赛最后拿下冠军杯的...爆肝。。
前期很容易上瘾，但是升级几次之后杯其他球会全面碾压属性，金钱周转也很成问题，无奈卖人还买不进新人，全靠青训挖宝。。
我这个档应该是打了三年联赛之后被属性压制的所有的受不了了放置了一段时间。最近建起来看发现竟然球员有肖像了就很惊喜。
总之，好游戏，策略向伪球迷可入。

最重要的是，文字量不大，甚至可以说初中生查查字典都能玩. 
没中文就差评的真是太丢人了。

it has been early accessig for a long time if im not mistaken. 
whatever, i was addicated to this game until my in-game club upgraded to higher leagues, when all the club members' status was all dimentionally CRASHED by those opponents.
continuously gaming demands a too high level of trying hard and definately elimated my interest...
but it is really a surprise discovering portraits while re-logging in. 
wish u team not confused with some not that pressing demands of chinese version and good luck.
developer_response:
Thanks ^ ^

PS To beat stronger teams, use skills. They really matter

author: {'steamid': '76561198041268891', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 8385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 733, 'last_played': 1566391478}
review: I usually don't review games but for an early acess game this game is a ton of fun and has a alot of depth to it. I hope it will get more features and perhaps statistics about your players like the amount of goals they have scored overall etc. The gameplay is nice and the game is very addicting and a nice way to burn hours. However I quickly adapted some of my strategies and game philosophies from other football games which made the game quite easy for me. I would also like some kind of system to do headers from loft passes as they are quite key part of football and I think that the Nutmeg player skill is bit too good. Good game as it is but im excecting it to be great once it's done.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014909747', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1483308589}
review:
Пустой шлак, который не стоит своих денег.
 P.S. Мультиплеер пустой...
developer_response: Вы не могли бы более развернуто написать, почему игра шлак? Судя по сыгранному времени, вы ирали только в Любительской лиге, которая является по сути туториалом. Далее постепенно раскрываются игровые механики. Далее, в зависимости от того, научились ли вы пользоваться навыками своих футболистов, вы уже сможете грамотно выстраивать тактику против более сильных оппонентов.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063804025', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1902, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1873, 'last_played': 1618354814}

author: {'steamid': '76561198026174880', 'num_games_owned': 304, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 5407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1695926891}
review:
Игра какашка.
Негде развеонуться.
Менеджмент сведен к уровню 6 летнего ребенка.
Игра больше похожа на Flesh игру из соц сетей.
В игре нет ни одного положительного момента.


НЕ ПОКУПАТЬ
developer_response:
Жаль, что вам не понравилась игра, но по отзыву видно, что вы прошли лишь Любительскую лигу, которая является по сути удлиненным туториалом. Когда вы начнете играть против сильных соперников, научитесь использовать навыки, поймете, как настраивать собственную тактику под каждого следующего соперника, станете собирать команду под собственные тактические задачи, начнете выигрывать значительно более сильных соперников благодаря своему уму, я уверен, что игра вам понравится.

Дайте игре еще один шанс, попробуйте разобраться в том, как благодаря использованию навыков побеждать матчи

author: {'steamid': '76561198082394081', 'num_games_owned': 479, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1680110930}
review:
Early Access on Steam has a notorious reputation for being a haven for dodgy developers and half-finished alpha prototypes that never make it into a Beta stage of play. Let me assure you: Football Tactics does [b]not[/b] fall into this category. This is a game and development team that are doing EA right. But why listen to me? Take a look at the up-to-date demo provided here on the store page; visit the discussion forum to see how often the devs visit, respond and take in feedback; and look at the highly active workshop community - which the devs enjoy highlighting in announcements.

This is a game community to rival any AAA title community.

The game itself (as of Dec 30, 2016) is a highly polished turn-based strategy game. The demo lets you play a full season with all the bells and whistles, and if you do purchase the game, you can continue your saved game. As of writing I have started season 2 of my NCAA-mod game and I couldn't be happier with the state of play. The mod is brilliant in of itself, and the developers are looking at ways to incorporate even more community ideas based.

It may seem like a turn-based strategy and a usually fast-paced sport like football shouldn't go hand-in-hand, but something just works. Somehow it blends well together and provides a challenging and unique take on not one but two genres. Players have unique stats for their positions which can be improved on through training and game-play, there are plenty of leagues incorporated into the game itself, and the newly implemented league editor encourages you to include leagues that may otherwise not be in the base game (like the NCAA). 

The UI is easy to navigate and lends itself to a simple to read yet still detailed enough management side of the game where you can build your strategy for match day via a formations menu. You can either be hands-on during match day, simulate or watch (and then intervene at your leisure). The AI, in my opinion, is well adjusted for each level of team and league I've played so far. Teams with good defense won't suddenly let you score goals, and you have to change up your tactics to suit your opponent. Gameplay is rewarding in its challenge.

Football Tactics, as it stands, is a complete game that offers a refreshing take on the hundreds of other football titles out there. Fancy on building a team that resembles your favourite players, well you can, with the current build featuring a face editor. New features are promised as they come to light, and I think even when this game has left Early Access, we can look forward to many more features and content from the developers and the active community.

This is a title that could change the landscape of a rather stagnant sports genre. RTS NFL? Yes please.

UPDATE: So many new features, improved graphics - this really is a labour of love gem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198243070958', 'num_games_owned': 519, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 6569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1708232767}
review:
Firstly, I will say that I'm not a football fan, I will watch a match now and then, I will play Fifa now and then, but that's about it.

So why did I buy the game? Although I don't play a lot of sport game, I do enjoy RPG Turn Based games. I like to make choices, but knowing that your choices could be good or bad it's all based on you the player. 

And this is what this game does well. You have to make a team work well for you for each match, but at the same you have to plan ahead because have a team all in thier 30's isn't going to help you for long. Plus I also found that game doesn't reward too easily, which I think is a good thing becuase you have to your money, as well as your fame points carefully.

However I will add, this isn't a realisic football game. Players will have positions but it's not like they have favoured spots (like to the right or left of the field). Another thing is that this game is more of a turn based game with elements of a football manager game, which does make it good, but it could be seen differently to players who play football manager games.

Overall, it's a good game and knowing it's a early access game too means they are still improving on it. Either way, if this interests you, you may want to look into it. It's very different, but in a good way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051311014', 'num_games_owned': 912, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1483320183}
review: Fun little turn-based soccer strategy game. If you like turn-based strategy and don't hate soccer, it's pretty fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999123009', 'num_games_owned': 668, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1015, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1483206678}
review:
At first glance a fairly throwaway and simple game, Football Tactics slowly offers more than meets the eye, with the fundamental gameplay system being much more complex and deep than I first thought. This is all enhanced by a very good surrounding set of systems in the form of a nice career system, player development, transfer market and player/team editing features.

Several minor negative points are that the game gets extremely easy once you have a good goalkeeper and at least one good striker, and also some minor graphical bugs and a solitary game crash in around 10 hours of play (Game autosaves every game so no lost progress).

Overall a great little strategy football game, and looking forward to seeing how it evolves throughout Early Access.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127917686', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1046, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1501442315}
review: Love this game!   It has many features that keep you interested in returning to it constantly, and I am not really a big soccer fan in the first place!  There are always things to do such as buying players, renewing contracts, training staff purchases, improving home stadiums.  Also the player face customization feature is outstanding in its depth of detail.  It really helps you bond with your playing staff at a whole different level - You almost don't want to sell them after you have been accostomed to them.  The match play is fairly quick (and exciting too) so you are not dwelling too much on the individual games as in the overall seasons standings which is nice.  I keep it at 48 moves which is the default setting for most realistic results and it seems to satisfy just fine.  A match is done in about 10 minutes or so.   A lot of depth can be had in setting up the right matchups against the different teams.  If you enjoy details and stats this is a great game - there is always something to do in between matches and the program leads and prompts you as to what is needed to be addressed in a timely manner.  2 thumbs up for this one!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198205898117', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 799, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1561662580}
review: Um grande jogo, majestoso! Mas atenção, é só mesmo para quem gosta de táticas!

author: {'steamid': '76561198060899882', 'num_games_owned': 491, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 801, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1585263292}
review:
Football Tactics n'ai ni un jeu de football, ni un jeu de tactique. Même si il est bourré de bonnes intentions, je trouve qu'il n'arrive pas a s'inscrire dans un genre en particulier. Trop sommaire dans ses stats pour vraiment avoir du fond, on se retrouve a entrainer tout betement les attaquants en précision, les milieux en passe et les défenseurs en défense. 

La stratégie de gestion du club est assez sommaire également et une fois qu'on a compris comment gérer le club, on enchaine les saisons comme dans un "jeu de clique" en passant les matchs en mode accéléré. Du coup, on perd une part importante du plaisir qu'aurait put procurer le jeu : les matchs.

C'est qu'on s'ennui également rapidement dans les matchs qui ne proposent que peu d'alternative pour marquer des buts : ils faut de bons joueurs... la tactique n'a que peu d'interet. 

Je ne conseille donc pas ce jeu et je ne vois pas vraiment comment il pourrait s'améliorer...

author: {'steamid': '76561198093222137', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 481, 'last_played': 1652634318}
review:
Игра хороша. Чтобы пробиться в топ дивизион нужно разрабатывать серьезную тактику на матч. В начале все эелементарно и кажется,что ты игру познал на 100%,но как только поднялся на ступень выше и тебя начинают обыгрывать все подряд,то тут понимаешь,что не все так просто.
Геймплей самого матча уже и так хороший,Хотелось бы больше проработки "межматчевого"(или "менеджерского") геймплея. Игрой доволен и денег потраченных не жалею...
https://youtu.be/SsSOK2U6mlE
