author: {'steamid': '76561197984465903', 'num_games_owned': 5402, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1465780476}
review:
This game feels almost like a halfway house between the Football Manager series and games like FIFA and PES. You get to create your own team (or mod in famous teams and players) and fight your way up your country's ladder in a turn-based football combat game.

Sometimes, the lack of control from the turn-based nature of the game is frustrating, as it leaves you powerless when RNG-based intercept plays fail and you concede a goal, but on the whole the idea works and is well executed.

Outside of matches there's also a fairly light team management sim going on, where you use "fame", "fans" and "money", basically 3 forms of currency, to expand your team and stadium and get better players. You also have the option to sign sponsorship agreements each season, which will dictate certain conditions to fulfill in order to get extra money. I feel this part of the game still needs more work, but it fits in fairly well overall

This review is from Early Access, so of course your mileage may vary, and the game is still subject to change.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122323073', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 4376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3489, 'last_played': 1601712043}
review:
Sehr netter Fußball manager als runden basiertes Spiel
Wann immer man aufhören will denkt man sich nur noch ein Spiel und danach nur noch ein Spiel.

Allerdings musste ich nach einer gewissen Spielzeit feststellen das es im moment kaum chancen gibt etwas falsch zu machen, man kann also eig. garnicht verlieren (Pleite gehen)

author: {'steamid': '76561197988749956', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 1468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 794, 'last_played': 1455514334}
review:
Super grindy, highly RNG based.  That about sums it up lol.

There are a few really annoying things that routinely happen in this game....like your keeper rolling 68 and the striker rolling a 1, and the keeper not hanging on to the ball leading to another corner.  I had this happen 5 times in a row one game....

Marginal, fairly shallow game, with highly annoying RNG.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072560068', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 625, 'last_played': 1606763766}

author: {'steamid': '76561198113446584', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1309, 'last_played': 1549018919}
review:
Warning: This Review of mine will be really long, but i suggest you read it completely. You will be informed and entertained!

First of all:

Wow! Definetly worth the Price for this Early Access (!) Game, if you´re into Soccer Management and tactical Gameplay and want to see a well rounded Game for the asked Price!

The Game:

This Games Base is solid and working, both performance and mechanic-wise. I fell in love with what this Game is already and even more so with what this Game can definetly be in the Future.

Football Tactics has, as i mentioned before, a good working and fun to play mechanic for the Games and the right Options on what to extend your Club on the management Side. There are real Choices to make, depending on your Play-Style, that make a Difference:

Need stronger Defense to hold the stronger League you got promoted to? You can do that!
Want even more dangerous Strikers to aim for the Title? You can do that!

This Game is so solid Gameplay and Fun-wise, that i have to admit i feel flattered to see a Game that doesn´t claim to be or tries to be more than it is.

It´s fun. It´s engaging to see your Club develop. And you feel the Difference of stronger enemy Teams and Teams that you are supposed to win against.

There is always a Chance to get behind when playing a supposedly weaker Enemy and always a minimal Chance to get a good Result against the overwhelming odds of a higher Class Opposition, if you have the right Idea and a bit of Luck. It´s Soccer after all.

All this without losing the importance of your Team Tactic and your Formation. In my first Season i made it to the second Round of the League Cup against all Odds, because i played with a 6-Man Defense and just tried to have as much Ball Posession as possbile. It was a boring 0-0 and i won in the Penalty Shootout. I´m not a big Fan of this Tactic, but i won and got a big Load of Prestige, Experience and Money to invest into my Infrastrcture and my personal favorite: My Youth Team.

So what are the Cons and what needs to be implemented to reach the maximal Potantial of this Game?

Cons:

As i mentioned: The game works perfectly and has a very solid and working Base + Fun-Experience, so it doesn´t need any Fixes. Which bring me to the "real" Cons of this Game, which is Content and Multiplayer.

Implementations (Cons 2):

This Game needs Multiplayer! It just does! It´s a shame to keep this Experience from the Multiplaying-Community! We Football/Soccer-Fanatics NEED to be able to measure our Skill against other non AI Opponents. Make it happen! It´ll eventually make this Game way bigger than it is atm! Seriously!

My Second Complaint is, that there isn´t more of this Game. With this solid and well developed Gameplay-Base there just needs to be more Content.

Examples:

More active Skills for the Players than the few we have, even when this few are very nicely done. Also make the Skill a little deeper and not just dependend on Player Skill or his Stamina. Make (mainly for Multiplayer Reasons) Rock-Paper-Scissors like Skills, like a certain Striker Dribble-Skill is weak to certain defensive Skill, which will result in +50% Bonus on the Defenders Throw. That would make it a real mind Game on what to choose in a Situation for the Players and it would even influence tactical Choices, like in reality where a certain Player who normally isn´t in the Starting Team gets thrown in, because he´s good against a certain Player from the Enemy Team. Also, implement more Passive Skills, maybe to make certain Players able to move even 3 Fields in 1-Turn. That way you would get so much more tactical Variations and each Team would really have a unique Face and Style.

In Short:

- Make Multiplayer happen
- More Content: More Active Skills, More Passive Skills, Deeper mechanics for SOME (!) of them

If you make this happen, this Game could really achieve more than anyone would think. At the Moment it´s a good Game for a fair Price.

It can be more though.

Have a nice Day to everyone who managed to read this to the End :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198014648641', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3418, 'last_played': 1622931156}
review: I've been with steam for several years now, likely from the beginning, and i have never written a review for a game until now. The very beginning of this game , is very simplistic, and it appears to me that by design, it starts to open up the deeper into the game you go. I honestly think what we have here is a very fun football game that is super simple to pick up and play. The skills your players possess, are easily forgotten to use and will be forgotten if you dont look up top to see what options are available to that player during the moving/shooting stage. The game does get tough, and i think it would take a long time to unlock /build up a team to being a powerhouse. But that in itself is the beauty of the game in a sense. Your team , once built to that power house, will feel like YOUR team. I really like this game. I think its one of the better time passers available on steam for the price. If i could add anything, maybe some career stats for your team, all time records etc....But in the end, i think its a job well done. Its not like they were trying to market a $60 game, but it almost feels like you ripped them off at the price it goes for. Well done, thank you Football Tactics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085970332', 'num_games_owned': 131, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 597, 'last_played': 1628000981}
review:
Oynanış bakımından gayet iyi bir oyun. Çevrimdışı modda yaklaşık 12saatlik bir oynamam oldu. Fakat eksik şeyler var. Oyunun mantığı menajerlikten ziyade maçlara ithaf ediyor. Ayrıca oyuncuların yetenek ve beceri seçenekleri kısıtlı. Yetenek ve beceriler çoğalabilir, slotlar arttırılabilinir. Ayrıca menajerlik havası vermesi bakımından başarılar elde ettikçe farklı takımlardan teklifler gelmesi, oyunculara teklif yapılması, ya da bizim başka takımın oyuncularına teklif yapmamız, oynanışı biraz daha güzelleştirir. Basın toplantılarına katılma, maçtan önce - sonra karşı takımı etkileme moral bozma vs. gibi seçenekler oynanış bakımından oyunu arttıracağına inanıyorum. Kısacası biraz daha detaya ihtiyaç var. Bu haliyle 1-2gün hevesli bir şekilde oynanır daha sonra sürekli aynı şeyleri yaptığımızdan ve fazla çeşitlilik olmamasından oyuncu sıkılabilir. Şahsen ben sıkıldım.

Yine de alınıp oynanılabilinir. Çok fazla çeşitlilik olmamasına rağmen 1-3 gün boş vakitlerinizin çoğunu ayırabilirsiniz. Sonrasında yeni güncelleme ve çeşitlilikler gelene kadar oyun kütüphanenizde tozlanmaya yüz tutar.

(Yıllar sonra gelen edit) Oyuna bugün  (28.09.2018) tekrar girdiğimde baya bir gelişme ve düzenleme olduğunu farkettim. Bu haliyle gayet oynanabilir olmuş. Slotlar arttırılmış beceri mekaniği daha da iyileştirilmiş. Güzel oyun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079307620', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 3980, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1364, 'last_played': 1633982043}
review:
It's a interesting idea, but it just doesn't really come together as a tactical game. The team building elements are solid, and if that type of game (manager game) is your thing, you might really like this. But, if you're looking for Blood Bowl Soccer without the blood, you're going to be disappointed. This just doesn't have that level of complexity, at least not yet. Maybe with some tweaking and fixing, this could be solid. As is, you only have three moves to make per turn, and you're supposed to be able to get more by executing skills, but rarely does this work, and there's really no explanation why. It basically ends being a matter of which team has better stats. The team with the better players can score easily with no real tactics, and the weaker team has few tools availble to stop them, or even slow them down.
I'd like to recommend this game, and spent a fair amount of time playing it, but it's just not real good, yet....

....Update: Changing to recommended. 3/25/18
The game has come a long way. Kudos to the developers for continuing to work on the game. The game feels quite a bit more tactical now, plus they've improved the graphics and added alot of depth to the manager/career mode.
developer_response:
Hi, thanks for the review even so it's negative. Just wanted to say that the information about skills which rarely work is not very correct. 

They work and they are really a deal breaker. When you master to use it, you can win the much much stronger opponent by using right tactics. It all depends on how good you mastered the mechanics. 

For example, here, on the forum, one of the players says opposite to the review: the skills make the game very easy for him (http://steamcommunity.com/app/375530/discussions/0/364040961441372977/ ).

It would be great if you decide to play Football Tactics again and maybe you'd change your opinion about the game after the understanding of how the skills work. 

P.S. I think that the problem is that you somehow missed the information in coach's notes, that the skills do not work in the first turn after kicking off (footballers should concentrate). If you have any other questions about skill - we would gladly answer on the forum

author: {'steamid': '76561198182982775', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 3889, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3883, 'last_played': 1456472963}
review:
Awesome game! It is simple yet well done Football Manager that lets you be in charge of tactical solutions on the field. It fills the gap in football simulators for the lovers of tactics like me. PES and FIFA offer just simple tactical solutions since they let you control merely one player properly. Football Managers focus just on strategy and let the tactics entirely on AI. In Football Tactics (FT) YOU perform ALL the tactics in turn based manner.

So just because this game focuses on actual tactics I love it :D now for the cons. FT is not too realistic and the tactics are often gimmicky. Next thing is that FT rather simple in design - both in the manager options and in the gameplay options. It could be better in the variety department but it is surely complex enough to enjoy the game.

8/10 Possibly the best simulator of football tactics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090686152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1450560708}
review:
First game I've ever refunded. The idea is solid, but there just is barely any content here. As it is, there isn't much strategy as the RNG and small field limit options. The unlocked moves and upgrading coaches and facilities is very shallow. The interface is clearly meant for mobile devices. This would be a great game if it was free to play, but there wouldn't be enough unlockables to even warrant microtransactions. Without an almost ground up overhaul of the interface, I don't see myself enjoying the game.

Edit: Apparently the first bit is meant as a tutorial. With how Steam does refunds, I did not see enough in the first 4 matches I played to keep going. I know this is early access, but it wasn't my bag of tea.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038363259', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2741, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2433, 'last_played': 1482264561}
review:
Gutes Spiel. Für jeden empfehlenswert, wer ein ruhigeres Fußballspiel will.

Ob einem das Spielprinzip taugt, kann man ja sehr einfach über die Demo testen. Sie geht über eine Saison und ich kann nur empfehlen vor dem Kauf die Demo anzuschauen. Kann mir sehr gut vorstellen, dass das vielen zu lahm ist, aber wer ein kleines Taktikspielchen mit Manager sucht ist hier richtig aufgehoben.

Hab nun nach 9Saisons und 40 Stunden alles erreicht. Jetzt wären internationale Wettbewerbe wie eine CL ganz nett, aber momentan beschränkt sich das Spiel leider nur auf ein einfaches Ligensystem mit 4 Ligen und 2 Pokalen. Auch ganz nett wäre es, wenn man Nationalmannschaften coachen könnte. Aber kann ja noch kommen. Sehr cool ist, dass man recht einfach original Embleme und Mannschaftsnamen übernehmen kann.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051316765', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3913, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1032, 'last_played': 1638983003}

author: {'steamid': '76561198049759051', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1032, 'last_played': 1649467755}
review:
Pro:
+ nice, but only one song
+ in the beginning (in the amateur) very motivating...
+ you can create your own team, symbols and dress
+ nice managerpart
+ good ambience

Cons:
- This is FIFA, only turnbased...numbers against numbers...in a casino it would be fitting, but not at a football field.
- in the third league you get  (after you win the amateur cup) f***ed up
- no training simulation, why the hell cant i train my team in my stadium?!? Test Game, Shoottraining and so?

At this moment, i cant recommend the game, but it is a Early Access Game..i hope the devs will work hard to emprove the game...

Update...2016-05-07

After a long break, ive started the game again - after a lot of patches...

I make it sweet and short:

Con: "- in the third league you get  (after you win the amateur cup) f***ed up" has gone....

Hints:

- Train your team
- Buy cheap, sell good players (but not too young)
- Update your management
- Dont play the matches, let it simulate
- Dont give up!

author: {'steamid': '76561198079357981', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1055, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1651384001}
review:
Game plays nicely and has a retro feel as others have indicated. Pleasing graphics and sound with some surprising depth - only a few gripes: the jump from Amateur League to Division 3 was HUGE, every team had a better Defender, Midfeld player AND Forward than I could put out so not losing was a real struggle. Opponents gained a bonus "move action" when a player succesfully completed a Skill, I do not. My beginning team were ALL 28 years old (or older) ... this makes for a difficult third and fouth season.

However, if you want a very playable game with a surprising amount of depth that has a very shallow learning curve, this is for you. Sadly, Fulchester United may not get beyond the Third Division for quite a few more years, I guess just like another manager, I'm not so special after all.

review: Yep. This game's awesome. I don't like FIFA, football manager, or any other football/soccer game. But this game is fun, simple, but has relaxing depth, with some lite management elements. You should get it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198007845690', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 45899, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6623, 'last_played': 1615559509}
review:
So simple, and yet so addictive.
Sound and graphics are.......well......very basic - but the gameplay more than makes up for it.
The price seems a little high for such a small game, but the devs are still adding features.

I'm hoping for more advanced starting line-ups to come, as you're kind of limited to the basic Defence/Midfielf/Attack formations. I wanted to use a 4-1-2-1-2, but the starting grid wouldn't allow it.

Nevertheless.....I can't put the game down.
It has a 'just one more game' feel.

EDIT: So, I maxed my team out, with every player at level 100 - both skills maxed on every player.
I hardlly ever draw or lose a game now.....only challenge is to start over.

And there's no Champions League!
Once you get to the top of Premier League, that's it. Nothing more to play for, except the next championship and National Cup.

Needs more endgame challenges!

author: {'steamid': '76561198027514454', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 58162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25973, 'last_played': 1709472042}
review:
Wenn Du mit deinen Spielern Gespräche führen möchtest, Dich um den Verkauf von Socken und um Deine Privat-Villa kümmern willst, dann wirst Du mit diesem Spiel NICHT glücklich.... Aber wenn Du einen Fußballmanager haben willst, der sich auf das wichtigste konzentriert und mit dem Du sofort loslegen kannst....dann bist Du hier richtig. Macht einfach Laune....genug jetzt, ich muss weiterspielen :-)

Update:
Fast genau 2 Jahre nach dem ersten Review habe ich das Spiel in den letzten Tagen wieder entdeckt. Die Spieler haben jetzt eigene Talentbaüme und bekommen für Aktionen Erfahrungspunkte auf der Position auf der sie sich bei der Ausführung befanden. Dadurch kann man sie jetzt nach Wunsch "ausbilden". Es ist immer noch ein toller, nicht überladener Fußballmanager. 

Für die Zukunft wünsche ich mir jetzt nur noch einen Mehrspielermodus (Hot-Seat, WLAN oder I-NET, völlig egal) bei dem man das, was man bisher nur alleine machen kann, mit ein oder zwei Freunden gemeinsam erleben kann. 

Update 2:
Manches Mal gehen Wünsche in Erfüllung (siehe vorheriger Absatz). Im Hot-Seat Modus kann man jetzt eigene Turniere erstellen. Noch nicht perfekt, aber zumindest ein netter Zeitvertreib mit 2-3 Freunden.

Ich kann von diesem Spiel einfach nicht genug bekommen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031376462', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 2884, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1581, 'last_played': 1511393120}
review:
Football Tactics is a creative strategy game. Even people who don't like soccer (football to the rest of the world) would enjoy the game. I have one issue- the teams are rated in "stars" out of 5. I have a 1 star team currently, and struggle to beat 1.5 star teams. The skill difference is phenominal. I really like this game and I do reccomend it. I hope the devs continue to work on it.

Since writing this the devs have edited the star system. It is much easier to play, but is still extremely enjoyable. Chess with soccer! I still highly recommend this!

review: Fantastic game, keeping me continually entertained and frustrated at the same time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014256851', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1665, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1155, 'last_played': 1638514028}
review:
**Revised review March 5, 2016**

The latest version of [i]Football Tactics[/i], as of this review, has converted my original vote of no to a yes. However, the part that swayed me is an optional setting, so please note that the default game still seems too random. So long as you go into it with reasonable expectations, [i]Football Tactics[/i] can be quite charming.

For one thing, it features slick design and UI. Information is easily accessible with a few clicks, and managing positions and rosters is straightforward.  This ties into the streamlined managerial experience. People who want a lot of number crunching and projections can play [i]Football Manager[/i].  This game is more arcade-like, with a simplified simulation.  You still get the whole experience (signing, training, budgeting, seasons, tournaments, etc.), but it's bite-sized.

The matches play in a similar fashion to blitzball in [i]Final Fantasy X[/i]: players have four stats that determine their passing, shooting, defensive, and positional abilities.  There are also "skills" that allow them to make harder shots, longer passes, etc. It is turn based, and each game consists of 48 actions taken in threes.  Success is determined by rolling one's players stat versus the opposition's stat.  For example, a player with a Pass rating of 24 is attempting to pass through an opponent with a Defense stat of 12.  Both players generate a random number from 1 to x, where x is their stat; the higher number prevails (ties go to the active team).

In the default settings, the RNG has too much variability for my taste, and they can significantly reduce the effectiveness of your tactics.  Some games devolve into a matter of who rolls better, you or the computer.  Training players takes a lot of time, and acquiring better players is expensive.  Tournaments happen each year, and if you get to enter, you will likely be facing teams from much higher leagues.  Their stats will be significantly higher than yours, and you will only be able to hope for a tie.

There is a new, optional setting when creating a new game that gives players a skill floor of 30% of their rating.  This means that high-skilled players can more consistently outclass weaker opponents, although they can still be beaten.  Although I would prefer that this setting be integrated into the core game, its presence makes it easier to execute tactics consistently rather than gambling on a lucky roll.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100955117', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 69515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 514, 'playtime_at_review': 1109, 'last_played': 1712373792}
review:
Highly addictive, definitely feels like a "easy to learn, hard to master" title. Matches can be as quick or long as you decide, interesting mechanical depth regarding skills, offense vs defense contests and all the different options you have in terms of positioning, formation and mitigating bad luck on the dice rolls.

Team management is done pretty well, with training, transfers, player age, match exposure, contracts, sponsors, and more. For an Early Access title, it feels like a complete game and the devs are proving that they have confidence in the future direction.

If you like Club Football, tactical games and management sims, pick it up.

Good!

author: {'steamid': '76561198064800171', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 688, 'last_played': 1495933053}
review:
Wow, as simple as it can look like from the beginning, this game is exceptionally well crafted alchemy of skills, perks and other RPG elements in well balanced cocktail of fun.

I have real respect for developers which can develop game so simple to understand, with so simply and still pretty looking UI which is getting deeper and more complex while you dont feel they would be hanging you by hand.
This game is like good play off chess.



To simply describe it: 

You start with bunch of amateur players on some public park, getting new young members from watcher - pals, choosing what to train and getting skills.

Every match means exp for your playing players, some money and "fame" while nothing of it is in the game just for effect.
You'll find yourself thinking how could someone balance the game so simply and exactly together. Why cant i stop playing this?

Every player is basically characterized only by 4 attributes: accuracy (shot), control, defense, passing
Every turn on field is counted on opposite attributes which are relevant to current action.
For instance tackle is counted as defense of tackling player versus control of player with the ball. Then dice are rolled and result is counted by probability (difference of opposite attributes)
Then you have passing, shooting, dribbling turn actions, or just control the ball to prepare your possession for opponent's turn.

Then you can train certain skills (like perks) which you can use as extra (like special move, or special shot), you can specify players by this skill for certain things in the game, build whole team tactics.
You can even use weather to alter your match tactic!

I have to admit i didn't expect so addictive gameplay, i simply cannot stop playing it.

Would recommend game like this again..

review:
Oyunu severek oynuyordum fakat emekleriniz bir bug yüzünden heba oluyor. 
29 sezon: Her sezon bilmem kaç maç 3 ligden şampiyonlar ligine yüksel avrupa kupasında son 8 e kal neredeyse bütün yükseltmeleri yap ama hepsi çp olsun 160 küsür saat oynayan birisi olarak uyarıyorum canınız acıyor :(

I was playing the game with pleasure, but your efforts are wasted because of a bug.
29 seasons: I don't know how many matches each season, rise from 3 leagues to the champions league, get to the last 8 in the European cup, make almost all the upgrades, but they will all be junk. As someone who plays 160-odd hours, I warn you, it hurts :(
developer_response:
As I asked in the bug thread - send me a report, please. Having the report file we can figure out what happened and possibly restore your save file.

- find our support utility STEAM FOLDER\steamapps\common\Football Tactics\config.exe
- press Troubleshooting
- press Generate report
- send it to me on kos @ creoteam . com
- describe please the bug in the letter

author: {'steamid': '76561198077199471', 'num_games_owned': 183, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 9175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5313, 'last_played': 1512876650}
review:
Turn-based football. You have time to think about your every move and feel the full control over your players. I am not FIFA fan, I don't even like football. But the way developers made the game totally won me over - it is a lot like chess (my favorite board game) but with elements of RPG like gaining levels of footballers and gaining skills and tallents for them. Moreover the developers are constantly improving the game to suit player's tastes (players can pick match duration in turns, will players playing on different position get a penalty for it, will there be injuries, how fast footballer's stamina will recover and more) and provide new options and additional content. And if there happens to be a bug from what I've seen they are fast to release a fix for it - usually within hours.

I don't know if all the FIFA fans would like this a bit slower and more tactical version but I recommend it to all who like turn-based strategies and RPG-type of games, at least for me it was a fun new experience that may not have as many resource types like in other strategies (fame, money in this case) but is just as fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056031520', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1243, 'last_played': 1601227294}

review:
Un bon jeu de stratégie/gestion de football au tour par tour.

Il est en early access et donc pas complet mais la dernière mise a jour qui nous permets d'avoir 3sauvegardes est pas mal de mon point de vue, on peux aussi personnaliser quelque options dans nos parties comme par exemples de pouvoir augmenter en 1clique notre argent ou renommée, cela permettant de voir ce qui nous attends.
Graphismes plutot moyen, les sons ne sont malheureusement pas réglable en % mais seulement en activé/désactivé.
Le jeu peut devenir répétitif mais on peux y passer du temps a s'amuser.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142274361', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 26460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7646, 'last_played': 1695157077}
review:
Amazing game.
Still think there are some things which you guys could improve. Firstly, I think that you should work on multiplayer a bit more, making this a far more competitive game than it is now. Competitive games usually attract people the most, and, besides, are much funnier, in my opinion, of course.
Another thing I'd like to see is more colours, to make clubs a bit more costumizable.
Another thing I've got to criticize is the translations. Both spanish and portuguese translations are pretty bad. You could work a bit more on that.
Any way, it is a very fun and entertaining game. I always want to play one match more, and I like to watch my club's trophy room growing ^^

author: {'steamid': '76561198007253213', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 78202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4866, 'last_played': 1606499343}
review: A very addicting "just one more turn" kindofa game.  The games move by quickly though, so maybe a setting to add a few more rounds to the half would be nice.  The transfer market is good, and the weight between "should I keep my highly skilled vet" or "sell him to land a young wonder-kid" is spot-on.  I've played long enough to get my Amatuer side to the PL, and every season I find myself struggling with these choices.  It is a very simple system, but I have yet to crack the code on building a solid roster of wiley vets and up-and-comers.  My only knock would be some better documentation on pulling off the numerous skill moves.  It took me many seasons to get to where I could routinely pull-off 4 moves per round, but on the offensive side, the moves rarely pay off.  I made a lot of mistakes in building my roster though, so maybe I will start a new save.  One other added feature might be to be able to drop below 11 players on the roster to be able to sell off 2 players to get one higher quality one.  Overall though, a great time-killing game that could be perfect with just a few tweaks.  It's like a stream-lined cross between Civ V and Football Mgr.  This ia highly enjoyable alternate to those time consuming games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979391923', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 821, 'last_played': 1632341260}
review:
So, wer auch schon immer nach einer Alternative für den ferngebliebenen Fifa Fußballmanager gesucht hat, der wird hier nicht unbedingt fündig, dafür bietet das Spiel (noch) zu wenig. Allerdings wars das schon mit den negativen Seiten, denn alles in allem ist es ein Spiel das Laune macht. Vor allem die Idee des rundenbasierten Spiels, bei dem man selber den Spielaufbau gestalten kann finde ich sehr gut. Hat ein bisschen was von XCOM oder Wasteland nur eben auf dem Sportplatz ;-)! Wer darauf nicht so steht wie ich, kann aber natürlich auch einfach zuschauen oder direkt simulieren.

Um diese Spielart noch mehr zu fördern können die Spieler unterschiedliche Talente haben oder Fertigkeiten erlernen, welche Spezialaktionen wie etwa den "Pass in den freien Raum" oder das "Tunneln" von Gegenspielern ermöglichen. Für Fertigkeiten kann man Ruhmpunkte investieren, welche man durch Siege, bzw. durch Höhe der Tordifferenz in den Spielen generiert. Desweiteren kann man auch das Scouting, sowie die einzelnen Trainer (es gibt einen für jede Art Spielertyp - Tor, Verteidiger, Mittelfeld und Sturm) mit Ruhmpunkten verbessern.

Natürlich darf auch das liebe Geld nicht fehlen. Damit kann man natürlich auf dem Transfermarkt neue Spieler kaufen, das Stadion und die Jugendabteilung ausbauen und natürlich die vorhandenen Spieler finanzieren. 

Achja, man kann seinen eigenen Amateurverein gründen und diesen hochführen, ingesamt gibt es hierfür fünf Ligen mit immer stärker werdenden Gegnern.

Ich hoffe ich konnte ein bisschen was sinnvolles über das Spiel wiedergeben und zocke jetzt mal weiter ^^!

author: {'steamid': '76561198009469170', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 4535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1025, 'last_played': 1628805330}
review:
Fun little game.
Didn't realize it's still in early access, already feels like a finished game.
Games themselfs are fun and there is quite a bit of "tactics" you can come up with to trick the opponent into moving his players in bad positions, pull fouls etc...
Adapting to the opponents tactical positions before each match is worth it, and putting players with the right attributes/skills into the right positions on the pitch is essential.
The game has also a managing part (transfers, training, sponsors, youth academy etc.) that fits in well.

if you like soccer management / turn based games, this one's for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000453458', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1746, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 480, 'last_played': 1489403501}
review:
Дуже цікава гра. Лише позитивні враження. 
На даному етапі версії - подобається майже все. 
- Є речі, які можливо збентежують у самій симуляції гри, але "великий рандом" іноді дуже радує. 
- Не до кінця зрозуміло ціноутворення деяких гравців. Є з середніми навичками, але з талантом або спец. вмінням, то у ціх гравців ціна захмарна! Стратегія проста -продаєш з супер навичками але посередніми скілами, та купуєш собі пів команди сильних гравців за копійки :)
Оцінка 9/10 Мій "+1" бал буде - за реалізацію мультиплеєра ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198026438007', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 20751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3084, 'last_played': 1668691415}
review:
Mit dem Hang alle Spiele, die irgendwie mit Fussball zu tun haben, auszuprobieren, fand ich diesen Geheimtipp.
Mal was für Zwischendurch für Taktikliebhaber.

Stellt euch einen sehr abgespeckten Manager in einer Mischung mit Blood Bowl in Fussball Form vor. Aber schön verpackt und schwerer als man anfangs denkt.
Simples Managing-System: Erstellt eure eigene Mannschaft, kauft und verkauft Spieler, upgraded euren Club, kümmert euch um eure Mannschaftsaufstellung und das Training der Spieler, gewinnt Geld durch Spieleinnahmen, investiert es in bessere Trainer, Spieler etc. und steigt nach ganz oben.

Die Spiele sind da schon anspruchsvoller. Zumindest 2-3 Ligen weiter oben. 
Eure Spieler besitzen 4 Werte: Treffsicherheit, Verteidigung, Passspiel und Kontrolle.
Je nachdem welche Position ein Spieler spielt sind bestimmte Werte wichtiger als andere. Ein Spiel geht über knapp 50 Runden. Pro Runde hat jeder Spieler 3 Züge bzw. man kann später mit Spezialattacken weitere Züge bekommen. 
Bei einem Schuss, Tackle, Pass uvm. bestimmt dieser Wert Und selbst mit den höheren Werten erhöht sich nur die Wahrscheinlichkeit, dass ein Spieler ein Duell gegen einen anderen gewinnt. Denn ihr würfelt quasi den Wert. D.h. wenn ihr zwar 50 Punkte mehr habt als der andere könnt ihr trotzdem verlieren.

Und sowas sollte auch mit in die Überlegung eines Zuges einfließen. Was ist wenn ich den Ball verliere?
Später geht es noch stark um Spezialattacken wie Regenbogenfinte, Grätsche, Langer Pass, Steilpass etc. Umso höher die Liga desto wichtiger ist eine gute Mischung aus diesen Attacken und Verteidigung gegen diese. Hat man kein Gegenmittel parat wird man gnadenlos ausgekontert.

Ich finde vor allem interessant wie eine unterschiedliche Ausrichtung der Mannschaft auch euren Spielstil verändert. Habe viele Aufstellungen probiert. Es gibt ja viele Wege nach Rom. Und die Haudrauf-Methode ist nicht die beste Strategie kann ich schonmal verraten. Aber probiert es selbst.

Fazit: Kein Blockbuster-Game, aber für das Spiel zwischendurch ist es richtig gut. Wer Action sucht ist hier fehl am Platze. 
Aber wer ab und an mal gern Tipp Kick o.ä. gespielt hat der wird seinen Spaß mit dem Spiel haben. Ein klassisches "Nur noch ein Spiel!"-Spiel, und Zack sind 4 Stunden rum,dass vom Preis her voll in Ordnung geht.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117497524', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 3795, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2534, 'last_played': 1455936099}
review:
В футбольный менеджер я играл лет 15 назад последний раз, когда был молодой и красивый. С тех пор тема меня как-то не волновала. А тут случайно наткнулся на эту игрушку. Удивило то что игроками можно было управлять самому. Вообще по-началу игра кажется простеньким Чапаевым в шашках. Любительская лига, третья... Это всё мелочи. Но чем дальше в лес, тем толще партизаны и начинают прорастать нехилые такие рога шахмат. Глубина начинает открываться со второй. А к первой начинают стареть изначальные игроки и если не озаботились заменой раньше, можно легко из первой лиги вернуться на любительскую полянку. Вообще игра может растянуться на недели игрового времени если поставить задачу пройти весь путь с любителей до профессионалов. Из названия видно что тактика тут есть. Однако есть ещё и стратегия. Очков и денег дают мало, а кинуть их хочется везде. И если не планировать на года вперёд, то можно остаться без хороших игроков. Поднять ли прибавку к опыту вратарям? Или нападающим? Повысить уровень юных талантов или понизить возраст новых игроков в трансферах? А может нужно бОльшее количество в трансферах? Или забабахать свой крутой стадион? Что тренировать игрокам из четырёх параметров если повышается только один? Натренируешь чудо пасы позабыв про контроль мяча, пасы будут действительно красивые. Если успеют отдать до того как отберут мяч. В общем есть о чём поболеть головушке.

В РС версии заметил пару багов. Письма в ящике пустые. Иногда чуть заметно дрожит экран. Да как-то раз переигрывал матч после серии ну очень неудачных пенальти, но игра почудила весьма забавно пару минут, а потом вылетела на рабочий стол. Это всё детские болезни которые надеюсь скоро исправят. 10 из 10 мячей в ворота! Хотя и цену бы снизить до 10 евро. Не то чтобы меня жаба за 3 задушила, но как-то...

author: {'steamid': '76561197968593879', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 8950, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3648, 'last_played': 1621386384}
review:
It is fun, rewarding, and challenging. Getting promoted, fighting to avoid relegation, coming back in yr 2 with a new strategy, selling big players to make the new strategy work, winning matches you would have lost last season.

It's relatively simple on the surface, but rewards creative play and purposeful strategy. They're really doing this game right and I highly recommend if you like sport management games or even just sports games in general. The match play mechanis are really really fun.

review: Веселый тайм-киллер. Оторваться очень тяжело. В игру уже вполне играть (хотя формально это еще "ранний доступ"), хотя кое-что, надеюсь, создатели "подкрутят" по ходу дела (типа формы для вратарей). Вовсе не просто выиграть все на свете, как в бесконечных футбол-менеджементах. Приходиться думать и варьировать тактику (даже на уровне любительского чемпионата).

author: {'steamid': '76561198078820819', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1972, 'last_played': 1522706331}
review:
Deceptively challenging game and fun to play.
I don't like that you don't have a screen after the match, that gives you a chance to spend your money, instead of jumping forwards a week and missing the transfer deadline, which caused me to lose my best player, who I could have signed to a shorter contract..
I don't like the fact that you can get 3 corners in a row after full time, but no penalty, or free kick, after you are brought down on your last move of normal time.
These things aside, it is still a good game and I enjoy playing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034017352', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 6400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5190, 'last_played': 1616610261}
review:
хотелось бы сказать о том,что напрягает в этой игре.речь о рандоме.перебор с ним пожалуй.нападающий может раз за разом переигрывать скилового защитника,при этом постоянно спотыкаясь на слабом.можно много раз не реализовывать выход один на один при положительных шансах(шансы указываются перед действием) и при этом словить голевой удар(при малых шансах) через толпу защитников.не то чтобы это все плохо,просто этого много.хотелось бы поменьше случайностей.

угловые.почти всегда это гол.даже при розыгрыше.а уж если есть игрок с прокаченым перком "кленовый лист",то это стопроцентный гол.конечно у вратаря может быть антикленовый перк "игра на выходах",но учитывая что каждому игроку перки даются рандомно(всего 2),то "игры на выходах" среди них с большой вероятностью может не оказаться.я сам использовал игрока с "кленовым листом" и за примерно три десятка попыток один раз только и не забил.

далее.скил и тактика.баланса практически нет.можно сколь угодно мудро выстраивать оборону и сколь угодно хитро выводить нападающих на удобный удар,но скиловый нападающий с центра поля или от самой бровки легко пробьет вашу оборону,а скиловый вратарь отразит любую атаку ваших нападающих.получается,что смысла в тактических перемещениях мало.проще положиться на рандом,о котором говорилось выше.в качестве примера:умышленно слился в лигу рангом ниже.и весь сезон даже не парился над тактикой.просто бил по воротам когда была такая возможность.защита с вратарем сами тащили все что летело в мои ворота.итог: выграная в одну калитку лига и кубок.

наверно по всему выше сказаному можно сделать вывод,что игра так себе.это не так.вобще не так.напротив игра затягивает похлеще иной трясины.интересная,с классной задумкой и ОГРОМНЫМ потенциалом.рекомендую :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198077811789', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 9237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 878, 'last_played': 1597783153}
review: Rly good game altho it seems rly simple. Some RNG thrills in it can help u write a brilliant underdog story, altho most times the team with the better stats will win. Its rly fast paced and has that "one more match" vibe to it which had me finishing a whole season in a day.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086888376', 'num_games_owned': 172, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 1878, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1236, 'last_played': 1449282308}
review: This game is a strategy soccer game mixed with football (soccer) manager. Really fun to play as it let you customize your team, players, abilities and so on. I highly recommend it for any football (soccer) fan and strategu games fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015919656', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 727, 'last_played': 1528653610}
review:
Здавалося б, як можна грати у покроковий футбол? Як виявилось, дуже навіть можна! У грі є майже все, що необхідно футбольному менеджеру, а самі матчі є якраз найцікавішим його елементом. З впевненістю можу сказати, що гра сподобалась.

Так як гра в ранньому доступі, то є деякі пропозиції:
 [*]ще збільшити тривалість матчу
 [*]ввести аути (наприклаж після неточного навісу на гравця біля бровки), з розстановкою гравців, як на кутових
 [*]гравця з м"ячем під сильним пресингом (коли стати понижуються майже до 1) заставляти спочатку виходити з під пресингу, а вже потім давати можливість робити пас/навіс і т.п.
 [*]в режим навчання додати приклад використання спеціальних навичок

А, ну і ще треба додати дівчат :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198039675617', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 20766, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1684, 'last_played': 1628517751}
review: unmatched and brilliant game, but has a repulsive design

author: {'steamid': '76561198117479291', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3853, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1336, 'last_played': 1643090852}
review: O Brasil é o país do futebol. Estamos acostumados com jogos de simulação como PES e FIFA, mas Football Tactics nos traz outra forma de nos dirvertirmos jogando. Aqui você usa estratégia e RPG para se tornar o melhor treinador. Excelente jogo e muita diversão por pouco custo. Eu recomendo!

author: {'steamid': '76561198054368205', 'num_games_owned': 773, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 1413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1691859922}
review:
Supergol de Marca.
Si te suena esto de algo, este juego es muuuuy parecido, asi que ponlo en el radar.
Si no te suena, es un juego tactico por turnos sencillo pero con añadidos de gestión del clud a lo largo de temporadas para ir poco a poco mejorandolo todo, aunque la chicha son los partidos.

Muy recomendable si el futbol y el género te atraen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994438689', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 9494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3776, 'last_played': 1617397568}
review:
Простой в освоении геймплей, понятный туториал, в то же время, перед каждым матчем приходиться поработать мозгами, чтобы найти слабые и сильные стороны соперника, чтобы основываясь на этом оптимально выстроить своих игроков. Особая тема - трансферное окно, где требуется решать судьбу каждого игрока + анализ спика трансферов. В то же время, на поле присутсвует элемент случайности, тебе может как повезти, так и наоборот. Всё это больше всего похоже на игру в покер, как мне показалось, только плюс ко всему, у вас нет ограничения по времени на ваш ход.
   Так что любителям не спеша подумать и испытать удачу однозначно рекомендую!

author: {'steamid': '76561198005836778', 'num_games_owned': 1128, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 7795, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4313, 'last_played': 1653140532}
review:
Nice little gem, when you like football, a bit of management and RPG elements and turn based tactical games.
The game isn't perfect (yet), but it is so addictive and fun to play, that I'm very enjoying playing this game. It has multiple leagues (so promotion and relegation), and cup games. You can invest in your club and in your players, and buy or sell players on the market. 

It's also nice that this game has kinda realistic results. You can win or lose from teams that are bigger or smaller then you. Besides player stats and special skills, luck is also a factor in this game. Also, you don't have to manage your team in the game, you can let the AI play for you, which does most of the time well (but definitely has it flaws), or when you already ''owned'' the league (by promotion or winning the title) you can also simulate the match. Did it 1 time. Lost with 0-3 from a team 4 places below me and 1 star lower quality than my team. Didn't used that option after that again.

Would I recommend this game? Hell yeah!

author: {'steamid': '76561198003290591', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1535270770}
review:
Approche intéressante et rare du jeu de football. Il vous met à la place d'un manager qui commence avec une petite équipe et qui va essayer de la porter vers la consécration ultime. 

L'approche tactique est bien faite et la gestin de l'épique force à faire des choix sur l'évolution du club. 

Les devs continus a travailler dessus pour l'améliorer et ca c'est bon :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198110453601', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 980, 'last_played': 1629929862}
review:
Bon c'est ma première recommandation donc soyez pas trop severe 
Nous avons là un jeu de foot assez realiste ...enfin pas niveau grafisme mais pour le reste.
differentes ligues a gravir et non vous ne pourrez pas passer d'amateur à champion de L1 en 4 saisons 
jeu parfois frustrant ( et oui quand ton equipe toute pourrie affronte les grosses pointure ça finit en 4,5,6 à 0 
mais apres quelques saisons on commence à bien se debouiller

les +
1) un match dure en moyenne 10' donc assez rapide 
2) prise en main très rapide
3) un controle total du club 

les -
1) graphiquement proche des Mii de la Wii( donc très laid) 
2) TRES FRUSTANT...de ne pas comprendre pourquoi tel ou tel stat augmente alors qu'on entraine nos joueurs sur d'autre

voila
donc bon jeu si vous avez que 10' le soir ça passe bien

author: {'steamid': '76561197999459739', 'num_games_owned': 1127, 'num_reviews': 548, 'playtime_forever': 14139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3077, 'last_played': 1676108199}
review:
This game is seriously addicting. I like football, I like team management and I like chess. The strategy and management may be simplistic but it is highly addictive.

Now they have gone and added even more customization and that really seals it, this game is just terrific.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057815250', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 2599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1678340331}
review:
RNG is even more biased against player than X-Com could ever HOPE to be.
The "less randomness" setting causes you to throw only super low or super high, actually increasing randomness ;p
The more randomness setting means enemies have less chance actually however the game still hold super-obvious anti-player bias when throwing thus as all the randomness settings are pointless.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032204304', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7642, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1422, 'last_played': 1618194808}

author: {'steamid': '76561198059921609', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 5028, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 840, 'last_played': 1594779367}
review: Ich kannte diese Form des Fußball-Managers zuvor nicht wirklich. Da es eine Demo-Version gibt, probierte ich es gleich aus - und war begeistert. Es ist zugegebenermaßen relativ einfach gehalten, es macht aber Spaß im Laufe der Zeit die Tiefe des Spiels zu erfassen. Und es ist ja auch noch in der Entwicklung und wird regelmäßig geupdatet. Das Spiel ist eine Art Mischung aus rundenbasiertem Spiel und Fußball-Manager, das sehr gut gelungen ist. Für mich auf jeden Fall eine Empfehlung wert.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975673062', 'num_games_owned': 849, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 162965, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14210, 'last_played': 1709614655}
review:
Its more than 2 years later. Time for a small update to my review! I'll keep the old one below, as a reminder to myself some game developers actually know what they're doing when improving a title beyond its initial promise.

First off, the turn based tactics is still key to the enjoyment. Somehow they've made it really work for a title like this, and I re-iterate how fresh it feels to the stale and frustrating 3D animations of other series. The fact that you get to play out your formation and choice tactically through the game day is so much fun, and this game has all other game beat when it comes to depth. You'll get the actual calculations, you'll understand why you concede and score goal, and you'll probably not feel like the game is unfairly punishing you without explanation when you suddenly trip out in a 1-5 defeat after a series of wins.

It's just sooooo much better than a certain other title. If you enjoy chess or X-Com or Civilization or just any form of turn based tactics you can't go wrong with this. I would even say you don't even need to enjoy "soccer". The abstraction of the match day into pieces on a chess board with limitations to actions and movement, is enjoyable for anyone with heart for tactics. This title gets two thumbs up from this "PC-masterrace guy" and I hereby lift the "embargo" on it as being a mobile phone title. It really isn't anymore. 2 years of improvements and the inclusion of more tactical choices and speciality classes, have brought the match engine to a state of near perfection.

Updated con/pro list:

Pros:
-Game expands its mechanics as you play, so it will never feel overwhelming for a new player
-Rewarding skill progression on players
-Surprisingly decent animations and overall aestethics
-2017: match engine depth. Tactics feel really rewarding, and you can go full Magnus Carlsen on the game and be rewarded for it. You'll start losing "easy" matches if you think you'll cakewalk thru' anyone.
-2017: Its actually as fun to be struggling as it is to be a top team.
-2017: The RNG factor is on the money.(its minimal) I've never felt arbitrarily punished in this game after the latest updates. 
-Has that "just one more turn" feeling which all good turn-based games need.
-2017: The AI is tough to the point of perfection. Its hard to make it trip up.

Cons:
-Lack PC-gaming masterrace depth. (the 20+ years of headstart from the CM/Football Manager series when it comes to Transfer Market, Player Database, Stats, News, Random events, etc... Basically this game has all that CM/Football Manager does wrong right, and vice versa. Often to no fault of their own.)
2017 update: Still applies, there's some basic functions, but this game is still all about match day. But at least you can finish a season in one sitting.

-Matches feel a bit "short" or like your managing a little league game. 
2017 update: No longer applies. There's a setting now to increase length. I'm at the point where I wish that was even longer, but thats just me being greedy. They've managed to get the game to a point where even with extra turns for each half, that doesn't mean you'll get insane results. I still wind up in 2-1 wins and 0-1 defeats.

-Tactics might feel gimmicky if you are looking for realism. 
2017: They do indeed. But this is just a con if you despise chess or turn based gaming. 

-2017 con: Hard mode isn't balanced yet. 
-2017 con: Game still looks like a mobile phone game in its presentation. Which is fine for now, but if they want a sequel, they need to rework the UI.
***

2015 original review:
So I usually despise iOS games being sold over steam since Im PC-Masterrace.
I also despise the modern gaming industry for pandering to the lowest common denominator when it comes to game complexity
The last game I gave a passing grade in modern times was Mount and Blade:Warband(I was tempted to say Jagged Alliance 1.13...)
I've played Championship Manager since the 93/94 version on glorious MS-DOS, and I've despised that series since 2003, mostly due to the fact that it gives no proper feedback anymore to whether you won or lost due to player intervention or just hidden RNG mechanics. (that is actually hardwired to f*** you over to no fault of your own if you get a winning streak)

I friggin' LOVE THIS GAME. Sure, its iOS, sure its modern gaming developers, but it actually got working complexity hidden beneath its shell.
Oh, and ofcourse its actually more rewarding to play than any of the modern Football Manager iterations, which has lost all its gaming appeal. Why this is? Because the game will actually reward and show you that YOUR changes actually made a difference in the game.

Turn based mechanics is the way to go for football managers, since Eidos/EA or whoever shitcompany is making that crap series doesn't realize that they are making a football manager GAME, not a football match simulator where every aspect of the gaming mechanics is hidden under the hood for nobody to ever see.

Pros:
-Game expands its mechanics as you play, so it will never feel overwhelming for a new player
-Rewarding skill progression on players
-Surprisingly decent animations and overall aestethics
-Has that "just one more turn" feeling which all good turn-based games need.

Cons:
-Lack PC-gaming masterrace depth. (the 20+ years of headstart from the CM/Football Manager series when it comes to Transfer Market, Player Database, Stats, News, Random events, etc... Basically this game has all that CM/Football Manager does wrong right, and vice versa. Often to no fault of their own.)
-Matches feel a bit "short" or like your managing a little league game.
-Tactics might feel gimmicky if you are looking for realism.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050026698', 'num_games_owned': 51, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 737, 'last_played': 1635430825}

author: {'steamid': '76561198081587918', 'num_games_owned': 179, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3810, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 612, 'last_played': 1692476948}
review: A very fun and addictive game that has far more depth than it might seem at first glance. However I'd like to warn those people who are looking for a classic sports game - Football Tactics is not at all like this. It's more of a puzzle/strategy game set in the football world. If you're into this kind of games, don't hesitate and buy Football Tactics right now. You won't be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006365269', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 930, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 616, 'last_played': 1527932042}
review: althrough more like a ipad game, still better than football manager

author: {'steamid': '76561197993779145', 'num_games_owned': 603, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 4112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2212, 'last_played': 1514554516}
review:
As a decade and a half long Football Manager player, this game does requires some adjustments in terms of how you understand football.

Forget what you know about the classic formations, this will require something else. This is to the FM series what Blood Bowl would be to a NFL Manager game. 

Gameplay is pretty simple, but there's a bit of depth to the strategies, which is nice. 
Like anything that contains dice rolls, it can be frustrating at times when you have a great striker in the perfect position, which huge advantage, and he rolls a one out of 56, squandering the chance away. 

Still, early access, the devs are hard at working improving the game, and I can see this becoming a great title.

Recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979029123', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 671, 'last_played': 1449082863}
review: It's a small but fun turn based sports simulation. Sort of like Blood Bowl ultra light, single player. It's fun but I don't know how much staying power it will have without multiplayer, and honestly, I suspect multiplayer would have severe balance issues with the current ruleset. Having said that, it's enjoyable and addictive this early in, so if the price is right for you, I'd say go for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001325367', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 74879, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 660, 'playtime_at_review': 405, 'last_played': 1711966241}
review:
I posted a review for this game back in 15. At the time it was my 2nd written review ever (1st on steam), my other was a review for High Heat Baseball 2000 on the epinions site back in 02/03. So early on I valued this game and it's developers.

After that initial review I think I took a two year break from steam. My mom got sick and I just had other priorities. On my return I couldn't believe the progress FTG had made during my absence. I was thinking for the amount of progress made most other games would have re-titled it with no further updates being made to original game. Not FTG.

I dont keep up with developers like many do. I dont know KOS from Adam but I have the utmost respect for anyone involved in my FTG experience. I've had steam since 08 and FTG leads my entire 300+ game library. The only title I have with over 1,000 game hours.

I was glad to see FTG make it to the console. I purchased the PS4 version and was amazed at the ease of using controller when I am so used to playing keyboard.

I am so thankful for FTG giving me an alternative to "the other game". It has long since been buried and forgotten.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035583168', 'num_games_owned': 468, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 3915, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 669, 'last_played': 1666863076}
review:
This game is what would be born if Football Manager and Chess met in a bar, started a relationship, got married and had kids.

In all seriousness though, the game is an absolute joy to play, the developers have a long history of updates with true content and features and the community on discord is amazing.

I highly recommend the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130268469', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 1373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1284, 'last_played': 1532625042}
review:
Simple, Intuitive. Like XCom + Soccer.

This IS NOT some simple facebook game. It has enough depth and strategy to actually keep you entertained and addicted.
It's actually pretty fun!


Suggestion:
Perhaps make each half of the match 1 turn more? Or at least give this option?

author: {'steamid': '76561197971079985', 'num_games_owned': 620, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 13058, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1830, 'last_played': 1696026512}
review:
Very cool game where you incorporate and then manage a soccer team from a grass-roots amateur club to a world class Premier League team. The management aspects of the game are simplified in contrast to simulation games that focus on that aspect alone, yet the experience is engaging and addictive. Games play out over the course of just a few minutes. These involve manipulating players in a turn based strategic mini-game where decision making, player stats and good old fashioned RNG dictate outcomes in equal part.

Just one more turn/game/season. Minutes turn into hours. Very clever game.

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198046331252', 'num_games_owned': 262, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 3333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 666, 'last_played': 1616724681}
review: Do you like Football Manager for deep management simulation, but wish there was a (much) simpler option? Do you like playing soccer games, like FIFA, but wish you could focus more on strategy rather than execution? If so, you'll probably enjoy this game. I love it! I wish it had more stat-tracking and history (e.g., career stats, hall of fame), but I think some of that will come in the future. As-is, it's a ton of fun, as long as you like your sports games heavier on strategy and light on graphics, action. When playing it, I feel like I'm playing a game of chess with my opponent. Moving players without the ball, luring defenders out of position, holding the ball and running out time. Except for the first league you start it, you won't win much by simply poundng the ball forward and shooting. You have to use trickery and deception to get your opponent to make a mistake and allow you a clear opportunity at goal. I recommend this game even in its early access form. I can't wait to see what the developers add in the future!

author: {'steamid': '76561198073146772', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 23616, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2565, 'last_played': 1710503779}
review:
Очень неплохая идея - объединить футбольный менеджер с пошаговым симулятором матчей. Давно искал подобную игру, и эта оправдала большую часть надежд. Те, кто знает, что такое футбол, футбольные тактики и т.п. найдут очень много параллелей с реальностью. В игре присутствует довольно не плохое тактическое разнообразие, хотя и хочется еще большего)
Из минусов - на мой вкус, матч коротковат по количеству ходов, хотя при подавляющем перевесе можно достичь и счета 6-0 (у меня есть один такой матч).
На мой вкус, слишком большой бонус вратарской площадки, сильного вратаря обыграть очень сложно. В общем, есть некоторые шероховатости балланса, а в целом - очень не плохо.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970635339', 'num_games_owned': 867, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 5947, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1502, 'last_played': 1636406736}
review:
Great casual game!

Feels surprisingly much like the real thing, basic foot-to-ball tactics and last-minute match-winning goals included. Mechanics include just enough chance to keep up the suspense but never feel unfair or random.

You can customize your team, the experience progression makes you care for them and then you sell your best players for outrageously high amounts of money ;)

The old football manager just-one-more-match-itch is very much there...

It's still in Early Access though, so expect some (minor) issues: The most annoying thing I found was that the indicators for the outcome of a turn would show before the players actually moved on the pitch, thus killing the suspense of watching them. Though once you've gotten the hang of the mechanics and attributes you can toggle the indicators off in the options.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974947876', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 6420, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1880, 'last_played': 1689366527}
review:
Simple but excellent - surprisingly deep game!

Give it a try - 100% recommendation!

author: {'steamid': '76561198058371343', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 919, 'last_played': 1545683962}
review: Has a lot more depth than I'd expected.  Gameplay is great fun and progressing from the amateur league to the Premier league takes a long time.  English grammar could be improved in a few places, but otherwise this is a great game all round.  The clever mix of football with turn-based RPG like gameplay is a surprisingly good combination.  Before full release would like to see a few more game modes added.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050016554', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 517, 'playtime_forever': 6859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1748, 'last_played': 1529500273}
review:
Malgré toutes ses qualités, et il en a suffisament pour que j'ai insisté sur plusieurs saisons, ce jeu ne m'a pas convaincu.

Malheureusement la première impression est assez mauvaise et je crains que de nombreux joueurs n'aillent pas assez loin pour voir le contenu réel du jeu et ses subtilités. En effet on démarre avec une équipe amateur dont les joueurs sont faibles et sans compétence et le budget ridicule. Ce qui fait que, d'une part, les matches qui se jouent par suite de 3 coups, se résument à un genre de baby-foot sans autre technique que 2 passes et boum, d'autre part cela prend un temps fou de développer le club avec des outils de mnagement hyper-simplifiés. Le marché des transfert est un  simple achat-vente sur un choix limité et imposé, les entrainements sont quasi-inutiles puisque les joueurs progressent dramatiquement peu dans les premières divisions. Concrètement il faut 4 ou 5 saisons pour s'apercevoir que c'est beaucoup plus élaboré que ça en a l'air :
- même si on reste loin du vrai football, le moteur de match offre quelques actions type comme les corners et les coup-francs,
- la valeur des joueurs dépend de leur utilisation,
- on peut recruter des staffs qui améliorent la liste de transfert et l'entrainement
- les joueurs ont des capacités spéciales, petit pont ou interception par exemple, qui permettent de gagner un coup supplémentaire,
- la fatigue et la récupération sont prises en compte,
- les joueurs ont peu de caractéristiques et à priori une seule est critique pour chaque poste mais en réalité définir notre style de jeu va demander des joueurs complémentaires et/ou polyvalents,
- la renommée acquise permet de d'attirer de meilleur staff, de prolonger des joueurs en fin de carrière, de les aider à apprendre des compétences.

On s'aperçoit donc à l'usage que Football Tactics est beaucoup plus sophistiqué qu'il n'y parait au premier abord.

Mais, mais... tout celà implique de longues heures à monter les divisions et la nécéssité de faire les bons choix de développement du club sous peine de galèrer encore plus longtemps. Et c'est là la faiblesse du jeu par rapport à ce que j'en attendais. A ne pas vraiment choisir entre la tactique et le management, on a un produit un peu bâtard qui n'est vraiment bon ni dans un domaine ni dans l'autre et qui demande un investissement temps disproportionné par rapport à ce que son look d'appli smarphone laissait augurer. 
en bref, ce qui m'a vraiment déplu :
- le management bien qu'abordant de nombreux domaines est simplifié au point qu'il n'a plus rien d'immersif,
- la tactique est frustrantre parce que le peu d'actions possibles fait qu'au final on a plus l'impression de gagner ou perdre sur les tirages que sur notre façon de jouer,
- on n'a aucun contrôle sur ce que l'on va recruter : que ce soit les jeunes (vous pouvez tirez plusieurs gardiens d'affilée, qui plus est avec des compétences d'avant-centre ou de milieux), ou la liste des transferts que le staff établit comme bon lui semble, il n'y a aucun moyen de chercher un joueur au profil précis.
- la logique du "seuls ceux qui jouent s'améliorent" est poussé à l'extrème sur ce jeu, les choix d'entrainement ne servent qu'à orienter les gains en match, si vous voulez former des jeunes faites les jouer ! Bon ce n'est pas trop pénalisant dans l'absolu puisque, vu le moteur de match, il suffit d'avoir 1 ou 2 bons joueurs par ligne mais ça ne me plait pas.

Edit : depuis la rédaction de cette évaluation le jeu a un peu évolué et offre désormais plusieurs slots de sauvegarde => paragraphe correspondant supprimé. Je maintiens cependant l'évaluation négative, avec du recul ce jeu me parait vraiment très loin du foot et finallement assez pauvre tactiquement comme stratégiquement en regard de son prix (surtout qu'il semble s'éterniser en EA).

author: {'steamid': '76561198003030375', 'num_games_owned': 3129, 'num_reviews': 773, 'playtime_forever': 1284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1202, 'last_played': 1597331408}
review:
[quote][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/6142328/][b]Like this Review? Follow The Cpt Froggy Club Curator Page for plenty more![/b][/url][/quote]

Football Tactics:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~
   
Always wanted to find out how the top coaches made it all the way to the Premier League? Well, don’t look further, they are all playing Football Tactics!!

Football Tactics is a football manager game using a turn-based system during match day which gives this game its originality.

First you will have to choose which team and in which country you will be playing. Then, the Amateur League will start. This league is realistically a tutorial and will help you to understand how to play the game and you will probably find it quite easy. As soon as you move up to the next league, the difficulty will increase straight away and you will be facing tougher opponents. In total, you have 5 leagues and 2 cups to play in and the aim is to reach and win the Premier League and the Cups, of course.

The management aspect of the game has good depth but it is easy to use and understand. I really like it that way. You can . . . upgrade your stadium to get more attendance and revenue, upgrade your youth academy so you can find better young talents, purchase new players during the transfer window, get specific coaches and assistants so your players improve their skills (but you will need prestige points). How do you get prestige points, you may ask? Really simple, if the goal difference is  1 in your favour then you will get 1 prestige point. If you manage to finish the season in the top 3 teams, you will be rewarded with additional prestige points. 

Match day – Each half will consist of 24 action moves to be used between each team, with a total of 48 moves per match. Remember, you and your opponent will use 3 action moves per turn. They are plenty of moves to make your mark and score goals. At the end of each match, your player will get experience points which in turn will help them to reach a higher level. If you win, you’ll get higher experience points. 

The graphics are smooth and polished and the game runs well. This game is an early access and it is very impressive so far. Please bring on the full version, I can’t wait!

Positives:
~~~~~~~   

-	Good and easy Football Management 
-	Turn-based match day
-	Really fun to play
-	Addictive and challenging
-	Plenty of achievements

Negative:
~~~~~~~ 

-	No trading cards

9/10 

Key provided by the developer/publisher for review purposes. Any opinions expressed are entirely my own!

[url=https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCZchpsMdA2hDYJKZgOPdo_w?view_as=subscriber][b]SUBSCRIBE TO THE CPT FROGGY YOUTUBE CHANNEL[/b][/url][/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561197971006392', 'num_games_owned': 1181, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 585, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 327, 'last_played': 1532374446}
review:
Nice idea with a lot of potential, sadly the game at the current state is really one-dimensional and gets boring within an hour. There's no real tactics/strategy, it's all based on luck, and the 3-turn-per-round-rule doesn't allow for anything fancy at all. Plus, as every action takes up minutes, you arithmetically can't win higher than like 3-0, maybe 4-0 if you are really lucky. No real surprises in the game, and nothing that would make you log back in again. - While I gladly gave my $15 for the nice idea and maybe something better in the future, I really can't recommend this game at all to anybody else.

[Edit:] I appreciate the developers answering negative feedbacks/recommendations. While I played the game a tiny bit longer now, I still feel that (a) match times are not long enough, and (b) actions always seem to consume the same amount if game time - I think the game would benefit highly from making actions using up time in certain ranges, aka 1-5 minutes, this would also give some games the feeling of lasting "forever" and others to be rather short - just like in real ilfe. :) - Anyways, for the polite and professional answer I change my recommendation, although I personally do not think this will be my next "big love". Good luck to you guys though!
developer_response:
We did Amateau league very easy to make people understand the basic game rules. But the tactics appears in the higher leagues when your opponents are stronger but you have footballers with skills. Here's, for example, what one of our players wrote on the forum: http://steamcommunity.com/app/375530/discussions/0/527274088403961368/#c527274088404658608

So consider, please, playing longer. I see that in general after 4-5 hours of playing players start understanding the tactics. 

We, from our side, will think how to show the tactical potential of the game right from the beginning.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048707951', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 420, 'last_played': 1475569314}
review:
I really bloody love this game! Someone described it as 'chess but on a pitch' and I think that's pretty accurate. Although I'm absolutely shite at chess I seem to be alright at this, so you obviously have to be much smarter for Football Tactics ;)


There's only one little glitch I can't seem to shake around at the moment. My starting line up has 12 players in it, but one of them is marked as a reserve, and it's meaning I start each match with two players in one forwards position. It doesn't seem to affect my gameplay too much but it's terribly annoying. It happened after I tried to make a transfer and the game crashed. Upon reloading this little glitch was stuck. Sad times :(

Like I say - fix that glitch and I won't have a complaint so far!
developer_response:
Hey! We are really glad you like the game!

Regarding your glitch. If you want to continue your campaign, send me your save to kos @ creoteam . com 

We will try to fix it and send back.

Or you can switch to Beta (where most of the bugs are fixed): http://steamcommunity.com/app/375530/discussions/0/598198356180416286/

In Beta I'd suggest you to start a new campaign.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992295019', 'num_games_owned': 1488, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1522817692}
review:
This game is very interesting and has a lot of potential behind it. The game itself is very fun and feels competitive. I look forward to the multiplayer aspect very much. However this game currently feels like a multiplayer aspect oriented game with single player tacked on as an afterthought. The single player campaign is far too slow for my liking because you need to play every match. While that is fine for the first few matches, it quickly grows old. A simulation feature would make this much better. In adition a fix to the black borders on the edges or at the very least an actual windowed mode would make this game look much better,
As it is I recommend this game due to its creative premise and a potential that seems very achievable, however do not expect Football Manager-esque gameplay or depth just yet. I also cannot see myself playing this game for hours on end. I would be surprised if I play this again before they update with new features.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039545673', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5870, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2275, 'last_played': 1669550579}
